Argument 1 should be the title of the page (all lowercase, no spaces), and argument 2 should be the formal name. Be sure to check if identity has already been claimed before linking to this passage, otherwise it could cause duplicates. */ <<widget "addidentity">> <<set $identity.unshift($args[0])>> <<print "<<flash 'New Identity: " + $args[1] + "'>><</flash>>">> <</widget>> /* Identity Definitions */<h3>Devotee</h3>\ You venerate The Lady Death, whose loving embrace will bring us all into the end-times when our brains stop working and we succcumb to her will. While you're alive, offerings to her at your altar can perhaps grant you luck, love, and happiness- or skill bonuses. <hr>\ /* Perk: Make offerings at altar in exchange for a bonus in one stat (you will keep that bonus until you choose a different one). Drawback: No offerings can be made until you've completed the altar lead. IMPLEMENTED */<h3>Merc</h3>\ You've worked most of your adult life as a gun for hire, taking gigs as a body guard and scavenger. Maybe even taken a few lives. <<if Flag("BrokenOath")>>People know you're not reliable, though- your reputation isn't good enough to earn you anything.<<else>>You know how to get work, never have to roll to get a gig, and can negotiate better pay. However, you're also bound by your word- if you back out on a job, or fail, you lose this perk.<</if>> <hr>\ /* Perk: Whenever you attempt to convince someone to give you a gig, you do not need to roll for it. One small payment counts as two small payments. Drawback: This identity will be removed from your list if you fail a gig or back out of one. IMPLEMENTED */<h3>Genderfuck</h3>\ You've immediately taken to Signal Hill's underground culture of genderfuckery. Wherever you've seen it, you're drawn in. You might be looked down upon by some traditionalists, but your people will recognize and support you. Oh, and you'll be hot as hell. <hr>\ /* Perk: People who are similarly genderfucky will get a bonus to liking you, and you'll get advantage when rolling Glam if the intent is to be sexy. Drawback: "Traditionalists" won't be crazy about you. IMPLEMENTED */<h3>Sex Worker</h3>\ There are plenty of ways to make money in this city, but between killing, scavenging the wastes, or rotting in a factory, you figure the most pleasant option is selling sex. You just might have to deal with people being fucking weird about it. Oh, and YVette's gonna be your boss. <hr>\ /* Perk: Work at the Rose and Thorn to gain some extra cash, although you'll need to succeed on a glam roll to entice a customer to hire you. Drawback: Yvette will be your boss. Oh no. */<h3>Hedonist</h3>\ Getting blackout drunk, dancing to the latest glitch-pop record, having (arguably) too much sex with people you just met. Some people would call you a wild child. You've done everything under the sun, so you can function better on drugs. But if you get bored? Prepare for the worst. <hr>\ /* Perk: You bigger bonuses when you use drugs, and don't recieve a negative for it. Drawback: You get a negative bonus when you're in a particularly boring environment. IMPLEMENTED */<h3>Augur</h3>\ You've secluded yourself in the shadows, pursuing the secrets of the world in the deep recesses of the temple. You know how to find meaning in the static, and you can divine the future at your altar. But holding such power will take its toll- having been ascetic for so long, this place (and society in general) has been a culture shock. <hr>\ /* Perk: On top of making an offering, you can divine the future at your altar. Drawback: People will generally think you're super weird, and you might act kind of weird. */<h3>Medic</h3>\ Working back home as a volunteer emergency medic, you've handled your fair share of medical emergencies. You've patched up gunshots to the lungs, lost limbs, and animal maulings (with various degrees of success). Using your med kit to patch yourself up after an injury is no big deal. Oh, and you might find it easier to relate with other physicians. <hr>\ /* Perk: You can immediately patch up your injuries with a med kit, no need to visit the doctor. You can also patch up injured people you encounter in stories. Drawback: None. IMPLEMENTED */<h3>Nomad</h3>\ You've lived your whole life as a wanderer. As soon as you could walk you were wandering, and as soon as you could get a job you were being paid for it. You've seen everywhere from the Golden Coast to the mountains of Hudson County, and you have tales to tell about all of it. <hr>\ /* Perk: The PC has travelled widely and can discuss their travels with others. This is a purely narrative perk. Drawback: None. */<h3>Machinist</h3>\ Tech just speaks to you. Its whirring in your ears is like your own mama's voice, and the warmth of its engines swaddles you. No wonder you've spent so long working with it, nurturing it, cradling it. With your level of experience, you'll be able to get far more out of your tech than others can. <hr>\ /* Perk: Batteries last twice as long, and you get a bonus to any roll involving machines. You may also get MYSTICAL opportunities with tech. Drawback: There kinda isn't one, it's just not that useful lol. IMPLEMENTED */<h3>Social Climber</h3>\ You're going places, man. You're //going places//. The glitz and the glamour, that's all gonna be yours, baby. The rich might not be any more friendly, but boy would you be willing to do some wild shit to get on their level. <hr>\ /* Perk: You get the opportunity to do some absolutely wild shit to get on the good side of rich people. Drawback: It's not necessarily going to... y'know... work out. */<h3>Socialist</h3>\ You aren't 100% sure what the governmental structure of Signal Hill is, but whatever it is, it's clearly not working. Somebody really needs to enforce sweeping changes to deal with the rampant poverty here. Somebody like you, perhaps? You've read a book or two, and you have plenty of ideas. <hr>\ /* Perk: You can relate more with the common man by discussing your progressive politics with them, and you might get the chance to get involved in some "community action." Drawback: Rich people will like you less if you start spouting commie garbage. */<h3>Gun Nut</h3>\ Placeholder <hr>\<h3>New Look</h3>\ Placeholder <hr>\<h3>Leather</h3>\ Placeholder <hr>\/* Add one level to the current wealth score */ /* Use: Argument 1 should be "small" or "large." A large payout will add 1 to Wealth, to a limit of 5. A small payout will add 1 to the Wealth counter, which will turn to 1 Wealth when equal to the current amount of Wealth. */ <<widget "addwealth">> <<if $args[0] == "large">> <<set $wealth += 1>> <<if $wealth lt 6>> <<print "<<flash '+1 Wealth (" + $wealth + ")'>><</flash>>">> <</if>> <<elseif $args[0] == "small">> <<if $identity.includes("merc")>> <<if not Flag("BrokenOath")>> <<set $wealthprogress += 2>> <<else>> <<set $wealthprogress += 1>> <</if>> <<else>> <<set $wealthprogress += 1>> <</if>> <<if $wealthprogress gte $wealth>> <<set $wealth += 1>> <<set $wealthprogress = 0>> <<if $wealth lt 6>> <<print "<<flash '+1 Wealth (" + $wealth + ")'>><</flash>>">> <</if>> <</if>> <</if>> <<if $wealth == 6>> <<set $wealth = 5>> <</if>> <</widget>> <<widget "spendwealth">> <<if $wealth == $args[0]>> <<set $wealth -= 1>> <<print "<<flash '-1 Wealth (" + $wealth + ")'>><</flash>>">> <</if>> <</widget>> <<widget "removewealth">> <<set $wealth -= 1>> <<print "<<flash '-1 Wealth (" + $wealth + ")'>><</flash>>">> <</widget>> <<widget "buyitem">> <<transfer $args[0] $pocket $args[1] 1>> <</widget>> <<widget "gamble">> <<if $bet == "petty">> <<set $roll = random(1, 10)>> <<if $roll gt 5>> <<set $win = "win">> <<else>> <<set $win = "loss">> <</if>> <<elseif $bet == "wealth">> <<set $roll = random(1, 20)>> <<if $wealth == 1 or $wealth == 2>> <<if $roll gt 16>> <<set $win = "win">> <<elseif $roll lt 10>> <<set $win = "loss">> <<else>> <<set $win = "even">> <</if>> <<elseif $wealth == 3 or $wealth == 4>> <<if $roll gt 19>> <<set $win = "win">> <<elseif $roll lt 14>> <<set $win = "loss">> <<else>> <<set $win = "even">> <</if>> <</if>> <</if>> <<unset $roll>> <<set $gambled = true>> <<if $win == "win">> <<goto "Slots Win">> <<elseif $win == "even">> <<goto "Slots Even">> <<else>> <<goto "Slots Loss">> <</if>> <</widget>>/* Add an item to the player's pocket for free */ /* Use: Argument 1 should be the item's display name, and argument 2 should be the number of items to pick up. */ <<widget "pocket">> <<print "<<flash '+" + $args[0] + "'>><</flash>>">> <<pickup $pocket $args[0] $args[1]>> <</widget>><<widget "cassettebattery">> <<set $cassettebattery += 1>> <<if $identity.includes("machinist")>> <<if $cassettebattery == 12>> <<set $cassettebattery = 0>> <<pickup $pocket "Empty Battery" 1>> <</if>> <<else>> <<if $cassettebattery == 6>> <<set $cassettebattery = 0>> <<pickup $pocket "Empty Battery" 1>> <</if>> <</if>> <<update>> <</widget>> <<widget "lpbattery">> <<set $lpbattery += 1>> <<if $identity.includes("machinist")>> <<if $lpbattery == 12>> <<set $lpbattery = 0>> <<pickup $pocket "Empty Battery" 1>> <</if>> <<else>> <<if $lpbattery == 6>> <<set $lpbattery = 0>> <<pickup $pocket "Empty Battery" 3>> <</if>> <</if>> <<goto $apartment>> <</widget>> <<widget "cdbattery">> <<set $cdbattery += 1>> <<if $identity.includes("machinist")>> <<if $cdbattery == 12>> <<set $cdbattery = 0>> <<pickup $pocket "Empty Battery" 1>> <</if>> <<else>> <<if $cdbattery == 6>> <<set $cdbattery = 0>> <<pickup $pocket "Empty Battery" 2>> <</if>> <</if>> <<update>> <</widget>>/* Buy an item from the store */ /* Use: Argument 1 should be the store it's being bought from, and argument 2 should be the item ID. Example: <<buy "$store1" "tank_top">> */ <<widget "buyclothes">> <<transfer $args[0] $wardrobe $args[1] 1>> <</widget>> /* Equip an item to your outfit */ /* Use: Argument 1 should be the item's type, argument 2 should be the item's ID. <<transfer $wardrobe $outfit $args[1] 1>> <</widget>> /* Save an outfit as a preset */ <<widget "saveslot1">> <<if $slot1.length gte 1>> <<dialog>> Are you sure you want to save over this slot? <<link "Yeah">><<dropall $slot1>><<merge $slot1 $outfit>><<update>><<dialogclose>><</link>>\ <</dialog>> <<else>> <<merge $slot1 $outfit>> <</if>> <</widget>> <<widget "saveslot2">> <<if $slot2.length gte <<widget "styletest">> <<set _handmadecount = 0>> <<set _practicalcount = 0>> <<set _punkcount = 0>> <<set _armouredcount = 0>> <<set _luxurycount = 0>> <<set _fetishcount = 0>> <<for _item range $outfit.array>> <<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("handmade")>> <<set _handmadecount +=1>> <</if>> <<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("practical")>> <<set _practicalcount +=1>> <</if>> <<if _practicalcount and _handmadecount gt _punkcount and _handmadecount gt _armouredcount and _handmadecount gt _luxurycount and _handmadecount gt _fetishcount>> <<set _result = "handmade">> <<elseif "practical">> <<elseif _punkcount gt _handmadecount and _punkcount gt _practicalcount and _punkcount gt _armouredcount and _punkcount gt _luxurycount and _punkcount gt _fetishcount>> <<set _result = _luxurycount>> <<set _result = "fetish">> <<else>> <<set _result = "none">> <</if>> <</widget>> /* Generates a random item of a specific style to allow NPCs to react to your outfit. margin-right: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; font-size: 4em"> $xp <div class="skillname"> XP </div> </div> <h1>Skill upgrade costs</h1> <div style="text-align: center"> ''-1 to 0'' costs 10XP<br> ''0 to 1'' costs 4XP<br> ''1 to 2'' costs 6XP<br> ''2 to 3'' costs 8XP </div> <br><hr> <h3>Weapon slots: $weaponslots<span style="text-align: right; float: right"><<link "+ (10XP)">><<weaponupgrade>><</link>></span></h3> <</liveblock>><h1><span style="float: left">[[<Back|$return]]</span>\ <span style="float: right">\ <<link "Gear">>\ <<replace "#gear">><<include "Inventory">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Weapons">>\ <<replace "#gear">><<include "Weapons">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Outfit">>\ <<replace "#gear">><<include "Outfit">><</replace>>\ <</link>></span></h1> <div id="gear"><<include "Inventory">></div><div style="overflow: auto"> <div class="skillbox" style="float: left; margin-right: 10px"> $wealth <div class="skillname"> <i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i> </div> </div> <div> <<switch $wealth>> <<case 0>> <p>You're impoverished. Penniless. Broke. You can barely scrounge up enough cash to survive.</p> <<case 1>> <p>You're pretty damn poor. Even the smallest purchase might bankrupt you.</p> <<case 2>> <p>You're not well off, but you've got enough to afford some small luxuries.</p> <<case 3>> <p>You're doing pretty well for yourself. You're not exactly rich, but you can afford to splurge.</p> <<case 4>> <p>You're finally making your way up the ladder! Money is no object most of the time.</p> <<case 5>> <p>You're at the top, baby! It doesn't get better than this!</p> <</switch>> </div> </div> <hr> <h1><<link "POCKET">><<replace "#inventory">><<include "Pocket">><</replace>><</link>> / <<link "MUSIC">><<replace "#inventory">><<include "Music">><</replace>><</link>> / <<link "COLLECTIBLES">><<replace "#inventory">><<include "Collectibles">><</replace>><</link>></h1> <div id="inventory"> <<include "Pocket">> </div><<liveblock>> <<for _item, _amount range $heldweapon.table>> <<print Item.get(_item).description>> <</for>> <<if $ownedweapons.length == 0>> You don't have any<<if not $heldweapon.length == 0>> other<</if>> weapons yet. <<else>> <<for _item, _amount range $ownedweapons.table>> <<capture _item>> /* Captures the _item variable to prevent it from being reset to last item */ <ul> <li style="text-transform: uppercase"> _item <span style="float: right"> <<link "Equip">> <<merge $ownedweapons $heldweapon>> /* Places current weapon into owned weapons */ <<dropall $heldweapon>> /* Empties the held weapon list */ <<transfer $ownedweapons $heldweapon _item 1>> /* Transfers the new item */ <<update>> <</link>> </span> </li> </ul> <</capture>> <</for>> <</if>> <</liveblock>><h4>Pocket</h4> <div class="show-number"> <<inv $pocket use inspect>> </div><h4>Music</h4> <div class="show-number"> <<inv $music>> </div><h4>Collectibles</h4> <div class="show-number"> <<inv $collectibles inspect>> </div>You're currently wearing... <hr> <<inv $outfit>><h1><span style="float: left">[[<Back|$return]]</span>\ <span style="float: right; text-align: right">\ <<link "Leads">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Leads Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Skills">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Skills Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Weapons">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Weapons Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>> <<link "Identity">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Identity Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Wealth">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Wealth Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "XP">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "XP Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "CONTROLS">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Controls Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>></span></h1> <br> <hr> <div id="tutorial"><<include "Tutorial Intro">></div><<widget "leads">> <<goto "Leads">> <<removeclass "#mobile-sidebar" "open">> <<removeclass ".sidebar-option" "visible">> <</widget>> <<widget "id">> <<goto "ID">> <<removeclass "#mobile-sidebar" "open">> <<removeclass ".sidebar-option" "visible">> <</widget>> <<widget "gear">> <<goto "Gear">> <<removeclass "#mobile-sidebar" "open">> <<removeclass ".sidebar-option" "visible">> <</widget>> <<widget "saves">> <<script>>UI.saves();<</script>> <<removeclass "#mobile-sidebar" "open">> <<removeclass ".sidebar-option" "visible">> <</widget>> <<widget "config">> <<script>>UI.settings();<</script>> <<removeclass "#mobile-sidebar" "open">> <<removeclass ".sidebar-option" "visible">> <</widget>> <<widget "help">> <<goto "Tutorial">> <</widget>> <<widget "achievements">> <<goto "Achievements">> <</widget>> <<widget "map">> <<toggleclass "#map-container" "revealed">> <</widget>> <<widget "menu">> <<dialog>> Are you sure you want to go back to the main menu? All unsaved progress will be lost. <h1>"""------""" <<link "YES">> <<run Engine.restart()>> <</link>> / <<link "NO">><<dialogclose>><</link>> """------"""</h1> <</dialog>> <</widget>><h1><span style="float: left">[[<Back|Start]]</span><span style="float: right">CREDITS</span></h1> <ul><li> Special thanks to my beta testers, Ash, Jay, Kiana, Lee, Marss, Nikki, and Mercury Neon.</li> <li> Twine was created by Chris Klimas</li> <li> The Sugarcube format and Tweego was created by T. M. Edwards</li> <li> Various macros created by <a href="https://github.com/ChapelR" target="_blank">ChapelR</a>, <a href="https://www.patreon.com/HiEv" target="_blank">HiEv</a>, <a href="https://github.com/cyrusfirheir" target="_blank">cyrusfirheir</a>, and <a href="https://sjoerdhekking.itch.io/" target="_blank">SjoerdHekking</a></li> <li> The template that I frankensteined was originally created by <a href="https://manonamora-if.tumblr.com/" target="_blank">manonamora</a></li> <li> If a text-based interactive fiction game can be Powered By The Apocalypse, this one would be it. Apocalypse World was made by <a href="http://apocalypse-world.com/">D. Vincent and Meguey Baker</a></li> <li> Clothing icons were created by <a href="https://thenounproject.com/blairwolf/" target="_blank">Blair Adams from Noun Project</a></li></ul>/* Places lead passages into the Active category */ <<widget "addlead">> <<if $leads.indexOf($args[0]) == -1>> <<set $leads.unshift($args[0])>> <<print "<<flash 'New lead: " + $args[1] + "'>><</flash>>">> <</if>> <</widget>> /* Places lead passages into the Complete category */ <<widget "completelead">> <<if $playedleads.indexOf($args[0]) == -1>> <<if $finishedleads.indexOf($args[0]) == -1 and $leads.indexOf($args[0]) gt 0>> <<set $finishedleads.unshift($args[0])>> <</if>> <<run $leads.delete($args[0])>> <<set $playedleads.push($args[0])>> <<set $xp += 1>> <<storereset>> <<set $gambled = false>> <<print "<<flash '+1 XP (" + $xp + ")'>><</flash>>">> <</if>> <</widget>>/* Memorial to the worst piece of code I've ever written. Hiiiiiii code divers */ <<if $leadlist.length is 0>>\ You don't have any leads right now. <<else>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 1>>\ <<include $leadlist[0]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 2>>\ <<include $leadlist[1]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 3>>\ <<include $leadlist[2]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 4>>\ <<include $leadlist[3]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 5>>\ <<include $leadlist[4]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 6>>\ <<include $leadlist[5]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 7>>\ <<include $leadlist[6]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 8>>\ <<include $leadlist[7]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 9>>\ <<include $leadlist[8]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 10>>\ <<include $leadlist[9]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 11>>\ <<include $leadlist[10]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 12>>\ <<include $leadlist[11]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 13>>\ <<include $leadlist[12]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 14>>\ <<include $leadlist[13]>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $leadlist.length gte 15>>\ <<include $leadlist[14]>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\<<liveblock>>\ <<for _i to 0; _i lt $leads.length; _i++>>\ <<include $leads[_i]>>\ <</for>>\ <</liveblock>>\<<liveblock>>\ <<for _i to 0; _i lt $finishedleads.length; _i++>>\ <<include $finishedleads[_i]>>\ <</for>>\ <</liveblock>>\ /* All Lead passages will be kept here, to be loaded when necessary */ /* MAIN LEADS */ /* PLOT-NEUTRAL */<h3><i class="fa-solid fa-exclamation"></i> Stolen Cargo</h3>\ Your cargo's been stolen- but if you could find it, it would be worth a lot. You should probably track it down. This might take some time. <hr>\<h3><i class="fa-solid fa-exclamation"></i> Consultation</h3>\ Doc told you to get the lay of the land first and come back to talk about your cargo when you're feeling a little better. <<if $cheatskip == true>>\ <ul><li> <<link "SKIP">><<completelead "consultation">><<addlead "trackingnumber" "Tracking Number">><<pocket 'Bloody Documents' 1>><<pocket 'Hand Drawn Map' 1>><<update>><</link>></li></ul>\ <</if>>\ <hr>\<h3><i class="fa-solid fa-exclamation"></i> Checkup</h3>\ <<if $leads.includes("crossroads")>>\ It's an exciting new world you've found yourself in! If you come across some, you should bring them back for her to photocopy. <hr>\<h3>Dead Air</h3>\ There's some kind of cool underground punk club operating in the Red Light District... if you want to get in with the local scene, that might be a good place to start. //This lead will be implemented in a later version.// <hr>\<h3>Arjun's Debt</h3>\ Reese told you that he used to work with the Lamplighters, and that Arjun owes him... something. Apparently if you pass on the message, his reaction will be "priceless." Maybe you should do that. //This lead will be implemented in a later version.// <hr>\<h3>The Old Haunts</h3>\ After your little date, Reese offered to bring you to one of his old hangouts in the Red Light District. He clearly doesn't want you to call him that... but now you //really// want to call him that. Maybe just try it and see what happens. //This lead will be implemented in a later version.// <hr>\<<set $title to "Signal Hill">> /* Pronoun Defaults */ <<set $pro = { they: "they", They: "They", them: "them", Them: "Them", their: "their", Their: "Their", theirs: "theirs", Theirs: "Theirs", themselves: "themselves", Themselves: "Themselves", }>> /* Player Initializing */ <<set $player = { name: "Unknown", surname: "Unknown", gender: "Unknown", trans: false, pronouns: "$pro.they/$pro.them", bodytype: "Unknown", hair: "Unknown", markings: [], tattoos: [], piercings: [], cosmetics: [] }>> /* Skill Initializing */ <<set $skill = { savvy: 0, glam: 0, brawn: 0, signal: 0 }>> <<set $wealth = 0>> <<set $wealthprogress = 0>> <<set $bonus = 0>> <<set $xp = 0>> <<set $weaponslots = 1>> <<set $chapter = 1>> <<set $gameversion = "Patreon">> <<set $map = false>> /* Relationship Initializing */ /* Measures the strength of the PC's relationships */ <<set $relationship = { doc: 50, kc: 50, malik: 50, yasmin: 50, yvette: 50, levi: 30, wolfe: 10, aldrich: 10 }>> /* Determines whether the PC has met the character */ <<set $met = []>> /* Determines how many times the player has flirted with a character */ <<set $flirt = { doc: 0, kc: 0, malik: 0, yasmin: 0, yvette: 0, levi: 0, wolfe: 0 }>> /* Determines whether romantic rolls are possible. When the PC declares disinterest, or if the character wouldn't be attracted to them, this is turned off. */ <<set $attraction = []>> <<set $attraction.push("doc", "yvette", "yasmin", "malik", "levi")>> /* A list of completed rolls, which blocks off the option to re-roll them. Only necessary for rolls that can be revisited later */ <<set $rolled = []>> /* Locations Visited */ <<set $visited = []>> /* Wins at the slot machines */ <<set $slotwins = 0>> /* Health Variables */ <<set $needsfirstaid = false>> /* Radio Lists */ <<set $radiolist = []>> <<set $radiolist.push("News 1", "News 2", "Ad 1", "Ad 2")>> <<set $radiodonations = 0>> /* Weapon Lists */ <<newinv $weapons>> <<pickup $weapons "hunting rifle" 1 "sawed-off shotgun" 1 ".44 magnum" 1 "semi-auto pistol" 1 "combat knife" 1 "spiked bat" 1>> <<newinv $ownedweapons>> <<newinv $heldweapon>> /* Weapon Definitions */ <<item "hunting rifle">> <<description>>\ <div class="weapon-grid">\ <div class="weapon-grid-top">\ <div class="image-weapon"><img src="images/square.png"></div>\ <div class="title-weapon">\ <<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <h2>HUNTING RIFLE</h2>\ <<else>>\ <h2><<link "HUNTING RIFLE">>\ <<merge $ownedweapons $heldweapon>>\ <<dropall $heldweapon>>\ <<transfer $ownedweapon $heldweapon "hunting rifle" 1>>\ <<set $currentweapon = {precision: 2, speed: 0, power: 2, value: 3}>>\ <<update>>\ <</link>></h2>\ <</if>>\ A hefty bolt action rifle with a wood stock and scope. Rudimentary sniper rifle, small enough to carry around. </div>\ </div>\ <div class="weapon-grid-bottom">\ <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>2</div> <div <</if>>\ A break-action shotgun with a shortened barrel, reducing weight and increasing spread. </div>\ </div>\ <div class="weapon-grid-bottom">\ <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid speed: 2, power: 2, value: 2}>>\ <<update>>\ <</link>></h2>\ <</if>>\ A large bore six-shooter with a classic design. <</if>>\ A sleek, black 9mm handgun with a sizeable magazine, for those who prefer quantity over quality. </div>\ </div>\ <div class="weapon-grid-bottom">\ <div class="weapon-statbox"><i 1}>>\ <<update>>\ <</link>></h2>\ <</if>>\ A large, fixed-bladed knife with a curved edge and serrated spine. On the front, the shape of a rose is printed in gold leaf. On the back, in red, are the words "DRINK VOUCHER" in an ornate serif font.</p> <<tags "quest">> <</item>> <<item "Hand Drawn Map">> <<description>> <p>An old letter, folded twice, with a crude map of The Stacks drawn in blue pen on the back. You can roughly figure out which building your cargo was meant to be delivered to based on this.</p> <<linkreplace "Do you want to read what's on the letter?">>\ <p>The letter was composed on a typewriter, and addressed at the top, "Dearest Emil." Very spicy. It reads:</p> <p>It has been so long since we've spoken. I, of course, have stayed up to date on your recent behaviour- my confidantes tell me the darndest things, I swear. One of them recently informed me that your expeditions beyond the city have led to procuring some interesting substances. I have a bit of a business proposal for you, if you'd entertain an old friend's //humble// offers.</p> <p>I am in need of a large amount- perhaps two bottles, three if possible. I understand that such a request is difficult, but I promise to reward you //handsomely// if you are willing to help out a lady in need. Trust me, this is for a very good cause. And perhaps when you deliver it we can catch up over a glass of wine? I'm sure you've missed me, hm?</p> <p>xoxo Yvette Valdez</p> <</linkreplace>> <<tags "quest">> <</item>> <<item "Bloody Documents">> <<description>> <p>A set of barely legible papers, stained with somebody's blood. These were the documents you were supposed to deliver to the recipient of the cargo. They're of no use now, but Doc was able to piece together a couple useful facts from them- the sender was a company called Sigma Biolabs, and the reciever was located in The Stacks. The cargo was labelled as not to be opened. Interesting.</p> <<tags "quest" "offering-blood">> <</item>> <<item "Pinky Finger">> <<description>> <p>Your, uh... severed pinky finger. It would feel wrong not to take it with you, but you're pretty sure there's no reattaching it. Back in the day they'd call this shit moonshine. It would probably kill you if you drank the whole thing. But it's not for drinking, so the taste shouldn't matter.</p> <<tags "quest" "altar">> <</item>> /* Identity Items */ <<item "Med Kit">> <<description>> <p>A stocked up med kit with everything you'd need to patch yourself, or somebody else, up after an injury. It might not be //good//, but hey, you take what you can get in this world.</p> <<liveblock>>\ <<if $needsfirstaid == true>>\ <ul><li> <<link "Patch yourself up.">><<set $needsfirstaid == false>><<unset $firstaid>><<update>><</link>></li></ul> <</if>>\ <</liveblock>>\ <</item>> /* Zines */ <<set $zinesdonated == 0>>\ <<item "The Transsexual Menace, Issue 5">> <<description>> <p>A folded and stapled sheaf of paper printed with black stencil artwork. The front cover reads, "THE TRANSSEXUAL MENACE" and features a posterized painting of a nearly nude transgender person with nipple piercings and a mohawk flipping off the observer. Leafing through it, you see that the contents are mostly artwork of transgressive transsexuals and typewritten op-eds about politics at the intersection of poverty and transsexual identity.</p> <<tags "zine">> <</item>> <<item "Lost Forever, Issue 2">> <<description>> <p>A folded and stapled sheaf of paper. The front is a low quality photocopy of a promotional poster, featuring a large group of people standing in front of lush mountains. The word "LOST" is printed above them in white, and under it the writer of the zine has printed "FOREVER" with white-out. Flipping through it, it seems to all be one (badly written) story typed out with a typewriter. The author's note in the intro lets you know that this is a fan-written continuation of the author's favourite television show, which was tragically cut short part of the way through its second season.</p> <<tags "zine">> <</item>> <<item "Dead Air Promo Zine">> <<description>> <p>A small sheaf of paper with some kind of avant garde digital collage printed on the front. The vague outline of a guitarist, printed in halftone, is jamming out on stage. The words "NO REST" and "NO QUIET" arranged in white next to him, and "DEAD AIR" printed in an even bigger font underneath. As you flip through it, you find a bunch of promotional (or fan) content for an underground punk band- printed lyrics full of profanity, low quality photos of the band members hanging out. It even lists the location of their main venue, a place called The Underground in the Red Light District.</p> <<if not $leads.includes("deadair")>>\ <<if not $playedleads.includes("deadair")>>\ <<addlead "deadair">>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <<tags "zine">> <</item>> /* Books */ <<newinv $books>> <<pickup $books "Guide to Common Seaweeds of British Columbia" 1>> <<item "Guide to Common Seaweeds of British Columbia">> <<description>> <p>A little green book, ancient, with covers made of light card and off-kilter pages all held together by a set of two large staples. <</item>> /* Wardrobe Settings */ <<newinv $outfit>> <!-- Creates the PC's main outfit --> <<newinv $slot1>> <!-- Creates empty preset outfits that the PC can save over --> <<newinv $slot2>> <<newinv $slot3>> <<newinv $wardrobe>> <!-- Creates an empty wardrobe to store bought clothes --> /* Clothing Style Lists */ /* Handmade Clothing */ <<newinv $handmade>> /* Headgear */ <<item "knit hat">> <<description>>\ A cozy hat made of knitted yarn. Probably a little too warm for this climate. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "simple headscarf">> <<description>>\ A square or rectangle of fabric that can be used to cover the hair or head and shoulders, depending on how it's wrapped or pinned. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "horned headdress">> <<description>>\ An elaborate headdress made with real goat, sheep or bull horns, or deer antlers. It gives off cursed energy. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "trinket headdress">> <<description>>\ A headdress made of coins, chains, pins, rings, and other trinkets arranged in a vaguely spiritual looking manner. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "macrame headdress">> <<description>>\ Rope or twine tied into complex knots to form a headwrap or headdress. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Glasses */ <<item "blindfold">> <<description>>\ A strip of fabric that covers the eyes. It's sheer enough for you to see through, but looks opaque to others. Good party trick. <<tags "clothing" "glasses" "handmade" "fetish" "1">> <</item>> <<item "leather goggles">> <<description>>\ A pair of handmade goggles formed from tanned leather and plastic or glass. <<tags "clothing" "glasses" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Masks */ <<item "face mask">> <<description>>\ A stitched fabric mask that covers the nose and mouth, attached with straps around the head or ears. <<tags "clothing" "masks" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "leather gas mask">> <<description>>\ A scavenged gas mask made of leather, with a hose that leads to a filter. It only covers the lower half of the face. <<tags "clothing" "masks" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "bandana">> <<description>>\ A bandana that can be tied around the face to prevent some debris from entering your airway. <<tags "clothing" "masks" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Earrings */ <<item "trinket earrings">> <<description>>\ Earrings made of punched coins, chains, pins, rings, or other trinkets. <<tags "clothing" "earrings" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "beaded earrings">> <<description>>\ Earrings made of glass beads strung together on thread, wire, or cord. <<tags "clothing" "earrings" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Neckwear */ <<item "trinket necklace">> <<description>>\ A necklace made of punched coins, pins, rings, or other trinkets on a chain. <<tags "clothing" "neckwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "beaded necklace">> <<description>>\ A necklace made of glass beads strung together on thread or cord. <<tags "clothing" "neckwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "tattered cowl">> <<description>>\ A hooded scarf worn around the neck and shoulders, tattered by age and wear. <<tags "clothing" "neckwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "knit scarf">> <<description>>\ A scarf made of knitted yarn. Probably a little too warm for this climate. <<tags "clothing" "neckwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Undershirts */ <<item "undershirt">> <<description>>\ A tank top meant to be worn under nicer shirts to protect them from sweat, or to keep warm. <<tags "clothing" "undershirts" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "long sleeved undershirt">> <<description>>\ A shirt meant to be worn under short sleeved shirts for fashion, warmth, or modesty. <<tags "clothing" "undershirts" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "binding tape">> <<description>>\ Flesh-toned tape that pulls the skin on the chest toward the sides of the body, making the chest appear flat. <<tags "clothing" "undershirts" "handmade" "punk" "1">> <</item>> /* Tops */ <<item "tattered tee shirt">> <<description>>\ A shirt with short sleeves that's seen better days. A bit oversized, with wear and tear around the bottom edge. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "handmade" "punk" "1">> <</item>> <<item "tattered shirt">> <<description>>\ A long sleeved top that's seen better days. A bit oversized, with wear and tear around the bottom edge and sleeves. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "handmade" "punk" "1">> <</item>> <<item "patchwork shirt">> <<description>>\ A shirt made of eclectic patches of fabric stitched together. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "handmade" "punk" "1">> <</item>> <<item "worn linen dress">> <<description>>\ A long dress made of a thin, unbleached fabric. May have some pintucks, flounces, or gathers. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "patchwork dress">> <<description>>\ A dress made of eclectic patches of fabric stitched together. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "striped sweater">> <<description>>\ A knitted sweater with red and white stripes, reminiscent of a particular old world book series. Good for getting lost in the crowd. (Thanks to Patreon supporter Waldo <i class="fa-solid fa-heart"></i>) <<tags "clothing" "tops" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Outerwear */ <<item "ragged cloak">> <<description>>\ A cloak that shrouds the wearer's body from view, with a hood that obscures all but their face. <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "long vest">> <<description>>\ A long, tattered sleeveless cardigan made of oversized panels that drape around the body. <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "short cape">> <<description>>\ A sturdy, hand stitched capelet that reaches the wearer's elbows. It might be decorated with leather straps, feathers, or fur. <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Pants */ <<item "patchwork pants">> <<description>>\ A pair of pants covered in various patches, paint, and even zippers. Well worn- the only pants you'll ever need. <<tags "clothing" "bottoms" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "parachute pants">> <<description>>\ A pair of billowy pants with a cord that cinches them at the bottom. Zippers around the knees allow you to detach them for warmer weather. <<tags "clothing" "bottoms" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "wide legged pants">> <<description>>\ A pair of simple, very loose fitting pants made of linen or cotton. <<tags "clothing" "bottoms" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Skirts */ <<item "worn linen skirt">> <<description>>\ A long skirt made of a thin, unbleached fabric. May have some pintucks, flounces, or gathers. <<tags "clothing" "bottoms" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "tattered skirt">> <<description>>\ A skirt that's seen better days. Its edge is frayed and torn. <<tags "clothing" "bottoms" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Arms */ <<item "knit fingerless gloves">> <<description>>\ Fingerless gloves made of knitted yarn. The ends are twisted together like barbed wire. <<tags "clothing" "arms" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> /* Footwear */ <<item "leather shoes">> <<description>>\ Simple shoes made from stitching pieces of leather together. <<tags "clothing" "footwear" "handmade" "1">> <</item>> <<item "sandals">> <<description>>\ Soles attached to the foot with an assortment of leather straps. <<tags "clothing" "footwear" "handmade" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Practical Clothing */ <<newinv $practical>> /* Headgear */ <<item "ballcap">> <<description>>\ A round cap with a sturdy brim. Might have some words or symbols on the front. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "cowboy hat">> <<description>>\ A high-crowned hat with a wide brim, perfect for shielding your eyes from the sun. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "visor">> <<description>>\ A strap holding a hat brim in place over your face. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Glasses */ <<item "simple glasses">> <<description>>\ An old world pair of metal or acetate framed glasses, possibly with new or scavenged lenses. <<tags "clothing" "glasses" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "sunglasses">> <<description>>\ An old world pair of glasses with tinted lenses to protect your eyes from the sun. <<tags "clothing" "glasses" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "goggles">> <<description>>\ A pair of aircraft, snowboarding, or safety goggles. <<tags "clothing" "glasses" "practical" "armoured" "1">> <</item>> /* Earrings */ <<item "stud earrings">> <<description>>\ A pair of simple studs with crystals, spikes, or small shapes on the end. <<tags "clothing" "earrings" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Undershirts */ <<item "binder">> <<description>>\ A tightly fitted garment meant to flatten the chest profile. Could be plain and discrete or loud and patterned. <<tags "clothing" "undershirts" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Tops */ <<item "tee shirt">> <<description>>\ A simple, short sleeved shirt made of knit fabric. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "linen shirt">> <<description>>\ A button-up shirt made of thin, breathable fabric. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "uniform shirt">> <<description>>\ A formal style button-up shirt with patches indicating affiliation with a long-dead organization. <<tags "clothing" "tops" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Outerwear */ <<item "poncho">> <<description>>\ A simple square of fabric with a hole for the head, which drapes over the body to keep warm or protect from the elements. <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "cape">> <<description>>\ A long, loose cape that drapes over the shoulders and has an attached hood. <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "flight jacket">> <<description>>\ A simple jacket with a knit wasteband and fur collar that zips up the front. <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "denim jacket">> <<description>>\ A jacket made of thick, blue-dyed cotton, rugged and practical. Also available as a vest. <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "puffer jacket">> <<description>>\ A zip-up jacket made of quilted plastic fabric. Not that you're going to need that, of course. It's not like you're going to get shot. (Thanks to Patreon supporter Ash <i class="fa-solid fa-heart"></i>) <<tags "clothing" "outerwear" "practical" "1">> <</item>> /* Pants */ <<item "denim jeans">> <<description>>\ A pair of pants made of thick, blue-dyed cotton, rugged and practical. <<tags "clothing" "bottoms" "practical" "1">> <</item>> <<item "cargo pants">> <<description>>\ A pair of baggy pants with an assortment of large pockets. Good for preventing crushed toes, or kicking in skulls. <<tags "clothing" "footwear" "practical" "armoured" "1">> <</item>> /* Armoured Clothing */ <<newinv $armoured>> /* Headgear */ <<item "motorcycle helmet">> <<description>>\ A large helmet that covers the head, with a reflective panel over the eyes that can be flipped up out of the way. <<tags "clothing" "headgear" "armoured" "2">> <</item>> /* Masks */ <<item "gas mask">> <<description>>\ A full-face gas mask with a large glass panel for the eyes. Flag names are NOT case sensitive. */ /* EXAMPLE: <<SetFlag "Mentor" "Bob">> */ /* EXAMPLE: <<SetFlag "TrialMed">> = sets TrialMed flag to True */ <<widget "SetFlag">> <<set _Fnam = $args[0].toLowerCase()>> <<if ndef $Flags>> <<set $Flags = {}>> <</if>> <<if def $args[1]>> <<if $args[1] == false>> <<if def $Flags[_Fnam]>> <<run delete $Flags[_Fnam]>> <</if>> <<else>> <<set $Flags[_Fnam] = $args[1]>> <</if>> <<else>> <<set $Flags[_Fnam] = true>> <</if>> /* Event flags: */ /* CHARACTER CREATION */ /* SeenWolfe = Whether the player saw Wolfe's face in the intro */ /* KilledJared = Whether the player successfully shot one of the militia guys in the intro */ /* HeardGeneral = Whether the player heard the militia guys talking about the General */ /* CONSULTATION */ /* ThinksItsDrugs = Whether the player is convinced that the cargo is drugs */ /* TRACKING NUMBER */ /* HonestLevi = Whether the player told Levi about the General or Wolfe. If this is false and one of those is true, they lied to him */ /* KidnappedByLevi = Whether the player was kidnapped by Levi */ /* LostFinger = Whether Levi chopped off the player's finger */ /* WorkingForLevi = Whether the player has agreed to work with Levi */ /* LeviOwed = The amount of money that Levi owes the player. If not defined, it's 0 */ /* BLOODLUST */ /* EmployeeDiscount = Whether the player gets a 25% discount at the Rose and Thorn */ /* WAVEFORM */ /* YvetteDomme = Whether the player a domme dynamic going with Yvette */ /* YasminThreeWishes = Whether the player made a joke about wishes with Yasmin */ /* YasminMysterious = Whether Yasmin thinks the player has a mysterious past */ /* TabDodger = Whether the player dodged the tab at Waveform */ /* WorkingForYvette = Whether the player agreed to work for Yvette */ /* HighKissedYasmin = Whether the player kissed Yasmin while high */ /* MISC */ /* ArjunPermission = Whether the player has Arjun's permission to enter the HQ */ /* LiedToArjun = Whether the player told KC that they lied to Arjun */ <</widget>><<if ndef $gameversion>>\ <h1><<link "UPDATE REQUIRED" "Update 1.1.0">><</link>></h1>\ <hr>\ <<elseif $gameversion == "1.1">>\ <h1><<link "UPDATE REQUIRED" "Update 1.1.1">><</link>></h1>\ <hr>\ <<elseif $gameversion == "1.1.1">>\ <<if $playedleads.includes("waveform")>>\ <<if not Flag("WorkingForYvette")>>\ <<if not Flag("YvetteHotfix")>>\ <h1><<link "UPDATE REQUIRED" "Hotfix for Yvette">><</link>></h1>\ <hr>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\<p>Update 1.1.0 has been released, which includes several major changes that may cause issues with existing saves. Currently donations only count towards flavour text, but any donations you make now will still count towards future content being unlocked * Fixed bug that caused the altar to be unusable after supplying three items. If you've supplied all three items, you should now be able to access the altar * Fixed bug that caused duplicate clothing items to appear if the player restarted the character creation process * Fixed bug that would allow the player to accept an identity twice at certain points in the game * Replaced Hunting Wolves I lead with Crossroads for better story flow <<silently>> /* Fixing Waveform bug */
