<<dialog "Cheats">> <h1>WEALTH</h1> <h1><<link "1">><<set $wealth = 1>><</link>> <<link "2">><<set $wealth = 2>><</link>> <<link "3">><<set $wealth = 3>><</link>> <<link "4">><<set $wealth = 4>><</link>> <<link "5">><<set $wealth = 5>><</link>></h1> <br> <h1>ENABLE SKIPS</h1> <div style="text-align: center">Enabling this will allow you to skip leads in the Lead menu. The lead will be completed according to a presumed "most common" route, with no options available to customize your choices. This is an experimental feature intended for testing and may introduce bugs- please regularly save your game while using this feature, and back up your saves before doing so.</div> <<liveblock>><h1><<if $cheatskip == true>><<link "DISABLE">><<set $cheatskip = false>><<update>><</link>><<else>><<link "ENABLE">><<set $cheatskip = true>><<update>><</link>><</if>></h1><</liveblock>> <br> <h1><<link "ADD LEADS">><<goto "Add Leads">><</link>></h1> <div style="text-align: center">This is intended for testing only and use may lead to weird contradictions in the narrative, including the ability to replay an already played lead. Please excercise caution and back up your saves.</div> <br> <h1><<link "WARP PIPE">><<goto "Lead Selector">><</link>></h1> <div style="text-align: center">Please don't use this if you're not me, or a future editor or something. Like it'll fuck your save up real good. This one is exclusively for line editing.</div> <</dialog>> <</widget>><h3>MAIN STORY</h3>\ * [[Crash Medicine]] * [[Checkup]] * [[Consultation]] <h3>FOLLOWERS OF THE LIVING GOD</h3>\ * [[Tracking Number]] * [[Crossroads]] <h3>THE ROSE AND THORN</h3>\ * [[Rose and Thorn|Yvette Intro]] * [[Waveform]] * [[Dress Up Games]] <h3>THE LAMPLIGHTERS</h3>\ * [[Lamplighters|KC Intro]] * [[Test Run]] <h3>SIDE LEADS</h3>\ * [[Shotgun Romance]] <h3><<link "<- Back">><<goto $return>><</link>></h3><h3>MAIN STORY</h3>\ * <<link "Checkup">><<addlead "checkup" "Checkup">><</link>> * <<link "Consultation">><<addlead "consultation" "Consultation">><</link>> <h3>FOLLOWERS OF THE LIVING GOD</h3>\ * <<link "Tracking Number">><<addlead "trackingnumber" "Tracking Number">><</link>> * <<link "Crossroads">><<addlead "crossroads" "Crossroads">><</link>> <h3>THE ROSE AND THORN</h3>\ * <<link "Rose and Thorn">><<addlead "roseandthorn" "Rose and Thorn">><</link>> * <<link "Ride the Waveform">><<addlead "waveform" "Ride the Waveform">><</link>> * <<link "Dress Up Games">><<addlead "dressupgames" "Dress Up Games">><</link>> <h3>THE LAMPLIGHTERS</h3>\ * <<link "Lamplighters">><<addlead "lamplighters" "Lamplighters">><</link>> * <<link "Test Run">><<addlead "testrun" "Test Run">><</link>> <h3>SIDE LEADS</h3>\ * <<link "Shotgun Romance">><<addlead "shotgunromance" "Shotgun Romance">><</link>> <h3><<link "<- Back">><<goto $return>><</link>></h3><p>The guy standing watch out front was built like a hyena, all gangly with sinewy muscles and an intense gaze. His dark hair was cropped short, and his cheeks were gaunt. He had on a grey tank top and a pair of camo shorts, each pale and sun-bleached against his warm brown skin. His boots had steel toe-caps fitted with rivets, which he ground into the ash as he eyed you up.</p> <p>"Name's Arjun. This is Lamplighter territory you're in. What's your business here, stranger?" His voice was measured, but not impolite- though that contrasted with his crossed arms and cold demeanour. You just couldn't get a read on him.</p> * [[“Just passing through. Not looking to make any trouble.”|Arjun Passing]] * [[“I was hoping to get an audience with your leader.”|Arjun Leader]] * [[“Heard there was illegal activity going on out here. Big fan. Wanted to check it out.”|Arjun Illegal]] * [[“I was told I could get work from you folks.”|Arjun Work]] <<if not $met.includes("arjun")>>\ <<set $met.push("arjun")>>\ <</if>>\<p>The guy nodded. You could tell you were being sized up- the way you were standing, moving, talking, all being computed to figure out your intentions. Whatever his conclusion, he relaxed a little. "You're pretty far out from the city. Scavenger? Outlaw? What's your deal?"</p> <ul>\ <<if $leads.includes("lamplighters")>>\ <li> [[“I'm new in town, kind of struggling, and a friend told me you might have some work for me.”|Arjun Doc]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“I am just an honest businessperson looking to make connections.”|Arjun Work]]</li> <li> [[“I need work. I heard you guys have work. So I'm here.”|Arjun Work]]</li> <li> [[“Honestly I'm just walking around and seeing what I find. Hasn't led me wrong so far.”|Arjun Around]]</li> </ul>\<p>Arjun snorted, an open grin spreading across hus face. He had a gold incisor, the one right to the left of his front teeth. "An audience? With our leader? What do you think we are, a sovereign nation?"</p> <p>"What, do you not have a leader?" Obviously they had a leader. Every mercenary group has a cool leader who wears dark clothes and has a scar over their eye or whatever. This was just a law of nature.</p> <p>He shrugged. "No."</p> <p>"There has to be somebody with more authority than everybody else," you argued back. "Is that... you? Are you the leader?"</p> <p>"Okay, just tell me what you want and I'll see if I can hook you up with the right person." He was being awful accommodating, which maybe you didn't deserve, given that you just introduced yourself like an alien from an old cartoon.</p> * [[“Who assigns you jobs?”|Arjun KC]] * [[“Who manages your resources?”|Arjun KC]] * [[“Who handles the business side of things?”|Arjun KC]]<p>Arjun narrowed his eyes, tapping his toe against the ashy ground. "And where'd you hear that?"</p> <p>"No, I'm like, crazy about illegal stuff. Fuck the police." You weren't sure what exactly was illegal around here, but it must be cool. Otherwise it wouldn't be illegal.</p> <p>"Well, you're outta luck then. Nothing illegal going on here." You were almost disappointed for a moment before he clarified. "Just a bunch of workers doing work that infringes on the 'official' militia's bullshit monopoly.”</p> <p>"Okay, so we're on the same page vis a vis the cops?"</p> <p>He took a long, exaggerated breath before responding. "Yes. Yes, we are in agreement."</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“So what's the vibe around here? Commies? Libertarians? Y'all some kind of art collective?”|Arjun Commies]]</li> <li> [[“So... do you have any 'legal' work I can help out with?”|Arjun Work]]</li> <<if $heardgeneral == true>>\ <li> [[“That's good to hear. I'm pretty sure the cops tried to kill me, so anybody who's an enemy of them is a friend of mine.”|Arjun Cops]]</li> <</if>> </ul>\<p>"Just wandering around the Graveyard? What, do you have a death wish?” He snorted at the sheer concept. "Be honest with me. Why are you here?”</p> <ul>\ <<if $leads.includes("lamplighters")>>\ <li> [[“I'm new in town, kind of struggling, and a friend told me you might have some work for me.”|Arjun Doc]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“You're right. I should probably head back to the city.”|Arjun City]]</li> </ul>\<p>"I have literally no idea what you're talking about." This guy was clearly not very well read. Everybody up North knew about communism. What, had he never seen WarGames? Insanity.</p> <p>"Commies are like..." Actually, you weren't really sure. In fact, you also weren't really sure what a libertarian was. After an embarrassingly long pause, you concluded, "I think it has something to do with the division of labour. I think."</p> <p>Arjun shook his head, his shoulders raised in a gesture of uncertainty. "I mean... we share revenue. And we make sure everybody's getting paid fairly for their work. I don't know, is that what you're asking?"</p> * [[“That sounds like commie shit, yeah.” (Derogatory)|Arjun Commie Shit]] * [[“That sounds like commie shit, yeah.” (Complimentary)|Arjun Commie Shit]] * [[“That sounds like an excellent arrangement. Are you guys looking for more partners?”|Arjun Work]] <<if def $tictactoe>>\ <<set $tictactoe += 1>>\ <<if $tictactoe == 3>>\ <<completeachievement "tictactoe" "Tic Tac Toe">>\ <<unset $tictactoe>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\<p>"So what exactly are you here for?"</p> <p>You shrugged. "I want to... you know... get in on your operation. Do some 'legal' stuff for cash. I really need cash, man."</p> <<include "Arjun Work">><p>He narrowed his eyes at you, one eyebrow raised in confusion. Trying to read you. Figure out if you were serious. The conclusion was apparently yes. "The militia, you mean? They tried to kill you? What the fuck happened?"</p> <p>"I mean, I'm not sure if it was the militia," you reasoned. "Could have been somebody else. Guys with semi-automatic rifles and body armour shot my whole caravan- I only survived by the skin of my teeth."</p> <p>"Huh. Yeah, that definitely could describe the Signal Hill militia." His eyes drifted up, staring off into space as he considered what you were telling him.</p> <p>"Is there anybody else it could be?"</p> <p>Arjun shrugged. "I mean, that could describe a lot of people. That's what our men usually look like when they're out on missions, although obviously it wasn't us." From the way he reacted, you could be pretty certain he was telling the truth. <<if $skill.signal gte 1>>Somewhere deep down in his resonant patterns, though, there was faltering- even he wasn't certain. Such was the structure of this organization, he couldn't be sure, only have faith. <</if>>"Not many looters are walking around with fancy rifles, but they could be from Jett's camp out East of here- those fuckers are nasty, and high tech too."<<if $skill.savvy gte 1>></p> <p>This was good information. Get more of it, your mind was telling you. Grill him. Figure it out.</p> <p>"Any other ideas? It happened just outside the North checkpoint."</p> <p>"There aren't that many groups of people with that kind of weaponry out here." He shook his head. "I mean, it could be independent mercenaries hired by somebody rich in the city. Other than that... well, there's a cult operating in the city that might have had the equipment and manpower required for that kind of thing at some point. They've been quiet for almost a year, though."<</if>></p> <ul>\ <li> [[“Who's Jett? Why do you think his people might have been involved?”|Arjun Jett]]</li> <<if $skill.savvy gte 1>>\ <li> [[“What's this cult you're talking about?”|Arjun Cult]]</li> <</if>>\ <<if $skill.signal gte 1>>\ <li> [[“You aren't convinced it wasn't Lamplighters who did it. Who don't you trust?”|Arjun Trust]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>"Nasty, violent motherfucker. The people who refused to move to the Hill, they're under his 'protection.' Not in a nice way." The way he talked about the guy, it was so full of venom. This was something personal. "If you want my advice, don't go anywhere near his territory. You'll regret it."</p> <p>"Noted."</p> <p>Arjun shifted on his feet, evidently uncomfortable with this subject. "So what, are you just here to ask questions? What do you want?"</p> <p>"I mean, I appreciate the info." After a bit of chatter, you figured it was safe to bring the subject up. "I was hoping I could get some work from y'all."</p> <<include "Arjun Work">><p>"Eh... bunch of weird Northerners worshipping some prophet type. I didn't know much about them, honestly. I don't pay attention to stuff like that." You could tell, just from the way he spoke, that he wasn't telling you something. It was nagging at you. "Important part is, they had a ton of weaponry, stockpiled it and weren't afraid to use it if it came down to that. I don't think they're operating anymore, though. They've been quiet for a while."</p> <p>"Hm. I guess that could be them. Seems unlikely, though."</p> <p>Arjun shifted on his feet, evidently uncomfortable with this subject. "So what, are you just here to ask questions? What do you want?"</p> <p>"I mean, I appreciate the info." After a bit of chatter, you figured it was safe to bring the subject up. "I was hoping I could get some work from y'all."</p> <<include "Arjun Work">><p>He looked a little offended by your insistence. "I trust my people, stranger," he muttered, unwilling to spill the beans. Whatever he was hiding, he wasn't going to share it with you just yet. Maybe if you earned his trust. Maybe. "What exactly are you here for?"</p> <p>You shrugged. "I'm not trying to pry. I just need work, y'know? And you guys seem to have work."</p> <<include "Arjun Work">><p>Arjun pursed his lips. "Friend? Who exactly told you where to find us?"</p> <p>"He goes by Doc."</p> <p>He shook his head, letting out an exasperated sigh. "I swear to god, that man. Doesn't know how to leave well enough alone."</p> <p>You were a little caught off guard. Doc hadn't given any indication of conflict here, apart from a somewhat rude tone. "I have no clue what you're talking about, honestly."</p> <p>"Let's just say him and us don't see eye to eye." Intentionally evasive. Interesting. "But if he sent you, KC's gonna want to see you."</p> <p>Well, whatever got you in with the gang was fine by you. "Who's KC? Your leader?"</p> <p>"We don't have a leader. KC... she handles the business side of things. She's like an administrator."</p> <p>"Okay, sounds good. Where can I find her?"</p> <<include "Arjun Success">><p>Arjun nodded, his arms still crossed defensively. "You better get going. It's dangerous out here." Despite his words, his tone was apparent- he was relieved to see you leave.</p> * [[You let him be.|Graveyard Leave]]<p>Arjun leaned against the brick wall behind him, letting out a low sigh. "We aren't in the business of giving out gigs, okay? That's not how this works. We get jobs from trusted sources, we assign them fairly to our own people according to their skills and needs, and we make sure safety and payment are up to snuff. For our own people. Not strangers."</p> <p>"So what, you're not accepting new people?"</p> <p>"No." There was no uncertainty, no wavering. Just no.</p> * [[“Is that up to you? Who's in charge of 'hiring' around here?”|Arjun KC]] * [[“Fine, then. I guess I'll go find somebody else to work for.”|Arjun City]]<p>The guy pursed his lips, tapping his fingers on his arm. "That would be KC."</p> <p>"Great. Can I meet with them?"</p> <p>"I don't know if you want to." Shaking his head and staring up towards the brick building behind you, he muttered, "She's a busy woman. Doesn't have much sympathy for time-wasters. You'd better have a really good reason if you want to bother her."</p> <ul>\ <li> <<link "“I want to work with you guys. I've got plenty of experience, just no connections out here.” <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-three'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-three'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-hand-fist'></i>">><<brawnroll 6 "Arjun Brawn Success" "Arjun Brawn Failure">><</link>></li> <<if $leads.includes("drugdealingi")>>\ <li> [[“Actually, I have a job for you folks. I'd like to discuss it with her.”|Arjun Savvy Success]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> <<link "“Actually, I have a job for you folks. I'd like to discuss it with her.” <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-four'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-four'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-brain'></i>">><<set $arjunlied = true>><<savvyroll 8 "Arjun Savvy Success" "Arjun Savvy Failure">><</link>></li> <</if>>\ <li> <<link "“You'll just have to trust me.” <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-three'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-three'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-heart'></i>">><<glamroll 6 "Arjun Glam Success" "Arjun Glam Failure">><</link>></li> </ul>\<p>Arjun sighed with all the energy of a retail worker being asked to fetch the manager. "She's just going to say the same thing I said."</p> <p>"I'm serious, I have years of experience doing this kind of work. I just want the opportunity to make a case for myself."</p> <p>He paused, analyzing your face for a good long while. "Fine," he finally said. "If you have as much experience as you say, I guess she might want you."</p> <p>Thank god.</p> <<include "Arjun Success">><p>He perked up at this. "Oh? Why didn't you lead with that, then? Jeez." Arjun shook his head and crossed his arms. "If you need somebody's services, KC can help arrange it, sure. Just know that we're the best this city's got, and that means you're going to have to pay a little more for our services than for any dude off the street with a gun. Got it?"</p> <p>"Yeah. I get it." <<if $arjunlied == true>>You couldn't believe that actually worked.<<else>>Lucky you, having a good excuse.<</if>>\</p> <<include "Arjun Success">><p>"I don't know you."</p> <p>You shook your head, letting a little glimmer of a smile cross your lips to really sell it. "I'm sorry, are you worried that your not-leader is going to get mad at you for letting me in? Is she gonna demote you?" This felt like the most reasonable tact to take. Either his boss was a bitch, in which case you'd strike a nerve, or she was nice, in which case he'd feel silly for keeping you out. At least, that's how it worked in your head.</p><<include "Arjun Glam">> <p>He paused for a moment, his top lip curling into a scowl as he eyed you up. Finally, he muttered, "Sure. If she likes you, she likes you. But don't hold your breath."</p> <p>Hell yeah. "Thanks! I appreciate it!" You beamed, only half sarcastically. Man, this guy really didn't like you.</p> <<include "Arjun Success">><p>"Her office is in that big ol' brick building over on the other side of the compound. Through the doors, up four flights of stairs, big door at the end of the hall that says 'KC'S OFFICE.' Can't miss it." He gave you a measured stare, grinding his foot into the ash. "And don't dawdle. Go up there, talk to her, and leave. Understood?"</p> <p>"Sure." Best not to antagonize him, now that you'd convinced him to let you through.</p> <p>And with that, you were free to enter the plaza.</p> * [[Proceed.|Lamplighter HQ Hub]] <<SetFlag "ArjunPermission" = true>>\<p>Arjun sighed with all the energy of a retail worker being asked to fetch the manager. "She's just going to say the same thing I said."</p> <p>"Please? I swear, I know what I'm doing. Just let me prove myself!"</p> <<include "Arjun Failure">><p>"You can't just change your strategy on me and expect me not to notice," he muttered, his upper lip raised into a scowl. "What do you think I am?"</p> <p>"Look, I'm just trying to get work- I mean, you know, get work done. By you guys." Way to blow it.</p> <<include "Arjun Failure">><<include "Arjun Glam">> <<include "Arjun Failure">><p>"You're really testing my patience here." He sighed, shifting his weight from one foot to the other. "Look, if you'd rather get told to fuck off by her than me, be my guest. Stops me from having to deal with you any more."</p> <p>Hell yeah! Huge success! "I'll take it."</p> <<include "Arjun Success">> <<SetFlag "ArjunHatesYou">>\<p>"Did you need something, dear?" The older woman pushed her spectacles up on her nose, looking up at you from your desk. "Help finding a book? Or did you have a question?"</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“What kind of books do you sell here?”|Bookseller Books]]</li> <<if $rolled.includes("bookstoresignal")>>\ <li> [[“You've got a strange way of organizing these things... how do you find anything?”|Bookseller Find]]</li> <</if>>\ <<if $leads.includes("bookseller")>>\ <li> [[“Are you from... the 'old country'?”|Bookseller Old Country]]</li> <</if>>\ <<if $leads.includes("zineseller")>>\ <li> [[Hand over a zine.|Bookstore Zines]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“No, I'm finding everything okay.”|Bookstore Office]]</li> </ul>\<p>A smile spread across her cheeks, deepening her laugh lines. "Oh, my. I don't know a kind of book I //don't// sell. I have old world biographies and science fiction and picture books for children... although I suppose that's probably not to your interest." Then her face lit up, as if she had just remembered something that had eluded her before. "There is one thing I don't have, and that is those 'zines' that the kids are collecting these days! People are always asking, but I'm afraid an old girl like me wouldn't even know where to find a thing like that!"</p> * [[“Zines? What's a zine?”|Bookseller Zines]] * [[“Okay, that's a lot of stuff. I guess I'll go browse.”|Bookstore Office]]<p>"Hm, I suppose I just assumed somebody your age would know."</p> <p>You shrugged. "I'm not from around here. We don't have 'zines' where I come from."</p> <p>"Well, let me show you." The old woman leaned over, pulling open one of the drawers of her desk. It was stuffed to the brim with electrical gore and papers, with the occasional book shoved up against the wall or balanced on top of a pile of wires. Rummaging in it for a moment, she came up with what looked like a bunch of small papers.</p> <p>The bookseller placed this 'zine' down on her desk, and you got a better look at it. Rather than just a stack of papers, it was more like a sheath- a little smaller than a standard page, a bunch of folded pieces of paper stapled together at the spine to resemble a little book. The paper was light blue, with black ink scrawled on the front that read "Computer Fanatics, Issue 2." Under it, a line drawing in the same white ink of a boxy contraption covered in buttons with a kyeboard sitting horizontally next to it.</p> <p>She flipped through a few of the pages, and you could see that it was all typewritten, full of weird jargon and hand drawn diagrams. "This is the only one I've come across so far- a dear friend donated it to me. They're like little magazines that people make at home and copy to share with people. All sorts of niche topics, too. They're a fascinating phenomenon!"</p> * [[“But this is the only one you have?”|Bookseller Photocopy]] * [[“Interesting. Thanks for sharing.”|Bookseller]]<p>"Oh... yes." She smiled sheepishly, as if this fact was embarrassing. "From what I understand, folks like to trade these around and hand them out to people in the know. I don't leave this place very much anymore, so I'm really not in the know!"</p> <p>Picking up the little book, you flipped through it. You were also not in the know, but your goal was to //become// in the know, right? So finding these things was probably a good goal. "It I come across them, I can give them to you."</p> <p>"Heavens, I wouldn't ask you to give me things you've collected yourself!" The old woman shooke her head furiously, her bun bouncing along with it. "They're yours to keep. But I suppose, if you wouldn't mind me photocopying them..."</p> * [[“Sure, I'd be happy to lend you whatever I find.”|Bookseller Lead]] * [[“Eh, on second thought I'm not really interested in collecting them.”|Bookseller]]<p>"My, you're a treasure. It's greatly appreciated, sweetheart." The woman gave you a sweet smile, once again reminding you of your grandmother.</p> <p>//When you collect zines, you can drop them off with the bookseller for her collection. Zines can be found all around Signal Hill through trading, buying, completing leads, and exploring. Don't forget to drop them off- you might earn some rewards.//</p> * [[“No worries.”|Bookseller]] <<addlead "zinecollector" "Zine Collector">>\<p>The old lady tittered at your question, a mischeivous smile crossing her lips. "I'm sorry, did you have trouble finding someting? I'm afraid not everyone is familiar with my process. The Dewey Decimal System produces very... energetically uncomfortable results."</p> <p>"Energetically? What exactly do you mean by that?"</p> <p>She brushed you off, shaking her head. "Oh, just humour a superstitious old woman, will you?" There was no further explanation.</p> * [[Weird.|Bookseller]]<<styletest>>\ <p>A big grin crossed the woman's face. "Ah... you hail from the North?"</p> <p>"I do." Maybe the old country wasn't so old anymore, though. You probably hailed from a very different version of the North than she did.</p> <p>"<<if _result == "handmade">>I should have guessed. You look straight out of an old painting.<<else>>I wouldn't have guessed! The city's changed you, friend.<</if>>"</p> <p><<if _result == "handmade">>"I suppose I do." Your trappings did give you away. The style wasn't exactly common here.<<else>>"I suppose it has." You had only been in the city a little while, but it did feel like its energy had started to infect you. Maybe it was apparent. Or maybe it was just your outfit.<</if>> "I met another Northerner down in Skid Row who mentioned you."</p> <p>"You'll have to be more specific, dear," she muttered, shaking her head sadly. "Many of us, especially around my age, aren't living in the best of circumstances."</p> * [[“I think his name was Jim.”|Bookseller Jim]] * [[“He told me you dealt drugs.”|Bookseller Drugs]]<p>"Oh, Jim... he's gone down to Skid Row, has he? The poor man... you know, he used to work in the bottling plant just East of here until they laid off half their staff..."</p> <p>How unfortunate. But her ramblings were really keeping you from, y'know, getting high. "He told me you sold him drugs?"</p> <p>She stared at you for a solid moment, the gears working behind her eyes. Trying to figure out what you meant. Maybe Jim had been fucking with you? But just before you became certain, the bookseller responded- "Oh, dear. You are on the path to attunement?"</p> * [[“Um... no. Actually, maybe I've got the wrong idea.”|Bookseller Deny]] * [[“Is that what you call what he was on?”|Bookseller Drugs]] * [[“Yeah, I am. I was hoping you could... help me out.”|Bookseller Buy]]<p>"I'm sure they don't have this up North, dear, but our community has discovered the most beautiful truth brought to us in physical form." That sentence was borderline incoherent, yet she was looking at you with this half concerned, half loving expression. "Is that what you're looking for?"</p> * [[“Attunement? Yeah, attunement sounds great.”|Bookseller Buy]] * [[“No. I think maybe you've got the wrong idea.”|Bookseller Deny]]<p>"Well, I wouldn't normally want to share with an outsider... but if you are on the path, I would gladly shepherd you along your way." A warm smile crossed her face. "However... well, darling, it isn't easy. I'm afraid I would have to ask for money."</p> <p>You nodded, unphased. Of course you were going to need money. That was how things worked, here and everywhere. "How much is it going to cost?"</p> <p>"If you need enough for one journey..." The old woman leaned back in her chair for a moment, contemplating the problem. You got the feeling that she wanted to ask for as little as possible. But when she quoted the amount to you, it was un unbelievably steep price.</p> <ul>\ <<if $wealth gte 4>>\ /* <li> <<link "Pay the woman. (4 <i class='fa-solid fa-coins'></i>)">><<spendwealth 4>><<goto "Bookseller Pay">><</link>></li> */ <li> This item can't be acquired in the current version. Sorry, check back later.</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“Woah. That's crazy!”|Bookseller Crazy]]</li> </ul>\"Ah." She seemed almost disappointed. "Apologies, child. I must have misjudged you." * [[“It's cool. Don't worry about it.”|Bookseller]]<p>The woman looked hurt, her eye curling up with concern and her lips twisting into a grimace. "Darling, you need to understand... our community itself is in short supply. If you aren't dedicated, well, I suppose you aren't meant to follow the path just yet."</p> <p>"Is there really nothing else I can do?"</p> <p>"Perhaps, come back to see me when you've found the funds. I'm sorry." And with that, she changed the subject.</p> * [[Tender topic, maybe.|Bookseller]]This is a placeholder. You shouldn't be able to get this much money in the current version. * [[And a way out in case you cheat yourself into this passage somehow. Naughty.|Bookseller]]<p>As you stepped inside to start wandering off into that all-consuming atmosphere, you were intercepted by the greeter- kept from your prize like a dog on a chain. She had this big red-painted smile across her freckled cheeks, and a faux black rose was tucked into her ginger updo. "Hey babe! My name's Cherry!"" Her voice was chipper, but practised. She'd said this hundreds of times. "First time at the Rose?"</p> * [[“Yeah, this is my first time.”|Cherry Rules]] * [[“No, I've been here before.”|Cherry Rules][$temp to "no"]] <<set $met.push("cherry")>><p><<if $temp == "no">>Without even skipping a beat, like she didn't hear (or care about) your response, Cherry jumped into her spiel. <</if>>"We've just got a couple rules to run by you before you go have fun, okay? Don't worry, they're pretty easy- leave your weapons at the door, no outside food and drinks, strict no touching policy on the main floor. Got it?"</p> <p>You nodded, eager to get past. The guard behind her exhaled a big puff of smoke, and you could see him giving you a bemused grin through it. Cherry just kept going, her voice maintaining the same energy level all the while. "You can tell who's an employee if they've got a rose on 'em," she continued, pointing out the example tucked into her own hair. "If the rose is red, you can hire 'em for a one-on-one. If it's black, they ain't available- don't ask."</p> * [[“Got it.”|Cherry More Rules]] <<unset $temp>>\<p>"Everybody sets their own rates," she kept going. "Tipping is highly encouraged. All our girls and guys have the right to deny you service for any reason, so don't treat this like a cheap whorehouse- chat 'em up before you try to bone down!" She giggled at her own crass turn of phrase. The guard behind her put out his cigarette on the chair and tossed the butt into an ashtray on the ground. Then he pulled out a pack and a lighter to start up another one.</p> <p>Cherry was silent for a moment, her grin fading and her eyes darting up to the ceiling as if scanning her brain for anything she'd missed. She must have found something. Her eyebrows shot up and her smile returned. "We're also offering escort services now! If you need to book somebody for an event or some //personal time// outside the building, just let me know and I can give you a hand!"</p> * [[“Okay, yeah, I get it.”|Cherry Voucher]]<p>"Okay, that's it! You're good to go!" She fumbled with some papers in her hands for a moment before handing over two slips of black paper, stamped with a rose in gold leaf. "Oh, and here's a voucher for a free drink at the bar. And a second one, because you're //soooo// cute, hon. Don't tell the boss!" Cherry gave you a furtive wink, although you were confident she was probably giving multiple of these out all the time. Two drinks was probably enough to start thinking that a night with one of their employees was worth a pretty exorbitant price.</p> <p>With her finally laying off, however, you'd get the chance to actually enjoy yourself. With these free vouchers the bar was calling for you...</p> <ul>\ <li> [[Try to chat with the guard.|Reese]]</li> <li> [[Head towards the bar.|Rose Bar]]</li> <li> [[Browse a little.|Rose Browse]]</li> <li> [[Walk out.|Red Light District]]</li> </ul>\ <<pocket "Drink Voucher" 2>>\ \ \ /* START REGULAR CONVERSATION WITH CHERRY */<p>As you approached, Cherry plastered a big, fake smile on her face. "Hey, darling! Need a hand?" Her teeth were incredibly white. Like, whiter than white. You wondered what was in that lip stain that kept it from smearing all over her teeth. Might be some kind of tattoo?</p> * [[“Is your boss here?”|Cherry Boss]] * [[“What do you do around here? Are you just a greeter?”|Cherry Greeter]] * [[“Can I just say, you're really pretty.”|Cherry Pretty]]<p>"Oh!" Her smile wavered a bit before returning to her face. "Yeah, hon, you're in luck! The Madame is usually too busy to make an appearance here, but we're getting a visit today! Big day!"</p> <p>"That's good to hear. I was hoping I might be able to get some work here."</p> <p>"Oh." This time, her smile was gone permanently. "Ah, yes, I suppose you can always ask about that!" That didn't bode well.</p> * [[“Thanks, Cherry.”|Cherry]]<p>"I do a little bit of everything at The Rose!" Cherry put her hands on her hips, as if to signal her authority, although the way she subtly bounced on the balls of her feet robbed any kind of seriousness from the gesture. "I'm a greeter, human resources manager, bartender, escort, handywoman... and a couple other things, I think!"</p> <p>"That's... a lot. Do you get paid well?"</p> <p>"Nope!" The smile didn't fade from her face for a second. "I do it for the love of the game!" Her left eye was twitching a little.</p> * [[“Cherry, are you sure you actually like working here?”|Cherry Work]] * [[“Uh... thanks for sharing, Cherry.”|Cherry]]<p>Cherry shook her head. "That's an awful rude question to ask, you know!"</p> <p>You should probably leave her alone.</p> * [[“Sorry, Cherry.”]]<p>"Oh!" She seemed genuinely caught off guard by that. "Um... thank you. I'm not on the job though, silly!" She tapped the black rose tucked into her hair.</p> * [[“When are you on the job, Cherry?”|Cherry Job]] * [[“No, no, Cherry, it was just a compliment.”|Cherry Compliment]]<p>"Um..." Cherry grimaced a little. "I'm available for escort services, if you want to book me. I guess... you'd have to talk to... me. About booking me."</p> <p>"How much?"</p> <p>"The rate depends on the nature of the event!" That probably meant the rate was made up on the spot, but okay. You'd bite.</p> * [[“What if I just want to have sex with you?”|Cherry Sex]] * [[“Can I just take you out on a date? Like a normal, unpaid date?”|Cherry Date]] * [[“I don't really have an event in mind. I'll let you know if I need to hire you.”|Cherry Nothing]]<p>"That's really not how this works!" Her smile looked more fake than ever.</p> <p>"But like, you're a prostitute, right?"</p> <p>At this point, Cherry's smile was almost agressive. "Do I need to explain to you what an escort is?"</p> * [[“Um... no. It's fine. I'll go find somebody else.”|Cherry]]<p>"Do you know how expensive rent is in the Red Light?"</p> <p>You took a beat before you responded, distracted by her perfect teeth. "Is that... a no?"</p> <p>"Yep!"</p> * [[Why did you even think she'd just say yes to that?|Cherry]]<p>"Okay! Well, I'll be here if you need me, pretty much 24/7!" You were getting the distinct feeling that she hated this job. Not sure why. Just intuition.</p> * [[“Sounds good, Cherry.”|Cherry]] \ \ /* START INTERACTION WITH CHERRY THAT STARTS DRESS UP GAMES */<p>The door opened, you stepped through, and you were immediately intercepted. In the exact instant you passed the threshold, Cherry's clawed hand had grabbed your bicep and yanked you into a secluded room off the main entrance.</p> <p>You hadn't even noticed it was there until your were trying to get your footing on its tile floor, having the door slammed behind you. It looked like a guard room. The only illumination was a hodge-podge array of small televisions stacked one on top of another, all showing the establishment from various angles through a haze of static fuzz.</p> <p>"<<print $player.name>>! I've been waiting for you!" Cherry had a sanitized, perfect smile plastered across her face and dead eyes. She was not excited to see you. "Mr. Valdez requested for you to join him at the boutique in The Heights, the one run by Ms. Darling. Very exciting!"</p> <p>"Oh, uh... yeah. That does sound exciting."</p> <p>The woman raised a painted-on eyebrow at you, placing her hands on her hips. Backlit by the monitors, cast in an artificial blue glow, she looked a little unsettling. "You're really lucky, you know. Mr. Valdez only commissions //expensive clothes// like that for his favourite playthings- I mean, friends. Colleagues. I certainly don't mean to imply anything untoward is going on!"</p> <p>To be fair, she wasn't exactly //implying// it so much as //stating// it. She also seemed more than a bit jealous. The dress she was wearing was the same one she'd worn the last time you saw her- and every time.</p> * [["Thanks for letting me know, Cherry. I wouldn't want to keep him waiting."|Cherry Backroom Leave]] * [["Cherry, what's your problem with me?"|Cherry Backroom Problem]] * [["Cherry, are you okay?"|Cherry Backroom Okay]]<p>As you turned to get the hell out of here, she lurched towards the door to cut you off. "Great! Good idea! But you have to keep this secret, okay? Mr. Valdez doesn't want anybody to think you work for him!"</p> <p>You took a step back, only slightly voluntarily. "Huh? Why?"</p> <p>"It's very important!" She maintained that big, ominous smile as she stepped out of the way to let you out.</p> * [[Mildly freaky. But on with your day.|Rose and Thorn Hub]] <<addlead "dressupgames" "Dress Up Games">>\<p>That plastered-on smile vanished from Cherry's perfectly primped face, replaced with a violent glare. "Problem? Heavens, I don't know what you mean. I don't have a problem with anybody." Her voice was almost completely monotone.</p> <p>"You're giving off a real hostile vibe right now, Cherry," you muttered, backing off towards the door. "How about I just... get going?"</p> <p>"Oh of course, you should really be going, since you have places to be! I'll just be here... running the entire establishment while you gallivant around with Mr. Valdez. Enjoy!"</p> * [[Yeah, you should probably get going.|Rose and Thorn Hub]] <<addlead "dressupgames" "Dress Up Games">>\<p>"Whatever do you mean?" Her smile only faltered for a moment. "I'm just peachy keen, as always!"</p> <p>"You sure about that? You don't seem like you're doing so hot."</p> <p>Cherry shook her head furiously. "I am doing so hot right now! Mr. Valdez is waiting for you, you don't want to keep him waiting, right?" She wanted you gone so bad. Like, with every fiber of her being.</p> * [[Yeah, you should probably get going.|Rose and Thorn Hub]] <<addlead "dressupgames" "Dress Up Games">>\<p>The carriage of Joyette's typewriter snapped back into place with a loud clunk as she continued typing, her fingers moving faster than your eyes could pick up on. As you approached her, she only barely glanced up from her writing. Her fingertips still danced across the little metal keys, a quiet thunk accompanying each letter. "Mhm?"</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“You're Joyette, right?”|Joyette Name]]</li> <li> [[“What are you typing?”|Joyette Typing]]</li> <li> [[“Sorry, do you know where Doc is?”|Joyette Doc]]</li> <<if $needsfirstaid == true>>\ <li> [[“I've got a medical issue.”|Joyette Doctor]]</li> <</if>>\ <<if not $rolled.includes("joyettesignal")>>\ <li> <<link 'Try to figure out what her deal is. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-tower-broadcast"></i>'>>\ <<signalroll 6 "Joyette Signal Success" "Joyette Signal Failure">>\ <</link>></li> <</if>>\ <li> [[She looks busy. She absolutely //hated// how Doc referred to her in front of patients. You didn't need to ask to find that out.</p> <p>"You were the one who operated on me?"</p> <p>A faint smile crept onto her lips. "That was mostly Dr. Zhao. I'm sure he undersold himself to you, but he is a very talented surgeon. I did help, though."</p> * [[“I thought he wasn't a doctor.”|Joyette Title]] * [[“That's good to know. Thanks.”|Joyette]]<p>The typing briefly halted. In that moment the silence was overwhelming, despite monitors beeping and a fan going somewhere. "Did he give you that whole spiel? Really?"</p> <p>"Yeah, he gave me the spiel."</p> <p>She shook her head, her fingers resuming their complex dance over the keys. "That man will be the death of me."</p> * [[Okay, so he is a doctor. Or not? Who knows.|Joyette]]<p>Joyette was silent for a moment, leaving you listening to the rhythmic thunks of metal against paper and the slow clicking of the carriage moving across the machine. "I just handle the requisition and finances. If there's anything that requires //special efforts,// Dr. Zhao takes care of it."</p> * [[“Okay, noted.”|Joyette]] <<addlead "requisition" "Requisition">>\<p>Joyette scowled at the question. "Do I look like a secretary to you?" She was sitting in the waiting room of a clinic typing on a typewriter, so yeah, actually, she looked exactly like a secretary from an old tape. But this was obviously a rhetorical question.</p> <p>After a moment of uncomfortable silence, you repeated, "Do you actually know where he is though? I wanted to talk to him."</p> <p>"He's in the lab." She nodded towards the door labeled "OFFICES."</p> * [[That's good to know.|Joyette]]<p>She pushed her chunky glasses up on her nose and looked up at you properly. "What's the problem, hon? Are the stitches healing okay?"</p> <<if $firstaid == "lost finger">>\ <p>You held up your hand, pinky finger absent. "Uh... I lost something."</p> <p>"Oh my god." Joyette pushed her chair back and stood to her feet in shock. "How did you manage to lose a finger?! It hasn't even been that long since you showed up!"</p> <p>"Would you believe it was chopped off as part of an interrogation?"</p> <p>She didn't have time to be concerned about your interrogation. She was busy inspecting your hand, where the stump of your finger sat. You were able to move it still, although it hurt like a bitch. It was sliced clean through just under the second knuckle. "Do you still have the finger? It //might// be able to be reattached..."</p> <<if $altar.has("Pinky Finger")>>\ <p>"I mean... it's within walking distance. I guess I could go grab it."</p> <ul>\ <li> [[...but it's probably of more use to you there, right?|Joyette Lost Finger Deny]]</li> <li> <<link "You should probably go grab that and see if she can reattach it.">><<set $altarsetup == false>><<set $altardonations -= 1>><<goto "Joyette Lost Finger Agree">><</link>></li> </ul>\ <<elseif $pocket.has("Pinky Finger")>>\ <p>"Obviously, yeah. I've got it." You pulled it out of your pocket to demonstrate, which was probably not a sanitary place to keep it.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[You've got to at least try to get it reattached.|Joyette Lost Finger Agree]]</li> <li> [[Actually... that sounds risky. Maybe you shouldn't.|Joyette Lost Finger Deny]]</li> </ul>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\<p>"Okay... let me call Dr. Zhao." It is an emergency."</p> <p>After a moment, the door opened, and Doc stepped out. He was dressed up in his nicest wool turtleneck, his hair having been hurriedly tucked into a messy bun. "<<print $player.name>>, hello again. What seems to be the problem?"</p> <p>"<<print $pro.Their>> finger got cut off." You nodded along with Joyette and added, "Yeah, my finger got cut off," lifting your hand up to demonstrate.</p> <p>"Jesus christ."</p> <p>"Yeah."</p> * [[You find yourself being rushed into the operating room, where you'd been (unconscious) only shortly before.|Operating Room Lost Finger]]<p>"Are you... are you sure?" The idea seemed completely nonsensical to her. "Look, I'm not going to force you to accept treatment. But please, at least let me clean and bandage it."</p> <p>"Yeah... I guess that works." Who needs a pinky finger anyway? You sure didn't. In fact, it was fine that it was gone! You looked way more metal now.</p> <p>Joyette rushed to grab fresh bandages and alcohol from a first aid box stashed behind her desk. "Come, let's go into your room to take care of this. My god, I can't believe you've already managed to lose a finger..."</p> <p>Soon your hand had been swabbed with burning alcohol and wrapped up in clean white cloth. "If that starts showing signs of infection, you need to let me know immediately."</p> * [[“Will do, doctor. Thanks for the help.”|Clinic Room]] <<set $needsfirstaid = false>>\ <<unset $firstaid>>\<p>Standing near her, you were picking up a little interference in that constant stream of static in your ears. Buzzing, humming, and the faint sound of voices through the haze. "It was an... stupid... work out?" It was jittery, inconsistent, but when it was there it was clear.</p> <p>Lines of it, modulated by your mind, spread out across the void behind your eyelids. Rolling down slowly as the feeling split and lost sync, then snapped back into place. Some of it was filled with fuzz, but what wasn't was a soft contrast with at least a few shades of grey in there.</p> <p>Doc, wearing a black turtleneck, indistinguishable from today but for much shorter hair that brushed the lines of his jaw. He was leaning back on a desk, standing across from Joyette, much as she appeared here. The office was dark.</p> <p>"Morally, I don't know if that's something I'd accept." Low res as it was, you could tell the look on his face was dark. This was a conversation he wasn't happy to be having.</p> <p>"You're hopeless, then. I can't help you if you won't help yourself."</p> <p>He sighed. "It's not about helping //me//, Joy, it's about the patients. I can't... they're only here because they can't afford anything else."</p> <p>"A sliding scale, then." Joyette looked just as exhasperated as he did. "There's no way you're going to be able to maintain this. This is going to kill you."</p> <p>"If you'll just help me, I swear to god I'll find a way to make money. Just... not like that." The signal fuzzed out before you could figure out the rest, the image collapsing on itself. Damn.</p> * [[It's something, at least.|Joyette]] * [[“Would you say you and Doc agree about how this place is run?”|Joyette Agreement]] <<set $rolled.push("joyettesignal")>>\<p>Standing near her, you were picking up a little interference in that constant stream of static in your ears. Buzzing, humming, and the faint sound of voices through the haze. "It was an... stupid... work out?" It was jittery, inconsistent, but when it was there it was clear.</p> <p>Lines of it, modulated by your mind, spread out across the void behind your eyelids. Rolling down slowly as the feeling split and lost sync, then snapped back into place. Some of it was filled with fuzz, but what wasn't was a soft contrast with at least a few shades of grey in there.</p> <p>Doc, wearing a black turtleneck, indistinguishable from today but for much shorter hair that brushed the lines of his jaw. He was leaning back on a desk, standing across from Joyette, much as she appeared here. The office was dark. In his voice: "Morally, I don't know if that's something I'd accept."</p> <p>"You're hopeless, then." The signal got fuzzy, snow filling the image. Then, a stream of letters... T - H - A - N - K - Y - O... No, this was nothing. Too focused on that damn typing to show you the rest of that conversation. Dammit.</p> <p>Well, you could piece something together. Seemed like the two of them were on different grounds, morally speaking. He did something she thought was stupid. Maybe something to look into.</p> * [[It's something, at least.|Joyette]] * [[“Would you say you and Doc agree about how this place is run?”|Joyette Agreement]] <<set $rolled.push("joyettesignal")>>\<p>She looked up at your from her typewriter, her fingers resting on the keys. "What kind of question is that?"</p> <p>You shrugged. "I was just curious, y'know." Maybe if you gave her an opportunity to complain... "He seems pretty opinionated, is all."</p> <p>That seemed to do the trick. She exhaled sharply, a slight smile across her lips. "You've got that right, hon." Leaning forward, for the first time she seemed genuinely interested in talking to you. "For the record, the whole 'free clinic' thing was his idea. Named the place before I ever signed on, you know. And I refuse to offer my services for free, and he refuses to change the name. A stubborn young man, that one, just like his father."</p> <p>Shit. That was more than you expected. But just as soon as she opened up to you, she turned back to her typing. "My apologies, I'm getting distracted."</p> * [[“Sorry. Didn't mean to distract you.”|Joyette]]<p>Stepping over decrepit old skids and suspiciously wet cardboard boxes, you made your way over to the corner. The walls were far from sparse, posters of bands whose members were all dead now stuck to the concrete with balls of blu-tack. An old metal desk was pushed into a corner, piled up with all sorts of junk and detritus. A pack of cards lay open on the ground with half the spades sprawled out.</p> <p>As you got closer, you could get a better glimpse of the people here- two men, maybe mid fifites, huddled around a fire burning low on the concrete floor. The guy on the right looked a bit older, perhaps due to the host of scars dotted across his skin. The guy on the left had this long black beard that hid most of his face and the most sunken eyes you'd ever seen. They were sitting in total silence, seeming to not even notice as you approached.</p> * [[“Hey.”|Druggies Hey]] * [[Maybe just... leave them alone.|Abandoned Warehouse]]<p>There was a pause that's far longer than it should be. You'd almost concluded that you should just walk away anyway. But the scarred man eventually piped up, his voice low and gruff. "Hey, man. Who the fuck are you?"</p> * [[“Just, y'know. Walking through.”|Druggies Walking]] * [[“No need to be all hostile.”|Druggies Hostile]] <<set $met.push("jim")>>\<p>"Hey, that's cool, man," the bearded guy responded. He had this lilting tone to his voice that made your skin crawl a little. The static seemed to get a little stronger when he spoke, invading your mind and making itself apparent. It was hard to take in what he was saying. "Just not many people just walking through abandoned buildings, usually. Kinda weird."</p> <p>You paused for a moment. "You're sitting in an abandoned building."</p> <p>The old man seemed offended by your implication. His voice was slurring a little as he insited, "This place isn't abandoned! We've been hanging out here for... what, a month? Has it been a month, Jim?" Jim concurred, and you decided not to bother pointing out the contradiction.</p> <p>It was pretty evident from just the way they were acting that these guys were inebriated in some way, but what exactly they were taking wasn't evident... and you weren't sure you wanted to know Then again, maybe they'd be able to hook you up.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“What are you guys doing hanging around here?”|Druggies Hanging]]</li> <li> [[“If you don't mind me asking... what are y'all on?”|Druggies Drugs]]</li> <<if $pocket.has("Painkillers")>>\ <li> [[“Hey... you seem a little stressed out. Maybe I have something that can help you take the edge off?”|Druggies Stressed]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>"No hositility here, man," the guy with the scars insisted. "We swear like sailors 'round here, you gotta get used to it." He had a good belly laugh, though you weren't sure what was particularly funny about that.</p> <p>The other guy joined in with a slight laugh, though as soon as he opened his mouth your skin started to crawl. The static was stronger around him, impossible to ignore. "I think $pro.they<<if $pro.they == "they">>'re<<else>>'s<</if>> a little too on edge. Somethin' off about $pro.their //vibe//, y'know. Need to... relax."</p> <p>"Most people need to relax, Jim," the old man concurred.</p> <p>It was pretty evident from just the way they were acting that these guys were inebriated in some way, but what exactly they were taking wasn't evident... and you weren't sure you wanted to know. Then again, maybe they'd be able to hook you up.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“What are you guys doing hanging around here?”|Druggies Hanging]]</li> <li> [[“If you don't mind me asking... what are y'all on?”|Druggies Drugs]]</li> <<if $pocket.count("Painkillers") >= 3>>\ <li> [[“Actually, I've got something with me that might help you relax...”|Druggies Stressed]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>Jim spoke up. "We used to hang out at the old chapel in The Stacks, but we got kicked out when the cops shut the place down," he explained. Just listening to him talk had you on the edge of vomiting. There was something deeply wrong with him. You couldn't figure out what.</p> <p>"Militia doesn't come around the Row anymore," the older guy explained, though you weren't asking. "I was in there till I saw the light, y'know. The militia. You join in cause the pay's good... that's how they get you. And they make you turn against God and her people."</p> * [[These guys have the right idea. Fuck the police, obviously.|Druggies Cops]] * [[These guys clearly have some fascinating religious ideas to share.|Druggies Religion]] * [[These guys are starting to freak you out. You should probably leave.|Abandoned Warehouse]]<p>"Yeah, man. Fuck the police. Down with organized crime. No more corporations. Firing squad for all of 'em." Maybe that was a little much, but it was the apocalypse, extremism was just kind of what people did now. The world's gone to shit. That solarpunk bullshit's for babies.</p> <p>The guys both nodded, though they seemed pretty spaced out. Maybe they weren't 100% aware of the conversation happening around them. Whatever they were on, it seemed pretty strong.</p> * [[“What kind of shit did you guys take?”|Druggies Drugs]] * [[This isn't going anywhere. Just leave.|Abandoned Warehouse]]<p>"What exactly do you mean by 'God and her people'?" The concept of a monotheistic divinity was not uncommon- you'd come across enclaves of those who still followed the religions of the old world, some of which were slavishly monotheistic and preached it to the heavens, some of which seemed happy to worship their one deity without making much of a fuss.<<if $identity.includes("devotee")>> You much preferred the latter, as colonies of the former tended to view your beliefs as sacrilege. At best, they'd pester you in an attempt to have you convert. At worst, you'd be accused of some kind of devil worship. Good times.<</if>> Still, most of those gods were supposed to be //dudes//. You hadn't encountered many worshippers of a supreme goddess.</p> <p>The older guy leaned towards you, as if he was about to share a secret. "I've met her, man. She's inside all of us, and I've talked to her. Whenever Jim lends me some of his fucking supply." He landed a quick, unenthusiastic punch to Jim's shoulder, which was casual enough that it couldn't possibly have hurt, but Jim was still cradling his arm after. "You gotta try that stuff at least once, man. Find your connection to God."</p> * [[“Hell yeah. I'm all about spiritual enlightenment. What're you on?”|Druggies Drugs]] * [[“I think I'm good with being unconnected. You guys... enjoy that.”|Abandoned Warehouse]]<p>"I've got static in my veins and my eyes are full of tears, man," Jim responded. Whatever he was talking about, jesus christ was it fucking him up. Barely lit by the fire, you could see that there was crust around his eyes and stuck to his lashes, and streaks down his face where tears had been. "The world is talking, and I can hear it."</p> <p>"Jim's got a source he won't tell me about, so it's real fucking top secret." The older man said this as if it explained anything. It didn't. "Good shit, though, man. I mean, you know. Enlightening shit."</p> <p>You weren't sure if this was something you wanted to pursue, if it left Jim like that. But then again... maybe.</p> * [[“I'll bite. Where do I get this stuff?”|Druggies Source]] * [[“Well... I'm glad you're enjoying it. I'm just gonna go now.”|Abandoned Warehouse]] * [[“Whatever that shit is, it's clearly bad for you.”|Druggies Bad]]<p>There was a prolonged silence. Jim stared at you, and when his eyes met yours you could hear that static louder and louder, burrowing in your ear drums like so many insects and beginning to cause a noticeable ache in your head. "I don't think you could handle it," he muttered. Part of you wondered if you agreed.</p> <ul>\ <<if not $rolled.includes("druggiessignal")>>\ <li> <<link '“I know the static. I can handle it.” <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-six"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-six"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-tower-broadcast"></i>'>><<signalroll 12 "Druggies Signal Success" "Druggies Signal Failure">><</link>></li> <</if>>\ <li> [[He's right. You can't. Time to go.|Abandoned Warehouse]]</li> </ul>\<p>You tried your hardest to maintain eye contact, staring into his sleep-filled teary eyes and seeing nothing and everything behind them. The static grew louder until the buzzing was like a drill entering your ear canal, beginning to drill through it and into your brain, gore spilling out in all directions. You maintained eye contact. The static was normal. It ran through your veins too. Pain was to be shrugged off like so many shawls and left behind when warmer climes were ahead.</p> <p>"You can, can't you?" His voice was low and serious, but without a hint of surprise. "The real source is beyond me, beyond the city walls, somewhere out in the great beyond. //My// source is an old friend, a bookseller from the old country who sees more than most. Whatever you seek, you can find it there. If you have the funds, she will show you."</p> * [[“Okay, sick, thanks.”|Druggies Farewell]] * [[“I'll let them know you sent me.”|Druggies Farewell]] <<addlead "bookseller" "The Bookseller">>\ <<set $rolled.push("druggiessignal")>>\<p>Jim nodded. "Go on, now. It's getting warm." You knew what he meant.</p> <p>The men returned to their silent vigil by the fire, as if you'd never been there.</p> * [[And you take your leave.|Abandoned Warehouse]]<p>You tried your hardest to maintain eye contact, staring into his sleep-filled teary eyes and seeing nothing and everything behind them. The static grew louder until the buzzing was like a drill entering your ear canal, beginning to drill through it and into your brain, gore spilling out in all directions. You glanced down, and the pain stopped, and you knew you'd failed. No way you were cool enough for whatever sick shit this guy was on.</p> <p>It was wordless. You knew now was the time to leave. Maybe some other time.</p> * [[You leave.|Abandoned Warehouse]]<p>"You don't wanna know what I was like before," the guy with the scars growled, his tone suddenly a hostile one. You hadn't even really been talking about him. Jesus.</p> <p>Backing up a little on instinct, you muttered, "I just mean it seems like maybe your drug use is contributing to like, mental health issues that can't be pleasant to deal with..."</p> <p>Jim stared you right in the eyes, your ears filling with that buzz of static. "The world says bad things are coming for people like you. Unbelievers and heretics."</p> * [[It's probably best to leave.|Abandoned Warehouse]] <<set $pissedoffdruggies = true>>\<p>You pulled out the glass bottle, the pills inside giving off a pleasant rattling sound. "Morphine, I think. Or maybe oxycodone." You couldn't really figure out exactly what it was. Might not even be an opiate. It's unclear.</p> <p>"We don't mess with that stuff," Jim declared.</p> <p>His friend gave him an angry glare. "Speak for yourself, asshole." Then, turning to you, he continued- "That dick at the clinic refuses to hook me up with any more shit until I 'agree to a monitored rehabilitation program,' whatever the fuck that's supposed to mean."</p> <p>Okay, so maybe this was a little bit unethical, but you wouldn't have gotten where you are in life through ethical behaviour! It was time to sell drugs to a struggling addict! And besides, withdrawal wouldn't be that much better, right? It was probably a very moral decision.</p> * [[Actually, no. No, I'm not gonna sell this guy drugs.|Druggies Change Mind]] * [[“How much is this worth to you?”|Druggies Sell]]<p>"Y'know, actually, I might... need these." You started to tuck the bottle back into your pocket, much to the scarred man's annoyance.</p> <p>"So you're just going to tease an old man like that, eh? Think it's funny? Asshole." Jim gave him a supportive pat on the shoulder, which the guy shrugged off. "I oughtta come over there and teach you a lesson..."</p> <p>You took a couple steps backward, ready to start running if the guy tried to attack you. But instead, he stayed slumped over next to the fire. Probably should have expected that. "I ain't gonna, though," he offered, "because I'm a decent guy. Now can you fuck off?"</p> * [[Yes. You could leave immediately.|Abandoned Warehouse]] <<set $pissedoffdruggies = true>>\<p>The guy took a look at the bottle, contemplating the number of pills still left over. After a minute, he told you how much he'd be willing to hand over- not exactly a huge fortune, but a decent amount. Something to help you get by.</p> <p>//Will you sell the painkillers for a small payment?//</p> * [[Sell them.|Druggies Deal]] * [[Don't sell them.|Druggies Change Mind]]<p>You tossed the guy the bottle, and he handed over a fistful of paper notes in its stead. This was certainly not a bad decision.</p> * [[Take your leave.|Abandoned Warehouse]] <<addwealth "small">>\ <<dropall $pocket "Painkillers">>\<p>You approached the uncomfortable looking shopkeeper, whose eyes were wide like a bug and whose body was small like... a bug. Are you going to buy something?"</p> * [[“You're the owner of this place?”|Roach Owner]] * [[Leave her be.|Threadz]]<p>"Yes!" she squeaked, her lips curling into an artificial smile. "I own this store! Legally!"</p> * [[“Are you... sure about that?”|Roach Sure]] * [[“I actually wasn't suspicious before, but now I definitely am.”|Roach Suspicious]]<p>"Why wouldn't I be sure?" I guess you own this place.”|Threadz]]<p>"Suspicious?" She was clearly feigning shock. As if it would make her less suspicious, when in reality it had the opposite effect. Never been to a charge bar, eh?"</p> <p>You felt like a fool for asking now. But it was true. You hadn't. In fact, you had never even heard of such a thing. It's just a mess, that's all.”|Bartender Lie]]<p>"Maybe it is. Not something I came up with. These things have been around for decades now." He leaned forward against the bar, the edge of the wood pressing into his round belly. "This establishment here was set up by my daddy 21 years ago, kid. The Stacks was a very different place back then, y'know. Wasn't called The Stacks yet, on account o' those smokestacks outside weren't even there yet. None of these immigrants, either." "Folks around here can't afford to all have personal generators to charge their own gadgets. Good thing, too, or else I'd be out of business!" He chortled, despite the uncomfortable cynicism of his joke. "Instead, they come down here and I charge 'em for 'em, for a fee of course. My daddy was the one who came up with a way to make it a little more profitable- y'see, early on, folks would come drop their batteries off and then go get a couple drinks while they waited. So my daddy said, hey, how about we give 'em a more //convenient// way of getting a drink? And this business model was born!"</p> * [[“Oh, okay. You honestly didn't even realize that you could get in trouble for hanging out with those people. Or that they were criminals. "Wait, they're criminals?"</p> <p>"Yeah. "Nobody who's in good with the law hangs out there."</p> <<include "Pistol Graveyard">><p>"Why is it called the Graveyard?" The name was more than a little ominous.</p> <p>Pistol glanced over the wall, towards the distant skyline, where enormous monumental buildings towered above. "They're like gravestones. All lined up in a grid. What, you don't see it?"</p> <p>You paused, scanning that horizon. They did resemble headstones a little. "Yeah. I guess I see it."</p> * [[“Any more questions?”|Pistol Last]]<p>"Just one. Are you coming back? To the city, I mean."</p> <p>That was a good question. The voice of a man sang over it with a loose intonation in what sounded like broken French. Maybe an acquired taste, but you could dig it.</p> <<case 2>>\ <p>There was a groovy tune drifting out of the radio's speaker, something with a distinct rock edge. Old though, old enough for saxophone to be a part of a rock 'n roll band. Pretty good shit. A little dated, though.</p> <<case 3>>\ <p>A soft guitar song was playing from the speaker, with the gruff voice of a man used to singing over much more angry music reciting distant lyrics about grief over it. As soon as you were getting a feel for it the rest of the band joined in, a bright and gritty crescendo. Nice.</p> <<case 4>>\ <p>The glittering, overproduced guitar and drum beats of a pop tune rang out from the radio's speaker, worming its way into your brain for the foreseeable future. A nasally man's voice was singing inane lyrics over it all. Ugh.</p> <<case 5>>\ <p>A sugary sweet pop song was playing from the radio. Over it, a soft woman's voice sang sad lyrics with an almost seductive tone and cadence. For a second, you were bewitched by it.<<if $met.yasmin == true>> It almost sounded like Yasmin's voice.<</if>></p> <</switch>>\<p>The radio filled your ears with the tinny sound of a guitar ballad from many years ago. The quality wasn't the best, but what else could you expect from such a thing? It had been decades since this thing's prime.</p> <p>As the song came to a close, the airwaves were filled with a very different sound- there was a click, like something being pressed or a switch being flicked, and a voice started to speak. Through the haze of static his voice was dulcet, warm, low. "Listeners, you're tuned in to The Signal- best broadcast this side of the Divide. Tonight's lineup is all 1990s indie classics, man. Good shit, but the best is yet to come."</p> <p>There was a pause in his spiel, and you could hear the faint sound of papers rustling, as if he was searching for a script he needed to read from. "Got a request for me? You can read my tracklist and make personalized requests at my radio station in the Heights. Got something I don't? Donated records, tapes, and CDs are how this station keeps its lights on. Leave 'em in my dropbox, and who knows- you might hear 'em over the waves."</p> <p>The sound of another song started to fade in under the host's voice, and he wrapped up his spiel- "This is 4 Non Blondes with What's Up." Another click, and his voice was gone.</p><p>You caught the tail end of some kind of experimental indie song. As the guitar and harmonica faded out into static, <<if $met.includes("malik")>>Malik's<<else>>the host's<</if>> voice rang out. "Y'know, I heard the other day that something went down up by the North checkpoint. Bunch of caravaneers got killed." He paused, and you could hear the crack and sizzle of a can being opened in the background. "Fucked up, man. They already don't care about workers in town, now they're targetting outsiders? Fucked up, man." It was unclear what 'they' he was referencing.</p><p><<if $met.includes("malik")>>Malik<<else>>The host<</if>> was mid-ramble when you tuned in. "-get in trouble for talking about this on air, look, I don't care. I've said worse. I'm just saying, we shouldn't stop asking questions about Nadir. Who profited from his death? There's an answer to that, listeners. I'm not gonna risk saying it, but there's an answer to that."</p><p>"This show couldn't exist without your donations," <<if $met.includes("malik")>>Malik's<<else>>the host's<</if>> warm voice recited, practised and measured, "and this week we've got a //very generous// donation from the folks at the Rose and Thorn. I... look, kids listen to this show, I can't read this copy word for word." He chuckled, and you could hear the rustling of paper as he leafed through the ads they'd provided him. "Let's jut say there's somethin' for everybody eighteen and older up there and leave it at that, shall we? Look for the bloody rose in the Red Light, you can't miss it."</p><p>"This show couldn't exist without your donations," <<if $met.includes("malik")>>Malik<<else>>the host<</if>> recited, just a part of his usual ad setup. "And this week, I'd like to shout out L'Apothecaire-" (his French was shaky at best) "-on 1st in The Heights for their donation, albeit not a monetary one. You recalled visiting with an augur in your youth during a particularly nasty infection, that strange androgynous figure you'd only seen from afar, their face covered in cloth and their body adorned with trinkets that clicked together with every movement. This kind of androgyny was something different, though. Every time you encountered it you could feel that vibe coming off of them. It was fresh. It was modern. No, it was futuristic. The androgynes and genderfucks of Signal Hill, at least the ones you'd met so far, had neon in their veins and ritual sanctity was the last thing they'd concern their bodies with. Light cascaded in through the windows, illuminating only floating dust in its rays. The bartender wiped down the counter with a dirty rag as a couple patrons sipped on cider. In the far distance, the drinkers-to-be were all huddled over assembly lines, sweat dripping from their brows in the afternoon heat. None of the workers would be here for at least three, maybe four hours. The perfect time for a covert meeting with your new confidante.</p> <p>If he was here, that is. Scanning the room again, you spotted nobody with that distinctive half-shaved hair. This was certainly the correct time and place- you hadn't been stood up, right?</p> * [[You feel a hand on your shoulder.|Cross Shoulder]]<p>"You're going to go sit in the booth nearest to the door, off to the left." Levi's voice was soft. Bordering right on the edge of threatening, almost falling off. "Sit in the seat that faces away from the door. I will order drinks. If anyone gets too close to us during this conversation, we will get up and continue outside. Alright?"</p> <p>Static tingled up your spine, sending the hairs on the back of your neck up.<<if $identity.includes("devotee")>> As a child, you lay in bed, racked with illness, overlooked by a minister with long blonde curls and a stark face. She placed her hand on your shoulder, and it felt cold against your fevered skin. Cold, comforting.<</if>></p> * [[“Understood.”|Cross Sit]] * [[“Sure, whatever.”|Cross Sit]] * [[“Don't fucking touch me.”|Cross Touch]]<p>Taken aback by the fire in your voice, in an instant he retracted his hand. "Don't speak to me that way, or we'll have an issue."</p> <p>"We have plenty already," you snapped. "Just go. Hurry up."</p> <<include "Cross Sit">><p>Wordless, he stepped around you, heading off towards the bar. Like he advised, you headed to the nearest booth. The seats were ratty and barely holding together after many years of operation, and the table had a stained vinyl cover stapled down to it at the edges. You faced away from the door, instead taking the time to admire a large mounted deer head hung on the opposite wall. Was that real? If it was, it must have been ancient. You don't see many deer around these parts.</p> <p>Finally, Levi slid into the seat across from you, a bottle of beer in each hand. You could get a good look at him for the first time today. He had a black hat with a wide brim that hung slightly off kilter, shielding his face just a bit from prying eyes. A dark turtleneck hid most of his tattoos, but you could still see vines snaking out from the cuff on his sleeve, twisting around his fingers as he drummed them against the table. It was out of sync with the tinny classic rock wafting over from the radio at the bar.</p> <p>"Do you feel safer meeting here in public?" His tone was robotic, like he was surveying you, trying to determine if his strategy had been successful.</p> * [[“Better than your basement.”|Cross Start][$temp = "funny"]] * [[“Yes, actually. You're a Northerner yourself- I can tell. You understand."</p> <p>Minister- okay. And the aurora wasn't visible from down South.</p> <p>"Migrants. Much like myself." Levi glanced out the window, out into the street, where folks passed with their heads down. "We make do, separated from the homeland. This city treats us poorly, but we're a resilient kind."</p> * [[“What do you mean, the city treats you poorly?”|Cross Poor]] * [[“How do you 'make do'?”|Cross Make Do]]<p>A dark expression crossed his face. Instead, most members of my congregation work 12 hour shifts handling harsh chemicals in the factories."</p> <p>Say what you want about Levi, but the venom in his voice when he spoke about his followers was a righteous one.</p> * [[“That's terrible. But this sort of thing, it was the future!</p> <<include "socialist">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "socialist" "Socialist">><<goto "Cross Continue">><</link>> / [[NO|Cross Continue]] """---"""</h1>\<p>Levi gazed at you with a sort of pity.
