He moved back towards your hands, just out of eyesight. <<include "Track Chop">></p> <<set $nextpassage = "Track Next">>\ <<set $relationship.levi to $relationship.levi.fm(-10)>>\<p>"My next question," Levi continued, staring down at your restrained form. The tips of his fingers glided along your bandaged side, just barely firm enough for you to feel it under the thick padding. <<if $temp4 == true>>It sent a shiver through you- not even his touch, just an echo of it through layers of gauze. Like static shock. <</if>>"Who, exactly, shot you?"</p> * [[“I can try to describe them.”|Track Describe]] * [[“I don't know who they were! I've never been to this fucking city!”|Track City]] <<unset $nextpassage>>\<p>Your protestations were cut short by the sound of metal clattering to the floor. All of your muscles tensed up, the restraints digging into your wrists as you instinctively tried to curl up into a ball. The little medical supply table next to you was rolling slowly across the floor, and Levi's right hand was gripped around the cleaver so tight his veins were visible. He had it raised a little over your body, his arm ready as if he was going to bring it down directly on your torso. It shook as his arm was gripped by slight tremors.</p> <p>"I told you," Levi muttered in a controlled voice, his anger entirely absent from its cold tones. "You are going to answer my questions. And you will not raise your voice at me. Understood?"</p> <<if Flag("LostFinger")>>\ <p>It was probably best not to antagonize him any more...</p> <</if>>\ <ul>\ <<if not Flag("LostFinger")>>\ <li> [[“No! Fuck you, jackass! I'm not going to answer shit!”|Track Anger Chop]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“Yes, I understand... I just don't know who they were...”|Track Describe]]</li> </ul>\<p>In that same controlled voice, he instructed you, "Spread your fingers out. Wide. You don't want me taking out a second one by accident."</p> <<include "Track Chop">> <<set $nextpassage = "Track Describe">>\ <<set $relationship.levi to $relationship.levi.fm(-20)>>\<p>"Okay. Just tell me. What were they like?"</p> <p>The whole thing was a bit of a blur, but you replayed it in your head like a tape being rewound, scouring it for some kind of info. "There were around five or six of them, I think. All dressed in like, body armour and fatigues and shit. They had these big rifles with them, they must have been fully automatic or something cause they just opened fire and took us all out in one go."</p> <p>Levi nodded. "Very good information. And how exactly did you survive?"</p> <p>"I just got lucky." Thinking about lying there in the ash-wastes, staring up at that sunless sky, seeing Doc standing over you... 'lucky' wasn't the right word for it. You were blessed or something. "A doctor found me and brought me back to the city. Saved my life."</p> <p>Noting that, he promptly moved on. "Was there anything else distinctive? Anything they said? Did you get a good look at any of them?"</p> <ul>\ <<if Flag("SeenWolfe")>>\ <li> [[“Yeah... I actually got a pretty good look at the one that shot me.”|Track Depot]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“No. That's all I saw.”|Track Unseen]]</li> </ul>\ <<unset $nextpassage>>\<p>"He was a little on the short side, freckles, military cut," you muttered, scouring your memory. "I think his voice was... cold. Very cold, very commanding. When he said what to do, everybody did it. So he must have been in charge."</p> <p>"And what did he tell them to do?" Levi was leaning in now, looking down at you much like the man who shot you, his eyes cold and intense like the shooter's.</p> <p>Something... important. There was something you were forgetting. You ran it through your mind again, again, trying to remember what exactly happened. And then it came to you. "He told them to bring it to 'the depot.' Some kind of... storage place, I guess?"</p> <p>Levi's eyes widened. "Perfect. That's perfect."</p> * [[“Now what? Is that everything?”|Track Everything]] <<SetFlag "HonestLevi">>\ <<set $relationship.levi to $relationship.levi.fm(5)>>\<p>"I suppose it is. That's a lot of very good information right there." He reached into his pocket and retrieved something you somehow hadn't noticed- a pristine black pistol. "Now, if you speak of this, know that you will be killed. I have eyes everywhere, and about as many guns."</p> <p>Everywhere? As in, outside this building? Were you actually going to be let go?</p> <p>"It seems that's all you can do for me. You're going to leave, and you're not going to speak of this again. Understood?"</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“Yes, sir! Thank you, sir!”|Track Sir]]</li> <<if $temp4 == "flirted">>\ <li> [[“I thought you were going to leave me tied up when you were done...”|Track Flirt]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“Sure... if you say so.”|Track Sure]]</li> </ul>\<p>His shoulders slumped. "If I find out that you're lying to me, you're dead, by the way," he muttered, though it was clear that his heart wasn't in it. "I assure you that I have eyes... everywhere. And about as many guns."</p> <p>Everywhere? As in, outside this building? Were you actually going to be let go? "Did you have any more questions," you asked, cautious not to anger him in case he changed his mind.</p> <p>"It seems that that's all you can do for me." Levi grabbed his cleaver, and his other hand went to his hip, where you hadn't even noticed a pristine black pistol stuffed into his jean pocket. "You're going to leave, and you're not going to speak of this again. Understood?"</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“Yes, sir! Thank you, sir!”|Track Sir]]</li> <<if $temp4 == "flirted">>\ <li> [[“I thought you were going to leave me tied up when you were done...”|Track Flirt]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“Sure... if you say so.”|Track Sure]]</li> </ul>\<p>"Don't call me sir." He wasn't even angry anymore, he just sounded tired. You supposed that interrogating kidnapped witnesses probably takes a lot out of you. <<include "Track Offer">></p><p>"Oh... were you serious about that?" Oh. Oh. Okay. That changes the dynamic a little. "That feels inappropriate, not going to lie.<<if Flag("LostFinger") == true>> Especially given the fact that I've just cut your finger off.<</if>>"</p> <p>"Another time, maybe?"</p> <p>He snorted, the most genuine expression of a positive emotion you'd seen from him since you met him (about an hour ago). "Maybe. You are... a strange one." Then, his focus shifted back to the matter at hand. <<include "Track Offer">></p> <<set $relationship.levi to $relationship.levi.fm(20)>>\ <<set $flirt.levi += 1>>\<p>"This is not an idle threat. You are going to be killed if you try anything." His calm tone made it clear that he was telling the truth. Somebody with so few emotions was probably capable of anything. <<include "Track Offer">></p>"Now, I'm going to cut you free, but I have a proposal first."<br> <p>You weren't sure if he was in a good place to propose anything to you, but you were a bit of a captive audience, so there was no point in telling him no. "What is the proposal?"</p> <p>"You are leaving here without any money. Of course. You have not delivered the package." Ah, fuck, yeah. You had almost forgotten that that was the purpose of coming here in the first place. Fight or flight response had taken over and money didn't seem as important as keeping all your digits. "I can still pay you what you're due if you agree to give me a hand in tracking that package down. I may need somebody who is not... associated with me. Somebody with a plausible reason to be making such inquiries."</p> * [[Is he fucking insane? No. No goddamn way.|Track Deny]] * [[You don't want to, but... well, money is money.|Track Money]] * [[And get a chance to get to know this hunk better? Hell yeah.|Track Hunk]] * [[Honestly, he kidnapped you and all, but you kind of like the guy. Sure.|Track Like]]<p>"I'm not fucking working for you. After you kidnapped me?<<if Flag("LostFinger")>> And cut off my goddamn finger?<</if>> Fuck no."</p> <p>"That is fair." He grabbed one of your hands, pulling it roughly off to the side as he sliced through the restraint. "It was only a proposal. You are free to go."</p> <p>The straps around your wrist were undone, and you finally found yourself able to sit up. Shaky, you pushed yourself up and shook out your hands. You were going to have marks on your wrists all day.</p> <p>"You're going to walk up those stairs, directly down the hallway, and out of the building. Behave casually, as if you are leaving after a perfectly normal interaction. Do not attempt to stay in the building or take any alternate routes. You will be followed."</p> <p>"Understood." With your legs free, you twisted to let them dangle off the edge of the table and hopped off.</p> <p>Levi gestured with his hand at the staircase. "Your weapon is next to the front door. Don't forget to pick it up on the way out."</p> <p>There went your paycheck. But then again... if this cargo was worth so much, you could probably get a pretty penny for it if you tracked it down first. Just maybe.</p> * [[And you left.|Track Finish]]<p>"Honestly, I really need the cash. You're not going to... hurt me any more, right?"</p> <p>"No. This is all I needed." He grabbed one of your hands, pulling it roughly off to the side as he sliced through the restraint. "You may be expected to be in danger, however. Not much more danger than you've already been in."</p> <<include "Track Pitch">><p>"Call me strange, but I like the cut of your jib, man. I'd be happy to work with you under less... strange circumstances."</p> <p>"That is strange." He grabbed one of your hands, pulling it roughly off to the side as he sliced through the restraint. "But good to hear. <<if $relationship.levi gte 60>>You've grown on me as well.<<else>>Hopefully we'll get along better under... better circumstances.<</if>>"</p> <<include "Track Pitch">><p>"I'd love to work with you, if it means I might be able to see under that //icy exterior// of yours... or your clothes, whichever comes first."</p> <p>"We'll just have to wait and see," he muttered. He grabbed one of your hands, pulling it roughly off to the side as he sliced through the restraint. "I'm going to be honest, one of them seems a little more likely than the other." You had the distinct feeling he was talking about his clothes.</p> <<include "Track Pitch">> <<set $relationship.levi to $relationship.levi.fm(5)>>\ <<set $flirt.levi += 1>>\<p>The straps around your wrist were undone, and you finally found yourself able to sit up. Shaky, you pushed yourself up and shook out your hands. You were going to have marks on your wrists all day.</p> <p>"So what do you need me to do, then?" Levi had gotten to work freeing your legs, and with your ankles newly freed, you twisted to let them dangle off the edge of the table and hopped off.</p> <<if Flag("HonestLevi")>>\ <p>"I'm going to need somebody who is not publicly associated with me to inquire with the local militia about seized cargo." There was math going on behind his eyes- he was still actively formulating this plan as he spoke. "We may need to forge some documents... it can not be clear to them that I was the intended recipient. They would know that you are not me."</p> <p>Why the militia would know who he was on sight wasn't of any concern to you. Maybe you could ask that later. "Yeah, okay. I can lie to some military pencil-pushers. No big deal."</p> <<else>>\ <p>"We still need to determine who was responsible for stealing the package." There was math going on behind his eyes- he was still actively formulating this plan as he spoke. "Perhaps I can send you back to the scene of the crime, as it were. Or we can discuss the likely suspects and attempt to narrow down the list."</p> <p>"You don't seem like you have a very clear idea yet."</p> <p>He shook his head. "I don't. This is a major inconvenience. And we have something of a time limit. Just... how about you meet me at the Juice Bar on Main, and we'll discuss it later, once I've gotten my thoughts in order."</p> <p>"Okay. Yeah, sounds good."</p> <</if>>\ <p>Levi gestured to the stairs. "You are free to leave. Your weapon is by the door. I will see you when you're ready to start. And be prompt."</p> * [[“It was nice meeting you Levi.”|Track Finish]] * [[“Glad this is finally over.”|Track Finish]] * [[“Just please don't tie me up again.”|Track Finish]] * [[“I'm looking forward to when you get to tie me up again!”|Track Finish]] <<set $temp5 = true>>\<h1>"""----""" STORY COMPLETE """----"""</h1> <h5>[[CONTINUE|The Stacks]]</h5> <<completelead "trackingnumber">>\ <<if $temp5 == true>>\ <<addlead "crossroads" "Crossroads">>\ <<SetFlag "WorkingForLevi">>\ <<if $temp3 == true>>\ <<addwealth "large">>\ <<if $temp6 == true>>\ <<SetFlag "LeviOwed" 2>>\ <<else>>\ <<SetFlag "LeviOwed" 1>>\ <</if>>\ <<else>>\ <<SetFlag "LeviOwed" 2>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $playedleads.includes("roseandthorn") and $playedleads.includes("lamplighters")>>\ <<if not $leads.includes("checkup") and not $playedleads.includes("checkup")>>\ <<addlead "checkup" "Checkup">>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <<unset $temp>>\ <<unset $temp1>>\ <<unset $temp2>>\ <<unset $temp3>>\ <<unset $temp4>>\ <<unset $temp5>>\ <<unset $temp6>>\ <<if Flag("LostFinger")>>\ <<if not $pocket.has("Pinky Finger")>>\ <<pocket "Pinky Finger" 1>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\<h1>"""----""" NEW STORY """----"""</h1> <h5>[[LAMPLIGHTERS|KC Intro Door]]</h5><p>You stepped up to the office door, your hand hovering over its rusted metal handle. Turn it, pull open the door, and walk inside. No big deal. Whoever this woman was, you just had to present your case to her and everything would go smoothly.</p> * [[No reason to worry. You're capable. She'll respect that.|KC Intro Confident]] * [[No... actually, you're kinda freaked out. Strong women scare you.|KC Intro Nervous]] * [[You're freaked out, but mostly because strong women are hot.|KC Intro Nervous]] * [[You're like, really charming, so the idea that she wouldn't like you doesn't even occur to you.|KC Intro Confident]] <<set $met.push("kc")>>\<p>You gripped the handle, your hand shaking a little with nerves, and pulled open the rusted metal door.</p> <<include "KC Office Description">> <<include "KC Description">><p>You gripped the handle with a confident hand and pulled open the rusted metal door.</p> <<include "KC Office Description">> <<include "KC Description">><p>Stepping into the office, it was bigger than expected- in the past this wasn't an individual's place of work, rather a conference room of some kind. A large, floor-to-cieling window covered most of the far wall, looking down on the Lamplighters' territory through one-way frosted glass. The light from outside cast dozens of long shadows across the cracked tile floor from the myriad assortment of furniture in here. From that window, you could stare down at the whole complex like a supervillain surveying their territory.</p> <p>A few mismatched armchairs were set up next to an old stained whiteboard, which currently held a few crass doodles and not much else. A huge bookcase sat across from it, without many books- instead, a wide assortment of tapes, game cartriges, CDs, and old memorabilia lined its shelves. An overstuffed couch draped in brightly coloured blankets faced into a corner where a big tube TV was positioned precariously on a steamer trunk. A VHS player, SNES, and PlayStation 2 were all arranged haphazardly around it. Above, faded and creased posters for all kinds of old bands were pinned or stapled to the drywall. The whole place smelled strongly of weed.</p> <p>In the center of the room was the thing that drew the most attention- a massive carved wood desk, all swirls and inlays, something some kind of executive must have had. It was facing towards the door, scattered with papers and office clutter among other things (an overflowing ashtray, a folding knife stuck upright into the wood grain surface). The centerpiece, a white piece of tech you vaguely recognized as a laptop, stunningly small (only a few inches thick) and hooked up to a battery backup with a thick cable. Leaning up against the side was a double-barrel shotgun, break action, all smooth dark wood and polished metal.</p><p>Sitting with her feet kicked up on the desk and a blunt between her lips, the woman you saw there was nothing like you expected. Her dark, coily hair formed a huge halo around her face. She had these big, warm eyes with puffy lids and a wide button nose with a black septum ring hanging underneath. Her thick brows were punctuated by a dark scar through one and a spiked piercing through the other. Not exactly a serious boss who had important work to do.</p> <p>"Hey," KC greeted you. Her voice was low and rough, almost a purr. Smoke wafted from her lips as she spoke. "What brings you to my office, stranger?"</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“I'm really impressed with your operation here.”|KC Intro Impressed]]</li> <li> [[“I'm kinda broke and I heard y'all could help me out with that.”|KC Intro Broke]]</li> <<if $arjunlied == true>>\ <li> [[“Honestly I just lied to Arjun out there so I could meet you.”|KC Intro Lied]]</li> <<SetFlag "ArjunHatesYou">> <</if>>\ </ul>\ <<unset $arjunlied>>\<p>KC leaned even further back in her chair, gesturing broadly to the area. The blunt, nestled between two fingers, let off a mesmerizing trail of smoke as she moved. "This place? This isn't my work, man. It's everybody's work. We all built this place up from nothing. Hell yeah, it's impressive."</p> <p>"But you're the one in charge, right?"</p> <p>"Nah. Not at all." She quickly leaned back towards you, putting her elbows on the desk, her chair snapping back into its basic position. "Not sure how you got past my guys down there without even knowing what we're all about, but maybe I need to explain my organization to you? Always happy to enlighten visitors."</p> * [[“Sure. Enlighten me.”|KC Intro Enlighten]]<p>KC responded with a hearty laugh, balancing the blunt between her index and middle finger as she leaned even further back in her chair. "Hey man, aren't we all? Not much I can do about that, though."</p> <p>"You give out work here, right?"</p> <p>"To my people." She quickly leaned back towards you, putting her elbows on the desk, her chair snapping back into its basic position. "Not sure how you got past my guys down there without even knowing what we're all about, but maybe I need to explain my organization to you? Always happy to enlighten visitors."</p> * [[“Sure. Enlighten me.”|KC Intro Enlighten]]<p>KC snorted at this, rolling her eyes and letting a crooked grin spread across her face. "Jesus, that ain't good security, is it? Never gonna let him live that one down." After a moment of studying your face, she added, "Not sure why you'd want to meet me, though! I'm nobody."</p> <p>"Aren't you in charge around here?"</p> <p>"Nah. Not at all." She quickly leaned back towards you, putting her elbows on the desk, her chair snapping back into its basic position. "Not sure what kind of lie you spun to punk Arjun, but maybe I need to explain my organization to you? Always happy to enlighten visitors."</p> * [[“Sure. Enlighten me.”|KC Intro Enlighten]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(5)>>\ <<SetFlag "LiedToArjun">>\<p>KC gestured to a ratty old armchair across the desk from her. "C'mon, sit down. Let's chat."</p> <p>You were a little caught off guard by her friendliness, but took a seat regardless. The chair was made of a scratchy old jacquard held together with patches of terrycloth and denim, and when you put your weight into it the whole structure audibly creaked with effort. There was a long silence as she took a hit, inhaling deeply and holding it for a couple seconds before letting a trail of smoke trickle out between her lips. Wordlessly she held her hand out, offering to share. With you. A complete stranger.</p> * [[She seems really nice. Take the offer.|KC Intro Smoke]] * [[This is kinda weird. Turn it down.|KC Intro Reject]] * [[You appreciate the offer, but you don't smoke.|KC Intro Reject]]<p>Settling in a little more comfortably in your seat, you accepted the offered blunt- loosely rolled cigar paper, the same sort they sold up North in crowded grocers alongside loose leaf tobacco and cans of dip. <<if $skill.signal gte 1>>Playback in your head, sitting on a rooftop with your first love, your feet dangling off the edge. The cold numbed your fingers like static as you rolled that cigarette balanced on your jeans. You'd pooled your pennies for this, days of work between you. Their eyes were bright, and their breath was visible on the air like smoke. <</if>>You took a pull before passing it back to her.</p> <<include "KC Intro Explain">><p>You shook your head at her offer, and KC shrugged, retracting her hand and reclining back in her seat.</p> <<include "KC Intro Explain">><p>"The organization you've stumbled your way into is called the Lamplighters," she informed you. Her jacket, this bright colour-block windbreaker in purples and teals and greens, was emblazoned with a black icon of the top of a classic streetlamp. The lamp part, with the gas flame going inside. "We're a loose association of mercs who help each other out. Make sure nobody's getting screwed out of a paycheck, y'know?"</p> <p>"Like a union?"</p> <p>KC shrugged. "Guess so. We're just folks helping folks. Not a formal group or anything- we're like extended family."</p> <p>You considered it for a moment. That was nice and all, but it wasn't entirely up to snuff. "Why are you way out here and not, y'know... in the city?"</p> <p>A dark cast fell over her face, a startling change from the relaxed vibe she'd had when you walked in. She pursed her lips. There were two other spikes through them, on either sides of her bottom lip. "You must be new in town, eh? Don't know about the militia?"</p> * [[“I've heard of them.”|KC Intro Mercs]] * [[“I'm not familiar.”|KC Intro Mercs]] * [[“Those assholes? I know about them.”|KC Intro Mercs][$temp to "assholes"]]<p>"Before the smokestacks went up, before the whole place glowed like a Christmas tree, mercs were the backbone of Signal Hill." There was a bitterness in her tone that ran deep. "Needed somebody to scavenge the ash-wastes without getting run through by a reaper, or rough up some thugs who think they can get protection money outta you... that was us. There are a whole lot of people out here in The Graveyard who've got no qualms about taking advantage of city folk like these."</p> * [[“I know what you mean. I used to do this kind of work up North. It's rough.”|KC Merc Identity Confirm]] * [[“Sounds admirable.”|KC Intro Was]] * [[“Sound exciting.”|KC Intro Was]] * [[“Sounds tough.”|KC Intro Was]] <<if $temp == "assholes">>\ <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(5)>>\ <</if>>\ <<unset $temp>>\<p>"It was." She took another hit, smoke wafting out from between her lips and drifting up toward the speckled ceiling tiles. "I was a teenager when Nadir started throwing money around for real, buying shit up. Working low-pay security jobs in the city, mostly. Company started getting some of us folks in as gig workers roundabouts when I was turning 18- I mostly worked for beer before then, but that shit paid way better."</p> <p>KC had a way with words that drew you in. She wasn't eloquent, at least that wasn't the goal- but the casual tone of her voice masked a masterful storysmith. She could lie to your face and you'd start to believe it more with every quip and curse. You weren't sure where this story was going, but you were quicker to question your own inquiry than to question her meandering answer.</p> <p>"I was //buddies// with a girl named Jessie back then, real beauty she was. Hands like a pianist. Softest lips you'd ever touch. She got me in on a bigger job, cause her best friend was the big guy's daughter." There was a fondness in her voice that seemed almost indulgent.</p> <p>"Buddies?"</p> <p>"Yeah." She didn't elaborate. "So I get shipped out there with a caravan to guard the tents at night, big fancy caravan, mind you, not the shit you're probably used to. Functional RVs and shit. Going up to D.A.L. for something or other, diplomacy I guess, I don't really care so I don't really ask. Nadir and his daughter are there. I'm guarding their tents, so I got this shotgun- I've been maintaining her for years, she's in great nick, right? Anyway, I got this shotgun in my lap and I'm sitting on on old folding chair in the middle of the ash-wastes and the moon is red and the dust is heavy."</p> <p>You had to interrupt her to clarify something.</p> * [[“You keep talking about this Nadir guy. Who is that?”|KC Intro Nadir]] * [[“That's a sweet shotgun, man. Old world, right?”|KC Intro Shotgun]]<p>You know exactly what she's talking about- you've been in this business long enough, you remember the long nights and violent altercations. The cruelty of the streets and the feeling of your next meal depending on how a single night went. It was probably different down here, but mercs are mercs.</p> <<if $identity.includes("merc")>>\ * [[And you certainly are one.|KC Intro Was]] <<else>>\ <<include "merc">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "merc" "Merc">><<goto "KC Intro Was">><</link>> / [[NO|KC Intro Mercs]] """---"""</h1>\ <</if>>\<p>The woman's eyes went wide at the opportunity to go on yet another tangent. She braced a hand against the desk and leaned over to grab it, holding it up in front of her on the table like a prized painting. Where her hand grasped the barrel with the blunt between her fingers, the subtle trail of smoke rising off it made the shotgun look like it had just been fired. It had a beautiful stock in dark reddish wood, smooth curves that conformed to the shape of the hands holding it, a polished sheen you could only get from regular care. Two barrels in dark metal were stacked one on top of the other, bright red straps wrapped around their base like laces on a corset. On the side of the stock, a shape had been carved with expert precision and inlaid with gold leaf- the stylized licks of a raging fire, arranged so it could be seen clearly across the shooter's chest as they aimed. KC ran her fingers along the curves of the wood, caressing it like a lover's waist.</p> <p>"Old world, all right. This baby is from 1985. Winchester model 101. Engraving's all custom, though."</p> <p>"How'd you get ahold of a fancy gun like that?"</p> <p>"Won her in a bet when I was 17." Sliding the gun off the table and resting it back against the desk, she muttered, "That's a story for another time, though. What part was I at?"</p> * [[“You were outside the tents.”|KC Intro Tent]] * [[“You were guarding that Nadir guy.”|KC Intro Tent]] * [[“You were a basically a teenager and some rich guy was paying you to guard his daughter.”|KC Intro Tent]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(10)>>\<p>"Oh shit, you //are// new around here, huh?" She was shaking her head, as if this question was unbelievable. "Old riches, who knows where he got it all. Came up here from down South about a decade back, bought up our struggling water treatment facility and modernized the whole operation. Real shrewd business type. Basically sole owner of the whole city, after he bought out the electric plant."</p> <p>"Rich important guy. Got it."</p> <p>KC grinned, shaking her head. "Not anymore, no. Got a bullet in his skull like a month ago. Real public like, too, I heard somebody got the whole thing on tape." She didn't seem to have any sympathy for this murder victim. Maybe a red flag, or maybe this guy was really a piece of shit.</p> * [[“Okay, so you were guarding the rich guy and his daughter...”|KC Intro Tent]] * [[“Okay, so you were sitting outside with the shotgun...”|KC Intro Tent]]<p>"Right. The tent." You realized that if you were going to have some kind of business relationship with this woman, you were going to be reminding her to stay on topic a lot. "Okay, so I'm out in the ash-wastes just up North of here, and there's like one other guard, I don't remember where he was. Basically I'm on my own sitting on an old folding chair outside the tent with a shotgun in my lap listening to the wanderers out in the distance, that little clicking sound, like a clock. Tick, tock. I like that sound, cause it means they're far enough away I don't have to deal with them. And there's only one."</p> <p>The parlance was different up North, but you knew what she meant by the clicking. Not a pleasant sound. Though by far not the worst sound you could hear from the distant wastes.</p> <p>"So at some point during the night, the guy's daughter unzips her tent, which I'm sitting out in front of, and she starts whining to me about the noise and how she couldn't sleep, and I'm sitting here like 'Jesus, what a fucking brat.' Like yeah, no shit it's hard to sleep. You're in the goddamn wasteland." KC took a moment to pause, assessing your reaction, and then added- "Worth pointing out, this is a grown ass woman I'm talking about."</p> <p>The clarification helped. You still weren't sure what relevance this had to anything, but at this point you couldn't really get her to stop telling this story.</p> <p>"Okay, so she's like, 'It would make me so much less scared to have a strong lady looking after me!' And I'm a little dense, so I'm all confused, cause I am pretty strong and sitting right outside. And then I realize she means //looking after her//, y'know..."</p> <p>She had lost the plot by now. This was probably the right point to intervene. Or maybe you could just hear out where this story was going.</p> * [[“Go on.” (Listen very intently to this part)|KC Intro Listen]] * [[“Go on.” (Try to be polite)|KC Intro Listen]] * [[“What does this have to do with the militia?”|KC Intro Interrupt]] * [[“Can you get to the fucking point?”|KC Intro Rude]]<p>As soon as the words left your mouth, KC's whole vibe changed. Her eyes narrowed and she leaned forwards, her hands planted squarely on the desk. The folding knife stuck into its grain was far too close to her hand for comfort. Also, she had a loaded shotgun right next to her.</p> <p>"I'm sorry, am I not talking fucking fast enough for you? Should I remind you who walked into whose damn office unannounced?" She had a hint of an accent there, a sort of drawl that you hadn't noticed before.</p> * [[“Sorry, I don't know what came over me. That was really fucking rude.”|KC Intro Apologize]] * [[“I came here with important business and you're wasting my fucking time.”|KC Intro Leave]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-50)>>\<p>KC laughed. "Okay, shit, man, I guess you probably don't need to hear about a hookup from like 5 years ago to get the point of the story." She leaned back in her chair and crossed her arms across her chest, the purple sleeves of her windbreaker audibly crinkling against each other. "I'm a talkative person. Sue me."</p> <p>"I noticed."</p> <p>"To make a long story short, I fucked the boss' daughter and the other guard fell asleep at his post and a wanderer almost killed the boss. //Almost//. Yours truly scared it off before it was too late, but y'know... not a great job."</p> <p>Yeah. Probably not a great job. "And what does this have to do with the militia?"</p> <p>"Nadir was a paranoid motherfucker," KC continued. "Always kept a guard on him, hated being in public. Guess it was a valid concern, given he got his brains blown out. But yeah. Never mind that his daughter was the one who //distracted// me, he really freaked out after that, thought us mercs weren't good enough- maybe thought it was some kind of conspiracy against him. I don't know."</p> <p>"So he... what, forced you guys out of the city?"</p> <p>She shrugged. "He did what rich people do. He threw money at it. Got some fancy assholes to pretend to be generals, started drafting people to be an 'official' military force. We formed this group to support each other, and after a while he tried to make it illegal for the rest of us to practice. So we moved our operation where those prissy militia fucks won't go."</p> * [[“So how do you still get work?”|KC Intro Reputation]] * [[“So you guys are criminals?”|KC Intro Crime]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-5)>>\<p>"You ever heard of this girl? She's pretty fucking important now that daddy got shot, so I guess you might know about her."</p> <<if $met.includes("yasmin")>>\ <p>"Yasmin? I'm familiar. I've met her."</p> <p>KC raised her eyebrows, recoiling as if shocked by this revelation. It was a clearly unserious gesture, though. "Really? <<if $pro.they is "he">>Mr.<<elseif $pro.they is "she">>Little Miss<<else>>Mx.<</if>> New In Town has met the fucking queen already? Jeez, kid, you get around."</p> <p>"Yeah, we met at a club the other day," you clarified. <<if $relationship.yasmin gte 50>>"She seemed nice enough."<<else>>"Seemed a little... flighty. I don't know if I trust her."<</if>></p> <<else>>\ <p>"I don't think so."</p> <p>"Name's Yasmin. Tall bottle blonde, big nose, sad eyes. Real cute." There was some kind of fondness there. Such a fleeting encounter had clearly left an impression on KC. "Don't bother trying to meet her, I've heard she's gone off the deep end nowadays."</p> <p>"But she wasn't back then?"</p> <</if>>\ <p>"She was a feisty one, I know that," KC laughed. "We were young. She was hot. Her voice was like vodka and her lips tasted like strawberries- if you ever get a chance to kiss a rich girl, you'll see, those fancy tinctures they put on their lips taste like candy..."</p> <p>You could imagine.</p> <p>KC continued, a little more on topic now. "So I'm a little busy, y'know, and I can't really hear what's going on outside because this girl's pretty damn loud, but it's fine, cause there's two guards, right? Like, if I needed to take a piss, it'd be fine, cause there's always two of us. That's how this works. But I guess my colleague guarding on the other side of the camp, rest his soul, he must have fallen asleep or something. So picture me between this girl's legs like a real fucking class traitor, and she goes quiet, and I can hear this //click, click, click// through the canvas like a clock, and I'm like, 'Oh shit.'"</p> <p>By this point, you were captivated. Say what you will about tangents, but this woman was a good storyteller. She took another long drag off her blunt, the smoke wafting from her mouth as she continued her account. "So I grab my shotgun, and I tell her, 'Stay right the fuck here,' and I unzip the tent and look out. And the sound's even louder. Click-click-clicking away from the other side of the camp. I can't see it from here, but I know I'm dead anyway if it's this damn close, so I might as well stick to my guns and be a problem to the very end."</p> <p>Resting her blunt in the ashtray on the table, she reached down to grab her shotgun and hoisted it up to her shoulder, pointing it as if the beast was in the corner of her room. Her hands were steady and worn. "I stalk around the side of the boss' tent as quiet as I can, and I can see viscera all over the fucking place. I don't know how to tell organs apart but even I could tell it was at least a whole human's worth. I come around the side of the tent and I see it there, and before I even have time to react it lunges at me, and I fire the first shot right at its chest. It stops in its tracks and I realize I've got only one more shot, one more opportunity."</p> <p>You already know how this story ends. She is sitting right in front of you. But you find your hands gripping the arms of the chair, your feet tapping against the tile floor.</p> <p>"Instead of the head, I point right at its left... thing. You know, the //things// they have, creepy motherfuckers." Unfortunately, you do know what she means. It sends a shiver down your spine. "The slug rips right through the thinnest part of it and the damn thing screeches louder than I ever heard anything screech. And it's out of there. And I'm standing there in a pile of meat with a shotgun, half naked, victorious." She tucked the gun back away behind her desk, now that it was no longer necessary for dramatic reenactment purposes.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“Cool story. What does this have to do with the militia?”|KC Intro Militia]]</li> </ul>\<p>"Well, after that, Nadir got really paranoid. Refused to hire mercs at all. At first he just got permanent bodyguards, but then it became clear just how much work we did for the company, and he got all freaked the fuck out about it."</p> <p>"So he... what, forced you out of the city?"</p> <p>She shrugged. "Not quite. Y'know, he threw money at it. Hired some fancy people to pretend to be generals and made up the militia, as if it's always been here. We formed the Lamplighters to fight for our rights and ensure everybody was getting paid well. No fucking scabs are gonna get in on our market."</p> <p>"And //then// he forced you out of the city?"</p> <p>"He calls us 'unlicensed military operatives,'" she informed you, her fingers motioning quotation marks to emphasize how silly the title was. "Sent his boys in to harass us, and it got bloody one time. Three of my men died. So we moved out here, where those prissy militia fucks won't go."</p> * [[“So how do you still get work?”|KC Intro Reputation]] * [[“So you guys are criminals?”|KC Intro Crime]]<p>KC laughed. "The militia is awful, and everybody knows it. The people of Signal Hill would rather do shady backroom deals with us than try to get the militia to do anything. We've got a good reputation, a reputation for solid work and reliability."</p> <<include "KC Intro Decision">><p>KC laughed. "By the militia's standards, sure. I don't much subscribe to the militia's standards, though."</p> <<include "KC Intro Decision">><p>Nodding along, you considered the concept. For sure, they were an extramilitary group that profited off of potentially wanton violence. But also, you liked the cut of her jib. These folks had moxie. Or maybe it was the idea of organized labour that really got you going.</p> * [[No... these people are criminals. Why should you work with criminals? With a sigh, KC pushed her chair pack from the desk and got to her feet, the chair spinning slowly on its axis as she approached the window at the back of the room. "I appreciate the opportunity to spin a little yarn, but we aren't accepting new members. Like, ever. That's why we have the ransom fund."</p> <p>Any workplace with a dedicated insurance plan for paying ransoms sounded like a real riot. Not boring, at least. "If you're sure."</p> <p>"Yeah." Everything was pretty much as it was before, with the exception of two things. One, there was now a big manila envelope on the table overstuffed with something- cash, probably. You could snatch it and leave if you wanted, but this place was so well guarded it wasn't really worth it. You'd just get another bullet in your side.</p> <p>Second, KC wasn't sitting at her desk, nor was she wearing the same casual windbreaker as before. She was standing over by the window that overlooked the courtyard, back facing you, staring down at her little kingdom. She was clad in an old, worn leather jacket, and her hands were fiddling with the straps of a scabbard she was wearing over her shoulder. She made for an intimidating sight like this, silhouetted against the bright desert sunlight outside, shotgun strapped to her back.</p> <p>"You came! I assume you're ready to head out, right?" Despite the change of attire, her voice was just as relaxed as when you first met her. You hoped she wasn't going to go into this high.</p> * [[“Of course I came! No way." This may or may not be true.</p> <<include "Test Nickname">>\ <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-5)>>\<p>Striding over to you in her clunky combat boots, KC looked you up and down, contemplating you for a second. "It's, uh... <<print $player.name>>, right?"</p> <p>You nodded. "That's me."</p> <p>"No way I'm gonna remember that. Got a nickname?"</p> * [[“Yeah, I do, actually.”|Test Type Nickname]] * [[“That is my nickname, actually.”|Test Real Name]] * [[“Not yet.”|Test No Nickname]] * [[“I'd rather you just call me my real name.”|Test Refuse Nickname]]<p>So... what's your nickname?</p> <<textbox "$nickname" "Nikki">> * [[Tell her what she should call you.|Test Custom Nickname Agree]] * [[On second thought, maybe let her suggest one.|Test Custom Nickname Disagree]]<p>"It's <<print $nickname>>." </p> <p>KC nodded along, pursing her lips and furrowing her brow. "<<print $nickname>>. Yeah. I feel it." </p> <p>It didn't take a genius to figure out that she really didn't care how hard your name was to remember. She just wanted to call you something fun. This would suffice. </p> <<include "Test Move On">><p>"You know what? The old one kinda sucks." People up North didn't give good nicknames, but people here? They were creative. You assumed. It's a little unclear if all the cool names people have are nicknames or not. It's not like anybody polices what you name your kids<<if $met.includes("truck")>>, so that guy called Truck might have just been named that at birth.<<else>>.<</if>> Either way, you wanted to see if she had a better one for you. </p> <<include "Test No Nickname">><p>"Oh shit." She leaned her hip against the desk, her arms crossed in front of her and her eyebrows raised. "So then what's your real name? Or is it a secret?"</p> * [[“You're right, it's a secret.”|Test Secret]] * [[“I'd rather you just use the nickname...”|Test Concede]] * [[“Nah, I can tell you.”|Test Type Real Name]]<p>"Hm." She narrowed her eyes even further, chewing on her lower lip like she was trying to figure something out. Or maybe just fucking with her lip ring. That could be it too. "I don't think it really counts as a nickname if it's the only name you have. Like, KC isn't my 'real' name, but it sure as shit ain't a nickname."</p> <p>Oh? This was new information. To be fair, KC would be a bit of a weird name- like Junior or something. You wouldn't usually call your kid an acronym. "So if it's not KC, what is it?"</p> <p>KC chuckled, flashing you a set of slightly crooked teeth and the tiniest hint of a piercing through the center of her tongue. "If yours is a secret, I ain't telling you mine, mkay?"</p> * [[“Fair play.”|Test Move On]] * [[“Don't worry, I'll figure out what it stands for eventually.”|Test Move On]]<p>"Fair enough, man. Good with me." She shrugged. It didn't take a body language genius to determine she was a little disappointed. "I'll just call you <<print $player.name>>, I guess."</p> * [[“Thanks.”|Test Move On]]<p>So... what's your real name?</p> <<textbox "$realname" "Nikki">> * [[Tell her to call you that.|Test Say Real Name][$temp = "agree"]] * [[Share it, but ask her not to call you that.|Test Say Real Name][$temp = "disagree"]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(5)>>\<p>"It's <<print $realname>>." You didn't often say //or// hear that name. It lived up North, not here in the big city. Here, you were meant to be <<print $player.name>>.<<if $temp == "agree">> But it was fine. "I'm cool with you calling me that, if you prefer."<<else>> That was in the past. "Just call me <<print $player.name>>."<</if>></p> <p>"Okay. <<if $temp == "agree">><<print $realname>><<else>><<print $player.name>><</if>> it is, then!"</p> * [[“Sounds good.”|Test Move On]] <<set $nickname = $realname>>\ <<SetFlag "RealName" $realname>>\ <<unset $realname>>\ <<if $temp == "agree">>\ <<SetFlag "KCRealName">>\ <</if>>\ <<unset $temp>>\<p>"Suit yourself, I guess." There was a definite disappointment in her voice, though. Not quite sad, but disappointed for sure. "To each his own and all that."</p> <p>"Sorry, just not my thing."</p> <<include "Test Move On">>\ <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-5)>>\<<if $outfit.has("cowboy hat")>>\ <p>"How about Tex?" Leaning her hip against the table, she gestured at your hat with her chin. Her hair bounced lightly around her face as she moved. "Since you like to dress like it's the wild west."</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“I like it.”|Test Move On][$nickname to "Tex"]]</li> <li> [[“How about something else?”|Test More Suggestions]]</li> </ul>\ <<elseif $outfit.has("battle jacket")>>\ <p>"How about Patch?" Leaning her hip against the table, she pointed at your heavily adorned battle jacket. "Y'know. Since you've got a ton of 'em."</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“I like it.”|Test Move On][$nickname to "Patch"]]</li> <li> [[“How about something else?”|Test More Suggestions]]</li> </ul>\ <<elseif $outfit.has("crocs")>>\ <p>"How about Croc?" It really makes a statement."</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“I like it.”|Test Move On][$nickname to "Croc"]]</li> <li> [[“How about something else?”|Test More Suggestions]]</li> </ul>\ <<elseif highestSkill($skill) == "glam">>\ <<if $player.gender == "woman">>\ <p>"How about Dolly?" "You've got that tough guy thing going on."</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“I like it.”|Test Move On][$nickname to "Brass"]]</li> <li> [[“How about something else?”|Test More Suggestions]]</li> </ul>\ <<elseif highestSkill($skill) == "signal">>\ <p>"How about FM?" "Um... let's see... I'm just gonna throw out some random ones..."</p> <p>"Okay. Hit me."</p> <p>"Fox, Dagger, Star, Mongrel, Scratch, Lucky... Any of those good?"</p> * [[Fox.|Test Custom Nickname Agree][$nickname = "Fox"]] * [[Dagger.|Test Custom Nickname Agree][$nickname = "Dagger"]] * [[Star.|Test Custom Nickname Agree][$nickname = "Star"]] * [[Mongrel.|Test Custom Nickname Agree][$nickname = "Mongrel"]] * [[Scratch.|Test Custom Nickname Agree][$nickname = "Scratch"]] * [[Lucky.|Test Custom Nickname Agree][$nickname = "Lucky"]] * [[“How about I just come up with one?”|Test Type Nickname]]<p>"So anyway. Nicknames aside." KC reached over to snatch the envelope off the table, its heft evident from the way it dangled from her fingers. "Are we good to head out? You got your gun?"</p> <<for _item range $heldweapon.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("ranged")>>\ * [[“Hell yeah.” You show it off, eager to impress her.|Test Show Off]] * [[“Yeah, I've got one.”|Test Weapon Agree]] <<else>>\ * [[“Wait, I was supposed to bring a gun? I don't have a gun.”|Test No Gun]] * [[“Why would I need a gun when I've got this?”|Test Melee Show Off]] <</if>><</for>>\<<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <p>You shrugged your gun off your shoulder, holding its hefty metal stock in one hand and the base of the barrel in the other. It was a solid construction, its barrel long and rigid, feeling cold against your skin. Evidently aware that you were trying to show off, KC stepped closer to run her hand along the rifle's cool metal surface. "Damn... that's a pretty nice gun."</p> <p>"I'd say." In this world, everybody's best friend is their firearm. This was a sacred ritual, displaying your connection to your weapon like a peacock with its feathers. Angling it one way or the other, letting her hand drift along its length as she admired it.</p> * [[“It'll come in handy if we need some long-range firepower.”|Test Range]] * [[“Let's hope we don't have to use it.”|Test Range]] * [[“Let's hope we don't have to use it, cause I'm not 100% sure I know how.”|Test Humble]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(5)>>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>You shrugged your shotgun off your shoulder, proudly holding it out for her to admire. It was quite similar to hers, though yours had shortened barrels for easier carrying and more spread.</p> <p>KC nodded, looking over the powerful machine as she stepped closer. "That's a real nice shotgun. Browning?"</p> <p>"I think so." You turned it over on its side, its varnished wood stock cool against your palm. "I got it up North."</p> <p>Her fingers traced along the wood grain. "I like it." A shotgun was less like a weapon and more like a pet- you had to nurture it, clean it, oil it. You were two people in the dog park on a sunny afternoon, leashes in hand, commenting on the pedigree and manners of each other's miniature schnauzers.</p> * [[“I think yours is still nicer. The engraving makes it special.”|Test Engraving]] * [[“I guess between us we've got mid range and short range. Hopefully they all stay within ten feet.”|Test Range]] * [[“Gonna be honest, it's mostly for show. I'm not good with a gun.”|Test Humble]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(10)>>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>>\ <p>Unholstering your pistol, you held it out for her to see- this little machine that was on your hip at all times, keeping would-be robbers at bay and keeping //you// confident.</p> <p>KC wasn't quite as impressed. "That little thing? It'll work, I guess."</p> <p>"What's that supposed to mean?" You'd never been particularly self conscious about the size of your gun, but now that she pointed it out, you felt that familiar sting of defiance in your chest. It wasn't //that// small. Like what, 7 inches? That's big! You'd seen much smaller pistols in your day. And besides, it was really the calibre that made the difference.</p> <p>KC changed the subject immediately. "You're not even going to need to use it, so it doesn't matter."</p> * [[“You're really sure we aren't getting into a fight.”|Test Fight]] * [[“That's good, cause I'm not very good with this thing.”|Test Humble]] <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>>\ <p>Unholstering your revolver, you held it out for her to see. //This// was a real gun. Old school. Real old school, when cowboys roamed the plains with a six-shooter on their hip and manliness in their hearts and good and bad wasn't so complicated. Brings a tear to your eyes.</p> <p>"That little thing?" KC's sneering response snapped you out of your cowboy fantasies. "Yeah, that'll be great if we need to fire six individual bullets at them, slowly, from short range.<<if $outfit.has("cowboy hat")>> At least your getup is appropriate, Tex."<</if>></p> <p>"What's wrong with revolvers? You're using a //shotgun//."</p> <p>"It doesn't matter. You're not even gonna need to use it."</p> * [[“You're really sure we aren't getting into a fight.”|Test Fight]] * [[“That's good, cause I'm not very good with this thing.”|Test Humble]] <</if>>\<p>"We aren't going to need to shoot anybody at any range." She held the envelope aloft again, dangling it in front of you as if to taunt you with it. It looked so heavy... so much cash...</p> <<include "Test Gas">><p>KC let out a long, exhausted sigh. "I... think I'll just assume that was a joke."</p> <p>A joke. Yes. Definitely a joke and not true in any way. "Yup, just a joke."</p> <p>"You're a regular clown." She didn't seem so certain. In fact, she seemed more certain than ever that bringing you on was a bad idea. How could she possibly have gotten that idea? "Please, just... leave the shooting to me. If it comes to it. Which it won't."</p> * [[“Got it.”|Test Leaving]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-10)>>\<p>"Mmm... you think so?" A wistful smile came across KC's face as she adjusted the strap on her back again. The engraved stock of her shotgun was visible over her shoulder, flames rising, lines deep and intricate.</p> <p>Your shotgun was nice, but that thing was a well-loved little masterpiece. Reminded you of those battle jackets you'd see people wearing out in the courtyard, all covered in unique patches and paint. "She's a beauty."</p> <p>KC promptly snapped out of it. "Well, she's staying on my back for today, because we're not getting into a fight." She held the envelope aloft again, dangling it in front of you as if to taunt you with it. It looked so heavy... so much cash...</p> <<include "Test Gas">><p>"I am about 95% certain. We've got what they want right here." She held the envelope aloft again, dangling it in front of you as if to taunt you with it. It looked so heavy... so much cash...</p> <<include "Test Gas">><p>"Good, cause we don't have loaners." She chuckled to herself, as if the very concept was absurd. "Times are tight right now. You feel me?"</p> <p>It seemed like times were tight all across the city. At least, outside of The Heights. At least these folks could probably sell one of their Playstations to get by. Your mind turned to Doc, your free emergency surgery, how much a doctor in The Heights would probably charge for that- times were tight, yeah.</p> * [[“Why's everything... like this? I thought Signal Hill was full of rich people.”|Test Rich]] * [[“This place seems miserable. The city, I mean.”|Test Miserable]]<p>"It is." KC shook her head, a dark smile crossing her full lips. "That's why things are like this. Rich people can't exist without all this."</p> <p>"Without all what?"</p> <p>"The smokestacks, the slums, the drugs..." She gestured broadly, as if to everything and nothing. "If you wanna get rich, you've gotta make everybody else poorer. No other way."</p> * [[“That's just the way of the world. What, you wouldn't want to get rich if you could?”|Test Way]] * [[“If only something could be done about it.”|Test Something]]<p>"Not particularly." She said it with no hesitation. It wasn't a lie. "I've got what I need for me and my friends. We're alive. That's rich enough for me."</p> <p>That certainly might be rich enough for her... but is it rich enough for you? Or do you want something //more// out of this existence?</p> <<include "socialclimber">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "socialclimber" "Social Climber">><<goto "Test Anyway">><</link>> / [[NO|Test Anyway]] """---"""</h1>\<p>She gave that a snorting half-laugh. "Cool it. You just got here, I think you can wait a little while before overthrowing the social order."</p> <p>But maybe you don't //want// to wait? People are clearly suffering here, and the people in charge clearly want it that way. But you could do it better, right?</p> <<include "socialist">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "socialist" "Socialist">><<goto "Test Anyway">><</link>> / [[NO|Test Anyway]] """---"""</h1>\<p>"Enough politics." She adjusted the gun slung over her shoulder and marched past you, towards the door. "We've gotta head out before the weather changes, okay?"</p> * [[“Got it.”|Test Leaving]]<p>She gave you a snorting half-laugh, her eyes rolling. "No kidding. I guess things were better where you come from, huh? Up in the middle of nowhere?"</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“No. If anything, it was worse.”|Test Worse]]</li> <li> [[“People there were a lot nicer. This city is especially bad.”|Test Nomad]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>"The winters were cold and the sun never rose," you muttered, only exaggerating a little. <<if $skill.signal gte 1>>The sky was filled with stars up North, so many stars, shining like windows into distant office buildings.
