She adjusted the strap holding her gun to her back and grabbed the envelope from the desk, tucking it under her arm. "You ready to get going?"</p> <p>* [[“Let's go.”|Test Leaving]]</p><p>"I'm going to assume that was a joke." KC grabbed the hefty envelope off the desk and tucked it under her arm, approaching the door, ready to leave.</p> <p>"No, it's true what they say, people really are nicer out in the countryside. You really get to know your neighbours."</p> <p>KC stared you down, a small, polite smile on her face. "We need to get going."</p> * [[“Let's go.”|Test Leaving]]<p>"There were trees up there too, y'know." You remembered the twisting branches of the towering oaks, their quivering leafless twigs weighed down with snow. Every gust of wind would dust you with a new torrent of the stuff. "And the buildings all had cellars. My grandpa used it to ferment wine down in ours- it was terrible though, bitter."</p> <p>"Cool." KC clearly did not care about the bitter taste of your grandfather's wine or the way the stars shone down on you from the heavens like a million eyes. She tucked the envelope with the cash under her arm and gestured to the door with her head. "We good to head out?"</p> * [[“Let's go.”|Test Leaving]]<p>"That right?" She chuckled, grabbing the envelope off the desk and tucking it under her arm. "What's so great about everywhere else, then?"</p> <p>"Well up North, everybody's really nice. Real spiritual types." This was debatable, but you couldn't talk bad about your home. "Out West, there are real trees with leaves and everything, and their crops have great harvests. Out East... you should see what kind of crazy technology they have."</p> <p>KC shrugged. "I don't know. I like it here. There's always something good on the radio." She adjusted the strap holding the shotgun to her back and propped open the door with her foot. "Ready?"</p> * [[“Let's go.”|Test Leaving]]<p>"You're kidding me, right?" She stared you down, waiting for confirmation that would never come. "Oh my god, you're not kidding. You don't have a gun?"</p> <<if $heldweapon.has('combat knife')>>\ <p>"I've got this." You pulled out your trusty knife... it felt light and pointless in your hands. Why... why did you bring a //knife// of all things?</p> <p>KC sighed, her eyes fixed on the little knife in your hand. It was the face of a woman who was regretting her decision. "You know what they say about knives and gunfights..."</p> * [[“Don't bring one?”|Test Bring]] * [[“You specifically said we weren't going to get into a gunfight.”|Test Gunfight]] <<elseif $heldweapon.has('spiked bat')>>\ <p>"I've got this." You hefted your bat over your shoulder, a menacing sight. Nails jutted out at odd angles. The wood was split and cracked around them.</p> <p>KC narrowed her eyes at you, her upper lip raised. "You think you're gonna club a guy over the head with that before he can shoot you dead?"</p> * [[“Yeah, actually, I'm pretty good at that.”|Test Club]] * [[“You specifically said we weren't going to get into a gunfight.”|Test Gunfight]] <</if>>\ <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-10)>>\<p>"Don't fucking bring one," she repeated back to you, her eyes glaring holes into your flesh. "I guess we're past that point now, though, huh? God, I can't believe I agreed to bring you along."</p> <p>"Can't I just borrow a gun?"</p> <p>"We don't give out loaners man. You'll have to just make do with what you've got." Her voice was dripping with aggravation. Oh no. You'd probably have to work extra hard to get in her good graces now. "Okay, come on. We're leaving."</p> * [[“Yeah... let's go.”|Test Leaving]]<p>"We're not." She held the envelope aloft again, dangling it in front of you as if to taunt you with it. It looked so heavy... so much cash...</p> <<include "Test Gas">><p>"Well, you're damn lucky you're not going to have to prove that to me." She was clearly infuriated with you, but trying to avoid showing it. Holding the envelope up for you to see, she muttered, "This is the difference between you living and dying, by the way. Better be grateful I have this." It looked so heavy... so much cash...</p> <<include "Test Gas">><<if $heldweapon.has('combat knife')>>\ <p>You unsheathed your blade, its metal surface glinting in the light from the window. It was no gun, but it was better than a gun- silent, sharp, fast. You could take out a man from the shadows without anyone hearing a thing. Whether you'd actually need to do that... well, that was irrelevant.</p> <p>KC stared at the knife, and for a moment your chest was puffed and your heart was full of pride. And then she looked back up at your face, her eyes full of bewilderment, and you realized. She was not convinced of the superiority of knife. "Are you kidding me? You just have a //knife?//"</p> * <<link 'You just need to convince her of the incredible value of a knife. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-heart"></i>'>><<glamroll 10 "Test Glam Knife Success" "Test Glam Knife Failure">><</link>>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('spiked bat')>>\ <p>You hefted your bat over your shoulder, feeling the harsh metal of a few nails jutting into your back. It was heavy, that much was clear- a thick, polished wood bat designed for hitting balls at really high speeds without cracking. Turns out that design was also great for cracking skulls. The nails helped, too. Hard to go on living with a nail through your parietal lobe.</p> <p>KC stared at the bat, and for a moment your chest was puffed and your heart was full of pride. And then she looked back up at your face, her eyes full of bewilderment, and you realized. She was not convinced of the superiority of knife. "Are you kidding me? A baseball bat?"</p> * [[“No... a baseball bat with SPIKES in it.”|Test Spikes]] * [[“It's for intimidation. They won't pick a fight if they don't want to get hit by this thing.”|Test Intimidation]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-10)>>\ <</if>>\<p>Time to do it. Time to really wow her. Win this woman over with the power of knife. "A gun's not much use in close quarters, or if we need to keep quiet," you reasoned, your voice confident and self-assured. No, not self-assured. Assured in the power of knife. "Knives, on the other hand... a short blade is the most versatile weapon. You can take care of the loud stuff, and I'll do the stealth kills."</p> <p>KC tilted her head to the side, her eyes softened and her lips curled into a disappointed frown. "Okay, y'know what? It's fine. Just... get a gun when you get the chance. Better to have both than neither."</p> <p>And better to have a //knife// than a //gun//. You hadn't quite convinced her of the revolutionary power of knives, but you had certainly made a dent in her resolve, which was good enough.</p> <p>Tucking the envelope with the cash under her arm, KC stepped towards the door. "You ready to head out?"</p> * [[“Let's go.”|Test Leaving]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-5)>>\<p>Time to do it. Time to really wow her. Win this woman over with the power of knife. "Guns? Guns are nothing." Off to a great start. She was squinting at you, trying to figure out what your angle here was. "Knives are ancient. Powerful. Look at this thing- the sharpness of the blade, the serrations, perfect for cutting flesh..."</p> <p>You held out your combat knife, gesturing wildly to the different parts of it. It was a nice knife, to be fair. Those serrations were good for cutting flesh, and the smooth curved cutting edge was very sharp. That... didn't really matter, though.</p> <p>"Get a fucking gun." Her tone was the kind you'd use to talk to a misbehaving child. "I should not need to tell you that you need a goddamn gun to do mercenary work. Now, are you ready to leave?"</p> <p>You hung your head. Mission failed. You'd have to get her next time.</p> * [[“Yeah, okay... let's go.”|Test Leaving]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-10)>>\<p>"I can see that." Her tone was disapproving. Like a mother who told her kid to clean up half an hour ago and came back to find an even bigger mess. "Do me a favour and get a gun, okay? You can not be going around on official business flailing around a stupid bat. You are going to get shot and die."</p> <p>That was possibly a fair point. It was a little hard to retaliate against guns with a bad. But you'd gotten this far...</p> <p>KC tucked the envelope with the cash under her arm and stepped towards the door. "No time for that now. C'mon. We're leaving."</p> * [[“Okay. Let's go.”|Test Leaving]]<p>Her upper lip curled back as she examined the gnarly looking bat. The nails were a bit rusted and the wood was splintered. There was probably still a little dried blood in the cracks, too. "Actually... you make a fair point. I probably wouldn't fuck with you if I saw that thing."</p> <p>You nodded in approval. "You'd want to fuck with me less if you saw it in //action//."</p> <p>"Well, then, I'll count myself lucky that I won't have to." She grabbed the envelope with the cash off the test and dangled it in front of you- it looked so heavy... so much cash...</p> <<include "Test Gas">><p>Shit, focus on the task at hand. "How are you so sure they're gonna accept that?"</p> <p>KC rolled her eyes at your continued questioning. "I know Jax. He's a money hungry sack of shit. Do you know how expensive gasoline is?"</p> <<if $identity.includes("machinist")>>\ <p>It was really fucking expensive. More expensive than the most costly liquor or the fanciest prostitute. More expensive than most caravan companies were even willing to deal with. After all, what's the point of carrying dozens of pounds of extra fuel if it makes your vehicle a big old flashing sign saying //ROB ME//?</p> <<else>>\ <p>No, actually, you had no clue. You'd certainly walked alongside a vehicle before, being pulled by workhorses- the normal way to travel. The gutted husk of a car or van was a common sight around these parts. A fully functional one was rarer. It must be expensive though, otherwise people would probably use them more, right?</p> <</if>>\ <p>"In and out, no fuss, no violence, real quiet," KC reinforced. "Keep the gun with you. Keep it loaded. It tells them we're serious. But you won't need to fire it."</p> * [[“Got it.”|Test Leaving]]<p>The sun was high by the time you left. You got yourself settled in the passenger's seat of one of the Lamplighters' cars, a bright blue Impreza with the logo stamped on the hood in yellow paint. Not exactly a subtle ride.</p> <p>The leather of the seat was cracked and worn from decades of use. It crumbled under your fingers as you slid them over one of the seams. The dashboard was bleached by the sun, adorned with a dancing figure of a woman in a hula skirt. A pair of fuzzy dice hung from the rear view mirror.</p> <p>"This is Ozzy's ride, just so you know who to blame if it smells like shit," KC pointed out as she turned the key and the engine sputtered to life. It did. It smelled like cigarettes and liquor. "Mind grabbing a CD for me? I can't stand driving without music."</p> * [[Open the glove compartment.|Test Glove]]<p>You started rooting through the glove compartment, hunting for music. There was a manual for the car that had been soaking wet at some point, all the dried pages stuck together. A few packs of old cigarettes. A bottle of cheap whiskey. A few stray bullets. And a little leather case, a just a bit bigger than a wallet, with a zipper around the outside.</p> * [[Keep looking, in case there's anything cool.|Test Zine]] * [[Open the CD case.|Test CDs]]<p>Setting the case of CDs aside, you leaned down, trying to get a good look inside this glove compartment. And you spotted something you'd missed as your hands blindly fumbled around- a little sheaf of paper, no bigger than your palm, with some kind of avant garde digital collage printed on the front. The vague outline of a guitarist, printed in halftone, jamming out on stage. The words "NO REST" and "NO QUIET" arranged in white next to him, and "DEAD AIR" printed in an even bigger font underneath.</p> <<if $leads.includes("zinecollector")>>\ <p>This must be one of those "zines" that the bookseller was telling you about. Some kind of music zine, probably. Some water had made the ink run and the edges of the pages were bent and warped from being shoved in the back of a glove compartment. Nobody would miss it.</p> <<else>>\ <p>What an interesting little curio. Certainly worth taking a look at. Some water had made the ink run and the edges of the pages were bent and warped from being shoved in the back of a glove compartment. Nobody would miss it.</p> <</if>>\ * [[You stuff it in your pocket before opening the CD case.|Test CDs]] <<pocket "Dead Air Promo Zine" 1>>\<p>You pulled the zipper around three edges of the little wallet with a satisfying purr. As soon as the tension of the zip was gone, it unfurled in your hands like butterfly wings. Dozens of transparent sleeves, all containing the holographic glimmer and stamped album cover of a single compact disc.</p> <p>KC put the car in gear and glanced over at the nexus of music in your hands. "Man, Ozzy loves his indie rock, huh? Is that... Neutral Milk Hotel?"</p> <p>Yes. Neutral Milk Hotel was definitely represented. As were several other indie rock bands from the 80s till the end of the world, with some more mainstream shit thrown in for good measure. And a couple other genres too, a bit of hip hop, a bit of metal. If you could accurately judge someone by their music taste, this guy seemed not half bad.</p> <p>Flipping through the CDs, you searched for something you felt like throwing on...</p> * [[Franz Ferdinand sounds good.|Test Music][$tempmusic = "takemeout"]] * [[Gorillaz sounds good.|Test Music][$tempmusic = "clinteastwood"]] * [[Violent Femmes sounds good.|Test Music][$tempmusic = "blisterinthesun"]]<p>Placing your finger in the center hole of the CD, you slid it free of its protective sleeve. You placed it into the slot and the machine whirred as it pulled the disc inside.</p> <p>Outside, KC was pulling out of the garage, past a couple of other cars and bikes the Lamplighters had stored here. It had been some kind of shop class once in its life. Full of machines and lifts and the like.</p> <p>"How often do you drive," she asked as she pulled out into the road. Her voice was raised so you could hear her over the <<if $tempmusic == "takemeout">>fast guitar stabs and hi-hats<<elseif $tempmusic == "clinteastwood">>dark drum beat<<else>>folksy guitar<</if>> playing through the lo-fi speakers.</p> * [[“Only once or twice.”|Test Twice]] * [[“We used to have a car back up North.”|Test North]]<p>"Well, welcome to your third car ride," she jeered. The car was making its way along a road towards the towering buildings of the Graveyard proper. "It's not gonna be a pleasant one. The roads are a little uneven around here."</p> <p>As if on cue, there was a bump so big it nearly sent you flying at the ceiling.</p> * [[Look out the window and try to get your bearings.|Test Out Window]]<p>She seemed surprised by the answer. "Eh? What are the roads like up there?"</p> <p>"There aren't any," you corrected her. "In summer, you can drive anywhere. It's all flat and dusty." In the winter, though, there was the snow- all encompassing, so deep at times that you wouldn't see the ground again until the thaw.<<if $skill.signal gte 1>> A sudden crackling in the stereo sounded like a blizzard from your youth. The howling wind overpowered the song for a moment, before it went back to normal.<</if>></p> <p>"Well, don't expect a smooth ride," KC warned you. The car was making its way along a road towards the towering buildings of the Graveyard proper, and as if on cue there was a bump so big it nearly sent you flying at the ceiling. "Nobody's doing road maintenance around here, for obvious reasons."</p> * [[Look out the window and try to get your bearings.|Test Out Window]]<p>Through the slightly tinted windows, you could see the barren wasteland around you outside. Buildings formed into towers and then megaliths as your driver wordlessly pushed forward, nodding along to the music. They were made of concrete and steel and glass, enormous windows smashed in to reveal collapsing interiors. The sidewalks that stood by were cracked and worn, but not overgrown. No. There wasn't a single living thing in this landscape of ruin.</p> <p>Why anyone would ever want to live here was beyond you. The people who built these things (and you knew they were built by people, even though you couldn't fathom how) must have been masochists. Everything here was decaying, but what wasn't? It was rigid, violent. But secluded in this little steel bunker, cordoned off from it with music resonating through your body, you felt safe.</p> * [[Maybe a misguided feeling.|Test Convo]]As she navigated the vehicle through the ruins, KC tried to spark up some small talk. \ <<if $identity.includes("merc")>>\ "So how long have you been in this business? The mercenary business, I mean." * [[“About as long as you, I guess.”|Test Merc Long]] * [[“Oh, y'know. I picked up gigs when I could get them.”|Test Merc Gigs]] <<elseif $identity.includes("devotee")>>\ "So you've got this... weird vibe about you. What's up with that?" Not a great way of phrasing it, but you got what she meant. * [[“Yes, I'm devout. What about it?”|Test Devotee Devout]] * [[“I guess we have a pretty different belief system up North.”|Test Devotee Belief]] <<elseif $identity.includes("nomad")>>\ "So you're new to the big city, huh?" * [[“This one, sure. But I've been to every big city I can think of.”|Test Nomad Cities]] * [[“Yeah, but I get around. I've been all over the place.”|Test Nomad Place]] <<elseif $identity.includes("hedonist")>>\ "How've you been taking to the big city? Enjoying yourself so far?" * [[“I'd be enjoying myself more if I could afford some damn drugs.”|Test Hedonist Drugs]] * [[“Oh yeah. Clubs, brothels, casinos... you guys really have it good here!”|Test Hedonist Good]] <<else>>\ "So mercenary work... you've done it before?" She seemed almost nervous, that she might have agreed to take on a total amateur with no skills. * [[“I've done it before. I've done a ton of different kinds of work.”|Test Merc Gigs]] * [[“Honestly, I have no clue what I'm doing.”|Test Clue]] <</if>>\<p>"So a while, then." She took her eyes off the road long enough to eye you up again, evaluating you again to figure out how long that must be. "Almost a decade?"</p> <p>"Give or take a few years."</p> <p>She nodded along. There was literally no way for her to figure out if you were lying, but if you weren't, she was impressed. "I don't know what kind of work people did where you came from, but assuming it's the same kind of stuff we do here, that's pretty good."</p> <p>"I told you I know what I'm doing." You could tell that she still needed convincing, but at the very least you were on the way.</p> <<include "Test Signal">> <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(5)>>\<p>"Ah." She nodded along, keeping her eyes on the road. "Work scarce back home?"</p> <p>"The holy wars ended when I was a kid, so by the time I started working, violence wasn't a big industry."</p> <p>Continuing to nod, KC muttered, "Yes. Of course. The holy wars. How could I not have taken that into account."</p> <p>You weren't sure what was so hard to understand. "Yeah, I mean. It was a big problem."</p> <p>"You're from up North, right?"</p> <p>"Yeah." She didn't respond to that. Like it was a rhetorical question.</p> <<include "Test Signal">><p>"Hey, man, I'm not saying anything //bad// about it." She briefly lifted her hands off the wheel to gesture surrender. An overall bad decision, based on how the car swerved sharply to the left before she got it back under control.</p> <p>You weren't really buying that. "Weird isn't exactly a neutral term."</p> <p>"Religious, then. What's up with the... religion?"</p> <p>"I venerate the Lady." It occurred to you that she might not know what that meant. "She's, like, a saint. I sacrifice things for her in the afterlife, and she gives me blessings in return."</p> <p>"Okay. You worship a dead lady." KC nodded, as if making a mental note of this fact. "That's very, uh... religious."</p> <<include "Test Signal">><p>KC laughed. "We don't even have religion in Signal Hill. I mean... I guess people believe whatever the fuck they want. But it's not like they go to church or anything."</p> <<if not $identity.includes("nomad")>>\ <p>"That's weird." To be fair, you hadn't //seen// any churches around- at least not any with the kind of architecture they had back home. It was a little bit odd, but y'know. Different strokes for different folks. "If there's no religion... what do people believe in?"</p> <p>"Uh..." She was a little stumped by this one. "Money? Money buys electricity. Electricity buys life."</p> <p>"So you'd say they believe in electricity then?"</p> <p>"Yeah. That." She wasn't satisfied with that answer. But it was close to the truth.<<if $skill.signal gte 1>> They worshipped the buzzing, gnawing truth deep at your core, the truth that lives in the wires.<</if>></p> <<else>>\ <p>"Interesting." You'd been all over the place since your youth and had encountered many places like this- places unmoored and drifting through reality. You wondered if saints were ever born in places like this, and if they died and were never worshipped. What a tragic existence.</p> <p>"What exactly //is// your... 'belief system'?" KC was choosing her words carefully, and you could tell she was trying hard not to offend you. Might be awkward.</p> <p>"Personally? I venerate the Lady." It occurred to you that she might not know what that meant. "She's, like, a saint. I sacrifice things for her in the afterlife, and she gives me blessings in return."</p> <p>"Okay. You worship a dead lady." KC nodded, as if making a mental note of this fact. "Interesting. Very interesting."</p> <</if>>\ <<include "Test Signal">><p>"What kind of cities? Anything I'd have heard about?"</p> <p>You took a moment to consider it. Places somewhat near here, and big, important. "Um... have you heard of Le Coeur?"</p> <p>"That's to the East, right?" She wasn't well travelled, you could tell that from the uncertain waver of her voice. "Yeah, I've heard of it. What's it like out there?"</p> <p>"Lots of tall buildings," you muttered. "Taller than Signal Hill, but not taller than these things, of course. But they're all made of stone. They've got this huge quarry nearby, where pretty much everybody works, and they use the stone to build more places for more people."</p> <p>She nodded. She didn't have to comment on it.<<if $skill.signal gte 1>> You both understood the beating back of death. You both knew why they quarried.<</if>></p> <<include "Test Signal">><p>"Like what?" She didn't take her eyes off the road, but there was a distinct curiosity to her voice. You were willing to bet she'd never left Signal Hill.</p> <p>You took a moment to consider what to share. Most things were... unexciting. "Well, I accompanied a caravan to Norwood a year or two ago. It's beautiful country out there. Built right up on the edge of a cliff, overlooking a reservoir- the rocks are red, and the water's the deepest violet you'll ever see. They grow practically all the weed in the whole region, something about the soil. You should see the farms- they're really something to behold."</p> <p>The car started drifting off course for a second before KC got control of it again. Her eyes were facing forwards, but her mind was elsewhere. "That sounds... cool."</p> <<include "Test Signal">><p>KC snorted. "Yeah, I guess it's an expensive lifestyle, huh? That why you're trying to get hired so hard?"</p> <p>"Well, there's that. I also got robbed right when I got to the city, so..." You trailed off. It was a shame, really. You would have been having a lot more fun by now if you hadn't lost all your drug money.</p> <p>"Well, I don't mind what kind of drugs you're taking so long as you're doing good work." She wasn't even phased by your robbery story. "Careful, though. Liquor, weed, opium, all of that shit's pretty safe. Anything outside of that and you're gonna start running into some unsavoury folks."</p> <p>You couldn't help but chuckle at that. "I'm not very savoury, myself."</p> <p>"Worse. Much worse."</p> <<include "Test Signal">><p>KC snorted. "//Us guys// don't have anything good. Some of //us guys// are banned from the city and could get in a whole lot of trouble if we were spotted at one of those brothels or casinos."</p> <p>"Seriously?" What a tragic existence.</p> <p>"I'm afraid that's the price of doing business." She didn't seem particularly bothered by it. "I did my fair share of partying in my younger years. Now I'm married to my work, y'know?" (KC could not possibly have been older than her mid twenties, maybe 27 max.)</p> <p>And you got the //best idea ever//. "KC, after we're done here, I'm going to take you to nightclub. Or a brothel. Or both!" You were getting giddy at the idea of bringing your new friend along for some wild shenanigans.</p> <p>All she did was glance at you, one eyebrow raised as if in curiosity. That meant //interest//. She wasn't going to say it, cause like, what if she didn't want to hire you after this? But you could rest easy. She //was// going to hire you, and you //were// going to bring her out for a night on the town, and it was going to be //fucking fun//.</p> <<include "Test Signal">> <<addlead "midnightplayground" "Midnight Playground">>\<p>"I'm not sure if you're joking right now." Those were the words that came out of her mouth, but you knew what she actually meant. It was more along the lines of 'You better be joking right now, or I'm going to open the door and dump you on the side of the road.' She did not have the patience to deal with your shit right now.</p> <p>You chose your words carefully. "I haven't done this kind of thing... in a while. I'm //out of practice//." Just a blatant lie, but better than getting on her nerves.</p> <p>KC nodded. "Okay. Out of practice. We can deal with that."</p> <<include "Test Signal">><p>The conversation lapsed, and you found yourself sitting there in the passenger's seat in silence. Well, silence except for the waves of music beating through the air. <<if $tempmusic == "takemeout">>The bright strumming of guitar in a catchy groove rumbled from the speakers and filled your body, your head subtly bobbing along to the rhythm of the drum.<<elseif $tempmusic == "clinteastwood">>A scant musical soundscape surrounded you, percussion rattling your bones, and a voice with a strong British accent crooned over it.<<else>>The bright guitar and simple drum beat felt out of place here, bringing an unmistakable light feeling into this otherwise dark place.<</if>> Your fingers picked at the worn stitching of the seat, and you could feel the waves wrapping around you. They vibrated your skin and sent shivers down your spine.</p> <ul><li> <<link 'You try to tune in on it. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-tower-broadcast"></i>'>><<signalroll 6 "Test Signal Success" "Test Signal Failure">><</link>></li></ul><p>The buzzing wasn't alien, brought here by the car's speakers. It was the opposite. You glanced at the radio's volume dial- it was barely above zero. This place was not a city. It was a //transformer//.</p> <p>Out the window, you could see it- not with your eyes, but with the motion sensors buried deep in your inner ears. The waves coiled around the buildings, expanding and cavitating. The megaliths around you weren't built for habitation. Their violent architecture was made so for a reason. It was made to synthesize the signal, amplify it, concentrate it. You felt it resonating deep inside you, vibrating every red blood cell in your ventricles.</p> <p>Nearly a century ago, you could see it from space, lit up like a network of stars. You could trace the paths between them in glowing dots. A million living, breathing stars emanating their waves into the atmosphere. You could hear a transatlantic accent beamed into your skull from a billion years ago, three chimes, a long forgotten radio play like the ones from your youth. How had they discovered this? How had they harnessed it to bring about the end? It felt like an unanswerable question.</p> <p>Before you could even try to fathom any of this, you felt a strong force slamming your body against the door and your body lurched forward as the car came to a worryingly sudden stop.</p> * [[Good thing you were wearing a seat belt.|Test Bearings]]<p>The buzzing was getting a little annoying, underlying the music blasting through the speakers. Tuning into it wasn't working, so you'd have to just try to tune it out.</p> <p>As the car turned a corner, you could see a looming construct in the road ahead. About a block away. Massive mechanical beasts piled one on top of the other- a dozen cars, or at least the exoskeletons of them. Rusted and burnt out, they had somehow been lifted on top of each other, a van balanced on two sedans and a city bus with all the windows busted out and the back side reinforced with scrap. It was a wall. A patrolled one, at that. A couple men were holed up inside the bus, and a woman with a rifle was perched on a bench on a wood platform that topped off the right half.</p> <p>"That's them," KC muttered, so quiet you were barely able to hear it. "They know who we are. This'll be-"</p> <p>She didn't get the chance to finish. It happened incredibly fast. A flash of red, a sedan nearly crashing into your door. You would've been blood on the concrete if KC hadn't swerved just in time, losing control of the car, braking just before it crashed into the glass front of a building. You were flung against the door and then sharply forward.</p> * [[Good thing you were wearing a seat belt.|Test Exit]]<p>You tried to catch your breath after the rubber belt robbed you of it. No broken ribs, at least. That was good.</p> <p>Next to you, KC was doing the same. Her eyes were wide. She calmly unbuckled her seat belt and let it whiz back into place. "Are you okay?"</p> <p>"I'm fine." You were, by some miracle.</p> <p>Looking around, desperate to figure out what had happened, you put a few things together. There was a red sedan on your right which had skidded to a stop after running KC off the road. The driver had gotten out and was approaching your door. Over his shoulder, you could see a strange construct- a massive wall that stretched between two skyscrapers, built up out of the long-gutted exoskeletons of vehicles. A van, a half dozen cars, a full city bus with its windows blown out. There was a woman with a rifle sitting up on a wooden platform above, and a couple guys watching you from inside the bus.</p> * [[Fuck.|Test Exit]]<p>By the time you'd gotten your seat belt off, the driver that had run you off the road had opened the door of the car and was yanking you out by the forearm. You yelped and instinctually went for your weapon. Before you could, KC hissed, "Don't! Just be cool." She was willingly climbing out of the car, keys in hand.</p> <p>You weren't shoved to the ground or shot. Once you'd been pulled from the Impreza, you were pushed in the direction of the stronghold and told to walk, a pistol between your shoulderblades. "No funny stuff, understood?"</p> <p>KC didn't let you answer that. "We're just here to get Ozzy back, man. We don't mean you any trouble."</p> <p>"You fuckers are always trouble." The guy's voice was dripping with acid. He pointed the gun at her, gesturing for her to walk.</p> * [[You calmly approach the wall along with KC.|Test Approach][$temp = "calm"]] * [[You approach the wall along with KC, but unwillingly.|Test Approach][$temp = "unwilling"]]<p>The compound loomed over you. Automobiles, scrap metal, and wood jutting out at odd angles. Platforms balanced above, where the sniper was sat, aiming between the two of you. This was bad.<<if $temp == "calm">> But you were maintaining your composure.<</if>></p> <p><<if $temp == "calm">>KC was just as calm as you were presenting yourself.<<else>>KC was far calmer and more compliant than you.<</if>> She had the envelope of money in her hands and was taking confident strides, looking up at those platforms. Like she expected something.</p> <p>And as you stepped within fifteen feet or so from the structure, it became clear what that was. Rising over the wall and stepping out onto the rickety wooden platform, two figures. One, a woman, gruff and built like a brick. Her ginger hair was shaved up either side and cropped short in the middle. A smattering of freckles across her cheeks might have made her look cute in another life. But it couldn't quite outweigh the thick kohl under her eyes and deep scars carved into her skin.</p> <p>The guy she was holding by the upper arm, on the other hand, was an exact opposite. Scrawny, pale, shorter than her by at least a foot. His hair was dark and teased, or maybe just naturally that frizzy. The look on his face was one of deep discomfort and even deeper embarrassment.</p> * [[The two of you stopped, and the woman started to talk.|Test Mercy]] <<unset $temp>>\<p>"So you've come for your man, huh? Just on time, too!" Her tone was exaggerated, like some kind of supervillain. It was either a little too much or kinda hot, depending on your perspective. "KC, we had some big plans for Ozzy here that you've interrupted!"</p> <p>KC stood there in silence for a moment, just staring. Her eyes were squinted and her arms were crossed. Looked like she was trying to figure something out. Then she spoke up. "Uh... Mercy?" (From context clues, that appeared to be her name, not a request.)</p> <p>"Do you not recognize me?" Mercy looked almost comically offended. Everything she did was over the top. A real showman. She could've been an actress if she wasn't a violent gang member.</p> <p>"No, I wouldn't forget that face in a million years," KC snapped back. "Where's Jax?"</p> <p>Mercy chuckled, a grin forming on her face. "Oh, dear... you didn't hear? He died a couple months ago. Really tragic. //Somebody// shot him in the head."</p> <p>"Oh." KC glanced over at you. The look was something in between a shrug and concern. It was a //plans might be changing// kind of look.</p> <p>"You know what that man was like, KC! He was so money hungry, he couldn't keep his hands out of the community's resources. So I guess //somebody// decided to take action!"</p> <p>KC looked like she wasn't taking a single second of this seriously. Well, what she was saying might have been true- she probably did kill the gang's previous leader. Gangs were like that, probably. But the overwrought persona was falling on deaf ears. "You're a real piece of work, Mercy," KC shouted up. "This is why I stopped hanging out with you when we were twelve."</p> * [[Okay, maybe you misread this situation a little.|Test Misread]]<p>"Ozzy, are you okay? Have they hurt you?"</p> <p>Mercy laughed, shoving her captive to the ground and earning a concerned yelp from Ozzy. "I've treated him just fine, KC. Clearly I'm feeding him better than you did." Ozzy gave a quiet thumbs up from where he was kneeling on the ground. Evidently, he wasn't too worse for wear. Although his ego looked pretty bruised.</p> <p>"We're here to negotiate, Mercy." KC's voice wasn't wavering an inch. She was experienced with this. She had done it before.<<if $skill.savvy gte 1>> You'd be willing to bet, based on her demeanour and the smooth tone of her voice, that she was the one specifically chosen for this task by her people- KC was more negotiator than fighter these days.<</if>> "Go on, name your price." The indifference was calculated. She was projecting pure in-charge energy right now, even with a gun to her head. She was balancing most of her weight on one foot, the other casually tapping the concrete.</p> <p>"I'm afraid the price is higher than you could afford." Equally unphased. If anything, her voice was full of glee. A righteous smirk had crossed Mercy's cracked lips. "We aren't taking this flagrant disrespect for our territory lightly anymore, KC. We'll be making an //example// of your friend here. It'll be a real spectacle! That's why I've invited you."</p> <p>"We don't even know where your territory is! Can you give us like, a map or something? I swear it changes every fucking week."</p> <p>You muttered something under your breath to KC.</p> * [[“I feel like maybe we misjudged this situation a little.”|Test Shut Up]] * [[“This doesn't seem as easy as you made it out to be.”|Test Shut Up]] * [[“A spectacle? That sounds fun...”|Test Shut Up]] * [[“We might need to start shooting.”|Test Shut Up]]<p>KC hissed back, "Shut up, <<if def $nickname>><<print $nickname>><<else>><<print $player.name>><</if>>." Her patience was very quickly wearing thin. This was not where this was supposed to head.</p> <p>Fumbling with the pocket of her jacket for a moment, KC produced something you hadn't seen before- a clear plastic bag stuffed with cash. Not as big as the envelope from the office. Presumably, this had been //in// the envelope from the office. "This is all I've got, Mercy. Can you do an old friend a favour and let us be on our way?"</p> <p>Mercy took one look at the amount and her face filled with mirth. "Are you kidding me? No. The entertainment value alone is worth at least double that."</p> <p>A pause. You were wondering if you should intervene.</p> <ul>\ <<if $wealth gte 4>>\ <li> [[You've got money! More than enough money to pay for this loser.|Test Pay Ransom]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> [[You could intervene... if you had enough money. But you just can't afford that.|Test Stay Silent]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Yeah... it's probably best to leave this to KC.|Test Stay Silent]]</li> </ul>\<p>You kept your lips strategically shut. <<if $skill.savvy gte 1>>KC clearly had a plan here, so it was probably best to let her execute that plan rather than interfere.<<else>>You were completely out of your depth here, and it wasn't even clear if she'd accept a ransom at all.<</if>></p> <p>KC let out an exaggerated, haggard sigh. "If I //have// to... I can dip into my personal money..." She reached into her pocket again, feigning how difficult it was to find what she was looking for. And her hand emerged with a fistful of loose cash, way more than the average person would actually carry. "This is all I have. It's about double."</p> <p>"No." Mercy crossed her arms, her eyes narrowed at the two of you. She sharply kicked her captive in the ribs with her steel toed boot, and poor Ozzy reacted accordingly. "Double that, or nothing."</p> <ul>\ <<if $wealth gte 4>>\ <li> [[You could probably afford to double that...|Test Pay Ransom]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> [[Double that? Insanity.|Test Refuse]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[This is really, really bad.|Test Refuse]]</li> </ul>\<p>Slow to avoid any twitch reactions, you got some of the money stored in your pockets together. Boy, it was probably a really bad idea to carry this much money around except for this very specific situation. What luck!</p> <p>"I have more cash." You shuffled through the stack of cash, showing off that it was very real and very much enough. "How about all of this together?"</p> <p>All the wind was taken out of Mercy's sails. "That's... a lot of money."</p> <p>KC was quiet. You were on your own here.</p> <ul>\ <li> <<link "“Nobody can't be bought. C'mon, just let us leave, I'll hand over all of this.” (4<i class='fa-solid fa-coins'></i>)">><<spendwealth 4>><<goto "Test Hand Over">><</link>></li> <li> [[“Actually... one second thought, y'know what? I like your idea better. What's the spectacle?”|Test Spectacle]]</li> </ul>\<p>The pause was long, drawn out, as Mercy stared down at you from on high. The two of you stood bolt upright, hands full of cash, ready to react at any moment.</p> <p>But you didn't need to. "Take the money," Mercy snapped at her man, the one standing behind you with the pistol aimed at you.</p> <p>The guy started to move, but KC stopped him, shouting a response back- "Not until you bring Ozzy down here."</p> <p>Without any hesitation, Mercy dug the toe of her boot under Ozzy's side and pushed hard enough to roll him off the edge of the platform. He landed with a thud on a jutting out car underneath, his limbs a flailing mass, and then toppled off that car onto the concrete below. By all means, he should have probably broken several bones, but instead he scrambled to his feet and rushed towards the two of you. His saviours. Kind of.</p> <p>The guy behind you holstered his pistol and started collecting the money from your hands. <<if $wealth lte 4>>So... much... money...<<else>>What a good deal! It was a lot, but you could afford a lot.<</if>> KC gave it up freely.</p> <p>"Okay. We're going to leave now." Her speech was measured, careful. "We're good. Right? All good."</p> <p>Mercy nodded, a pout on her lips. "Fine. Go ahead. We'll find our fun elsewhere."</p> * [[Success! This was the most boring and expensive way you could possibly deal with this situation!|Test To The Car]]<p>Mercy tapped her foot on the wood platform, staring down, her eyes flicking between the two of you. "Nothing? Going... going... okay, your opportunity is gone. Time for the spectacle!"</p> <p>"Don't hurt him," KC shouted back. "Seriously. He was just trying to do his job."</p> <p>"Oh, we aren't going to hurt him." A smile spread across Mercy's lips, like this was just the line of questioning she'd been hoping for. "See, we've been working on a new construction project, and I think the two of you are going to want to see it. A nice new arena. The kid wins against my strongest man, he goes free, free of charge! How does that sound?"</p> <p>The scrawny guy's eyes widened. Yeah. He was not going to be winning any fights any time soon. Shit.</p> * [[Take stock of the situation. You need a battle plan.|Test Stock]]<p>"Oh, you're gonna love it!" Mercy beamed. She didn't want money- she wanted to show off. "See, we've been working on a new construction project, and I think the two of you are going to want to see it. An arena. Things are pretty boring around here, so we're getting into the //entertainment// business, and your friend here is going to get to be in our first match! The kid wins against my strongest man, he goes free, free of charge! If not... well, then the entertainment starts. How does that sound to you?"</p> <p>The scrawny guy's eyes widened. Yeah. He was not going to be winning any fights any time soon. Shit.</p> * [[Take stock of the situation. You need a battle plan.|Test Stock]]<p>The sun hung high in the sky, casting the scene in a warm orange glow. The dust-choked streets of The Graveyard were the perfect setting for a gunfight. Surrounded by stripped cars, there were plenty of places for cover- but that tower of automobiles made for an advantageous position. This was going to be a tough fight.</p> <ul>\ <li> <<link "Try to formulate a plan. <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-four'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-four'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-brain'></i>">><<savvyroll 8 "Test Savvy Success" "Test Savvy Failure">><</link>></li> </ul>\<p>In a split second, your eyes flicked back and forth to take in the different players.</p> <p>Mercy. Unarmed, maybe. There wasn't a gun in her hands or strapped to her back, at least. You couldn't tell, at this angle, if she had a pistol at her hip. Even if she did, she was far enough away to hinder her aim.</p> <p>The same couldn't be said for the sniper. Well, not quite sniper- there wasn't a scope on her rifle, but hitting you from that distance with a gun like that would be trivial for anybody with decent aim. If her aim was particularly good, she'd probably be able to take you out in one shot before you could do anything to react. Bad news.</p> <p>The guys inside the bus were the least of your concern. They were at eye level with you, so you could get a decent enough look at them- they were the type to get liquored up to make "guard duty" bearable. They were barely even paying attention to you, too busy passing a bottle back and forth. Chances are they'd run before you even got the chance to shoot them.</p> <p>And the final threat. The guy behind you. He was a big concern, but with a major caveat- he only had one gun, currently pointed at KC. Both of you were in range to attack him. If either one of you were to do so, it would be an even enough fight. You'd just have to be quick enough on the draw to catch him off guard.</p> <p>Glancing over at KC, you caught her eyes. She gave you a very faint nod.</p> * [[Now or never.|Test Plans]]<<for _item range $heldweapon.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("ranged") and not $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>One of you was going to have to go after the guy behind you no matter what. There was no way to take cover from both him and the sniper at the same time. Your gun was probably a better fit for a ranged attack than KC's shotgun, so you could take out the sniper while she took care of him. Or alternatively, you could take him out to give her the chance to run for cover.</p> <<else>>\ <p>One of you was going to have to go after the guy behind you no matter what. There was no way to take cover from both him and the sniper at the same time. But you weren't exactly equipped to take out that sniper- KC's shotgun would be a long shot, but the only shot. If you took care of the guy aiming at her, she'd at least have the chance to run for cover.</p> <</if>><</for>>\ <ul>\ <<for _item range $heldweapon.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("ranged") and not $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <li> <<link 'Take out the sniper. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>'>><<precisionroll 8 "Test Precision Success" "Test Precision Failure">><</link>></li> <</if>><</for>>\ <li> <<link 'Take out the guard behind you. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>'>><<speedroll 8 "Test Speed Success" "Test Speed Failure">><</link>></li> </ul><p>You met eyes with KC, and she nodded just slightly. Your mind reeled. What kind of plan could you possibly come up with here? The deck was stacked so thoroughly against you. There was a gun pointed at your companion, a sniper up on the platform, and several other guards who'd surely start shooting as soon as they could. There was only one option.</p> * [[Unbridled violence. Attack the guy behind you.|Test Speed Failure]]<p>The sun hung high in the sky. Your eyes locked on the sniper. Like slow motion, she was moving her rifle into position, sunlight glinting off the lens of her scope.</p> <<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <p>Shrugging your rifle off your shoulder, it fell right into position. Your hands were worn in these shapes, like the familiar curves of a lover's body. The barrel lined up, you shut one eye and squinted through the scope. Through it, you could see she was doing the same for you.</p> <p>A shot rang out, suspended in the air like dust hanging in a ray of light. The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. For just a moment you could see blood gushing from the side of her head before her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>Shrugging your shotgun off your shoulder, it fell right into position. Your finger hovered over the trigger with one hand, the other aiming the shortened barrels up at the platform above. The barrel of her rifle stared back at you. Through her scope, she was watching you point your shotgun. The ultimate hail mary.</p> <p>The blast was loud, and the recoil shoved you back.</p> <p>Buckshot ripped through the metal of the cars and lodged into their frames. The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. A trickle of blood leaked from the center of her forehead before her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>>\ <p>Your hand went to your side, falling into the familiar grooves of your pistol's grip. A finger slid over the trigger, and in an instant you whipped it out and had the muzzle pointed squarely at the sniper. Over the sight, you could see her scope looking you straight between the eyes.</p> <p>One shot went off. Miss. Another. Miss. Third one. Bingo. You'd gotten her just before she could pull the trigger. The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. You couldn't even see where you'd hit her as her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>>\ <p>Your hand went to your side, falling into the familiar grooves of your revolver's grip. A finger slid over the trigger, and in an instant you whipped it out had the muzzle pointed squarely at the sniper. You could see her scope looking you straight between the eyes.</p> <p>A shot went off. One out of six. But you didn't need the other five. The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. You couldn't even see where you'd hit her as her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <</if>>\ <p>Behind you, the sound of metal hitting pavement as the guard's gun skittered out of reach. You turned to see KC's beloved shotgun pointed at the guy's head. His hands were up, a sign of surrender. Didn't want to get his brains blown out for this gang. Smart.</p> <p>Looking back to the wall, the bus was empty. They'd fled as soon as the shooting started. Mercy was standing over you, her brow furrowed. She didn't have a gun drawn. At least not yet.</p> * [[“You're outgunned, Mercy. Hand him over.”|Test Hand Over]] * [[“...KC? Should I shoot her too?”|Test Mercy Shoot]]<p>The sun hung high in the sky. Your eyes locked on the sniper. Like slow motion, she was moving her rifle into position, sunlight glinting off the lens of her scope.</p> <<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <p>Shrugging your rifle off your shoulder, you fumbled to get it into position. The pressure was killing you. The barrel lined up, you shut one eye and squinted through the scope. Through it, you could see she was doing the same.</p> <p>A shot rang out, suspended in the air like dust hanging in a ray of light. Nothing. You missed. Fuck.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>Shrugging your shotgun off your shoulder, you fumbled to get it into position. Your finger hovered over the trigger with one hand, the other aiming the shortened barrels up at the platform above. The barrel of her rifle stared back at you. Through her scope, she was watching you point your shotgun. The ultimate hail mary.</p> <p>The blast was loud, and the recoil shoved you back.</p> <p>Buckshot ripped through the metal of the cars and lodged into their frames. Through a wisp of smoke, you saw the sniper... unaffected. Not a single pellet hit her. Fuck.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>>\ <p>Your hand went to your side, fumbling with your pistol's grip. A finger slid over the trigger, and as quickly as you could you whipped it out and aimed it at the sniper. Over the sight, you could see her scope looking back.</p> <p>One shot went off. Miss. Another. Miss. Third one. Miss. Fuck. Fuck. Fuck.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>>\ <p>Your hand went to your side, falling into the familiar grooves of your revolver's grip. A finger slid over the trigger, and in an instant you whipped it out had the muzzle pointed squarely at the sniper. You could see her scope looking you straight between the eyes.</p> <p>A shot went off. One out of six. Missed. You went to pull the hammer back, but by that point your opportunity was gone. Fuck.</p> <</if>>\ <p>Behind you, the sound of metal hitting pavement as the guard's gun skittered out of reach. Great. He was unarmed. But then a single shot went off.</p> <p>You weren't hit. Thank god. But turning around, you realized the situation wasn't nearly as good as you thought. KC was hunched over, her hand clutching her shoulder and pain in her eyes. The sniper had missed her head, at least.</p> <ul>\ <li> <<link 'Try one more time. You can hit the sniper. You just need one more shot. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>'>><<precisionroll 6 "Test Second Try Success" "Test Second Try Failure">><</link>></li> <li> [[KC's hurt. You've gotta take out that guard before he attacks her.|Test Precision Dead]]</li> </ul>\ <<SetFlag "KCShot">>\<p>The guard behind you started towards his gun, but the shot only slowed KC for a moment. Before you could even worry about her, she'd lunged at him, tackling the guy to the ground. Her blood got all over his hoodie as they struggled, his hand reaching towards the pistol and her fists hammering on his face.</p> <<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. Methodical, practiced, you lifted the bolt and pulled it back to eject the cartridge. Up on the platform, your sniper was mirroring your movements exactly. You pushed the bolt forward, feeling the resistance as you chambered another round. The sniper did the same.</p> <p>Staring down the scope again, you steadied your hands and took a deep breath. If you didn't land this, she was going to land hers. Now or never.</p> <p>Another shot. Your ears rang. The sniper never got the chance to respond. The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. For just a moment you could see blood gushing from the side of her head before her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. You had one more shot. Entropy might have fucked you over the first time, but you could still bring this back. With one more chance, you pointed your shotgun up at the sniper.</p> <p>The blast left your ears ringing. The sniper never even got the chance to chamber another round. The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. A trickle of blood leaked from the center of her forehead A trickle of blood leaked from the center of her forehead before her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. You'd only fired off a couple shots so far, and you had many more in you. She'd landed one hit, but you had an advantage- she had to reload. You could just keep shooting.</p> <p>You took a deep breath and pointed your pistol at her again. One more shot. Missed. She pulled the bolt back and chambered another round. Another. Hit. The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. You couldn't even see where you'd hit her before her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. You still had five rounds. She'd landed one hit, but you had an advantage- she had to reload. You could just keep shooting.</p> <p>You took a deep breath and pointed your revolver at her again, trying to steady your hands. This was your best chance. She pulled the bolt back and chambered another round, and you pulled the trigger.</p> <p>The rifle clattered to the wood platform below her, tipped just slightly off the edge, and tumbled down the side of the wall. You couldn't even see where you'd hit her before her body, too, fell out of sight.</p> <</if>>\ <p>At the same time, the commotion on the ground ceased. You turned to see KC stumbling to her feet, triumphant, the guard lying flat on the pavement. His nose was broken and there was blood all over him, but his chest was still rising. She was barely worse for wear (aside from the bullet hole). She shrugged her beloved shotgun off her shoulder and nodded to you.</p> <p>Looking back to the wall, the bus was empty. They'd fled as soon as the shooting started. Mercy was standing over you, her brow furrowed. She didn't have a gun drawn. At least not yet.</p> * [[“You're outgunned, Mercy. Hand him over.”|Test Hand Over]] * [[“...KC? Should I shoot her too?”|Test Mercy Shoot]]<p>The guard behind you started towards his gun, but the shot only slowed KC for a moment. Before you could even worry about her, she'd lunged at him, tackling the guy to the ground. Her blood got all over his hoodie as they struggled, his hand reaching towards the pistol and her fists hammering on his face.</p> <<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. Frantic, you lifted the bolt and pulled it back to eject the cartridge. Up on the platform, your sniper was mirroring your movements exactly. You pushed the bolt forward, feeling the resistance as you chambered another round. The sniper did the same.</p> <p>Staring down the scope again, your hands were shaking. If you didn't land this, she was going to land hers. Now or never. You took the shot... and it whizzed past her head. Your stomach dropped.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. You had one more shot. Entropy might have fucked you over the first time, but you could still bring this back. With one more chance, you pointed your shotgun up at the sniper. The shot was loud enough to leave your ears ringing, but in the wake of it, your stomach dropped. The sniper was fine.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. You'd only fired off a couple shots so far, and you had many more in you. She'd landed one hit, but you had an advantage- she had to reload. You could just keep shooting.</p> <p>You tried to steady your hands long enough to aim at her. One more shot. Missed. She pulled the bolt back and chambered another round. Another. Missed. She was looking at you through her scope. Another shot. Missed. Your stomach dropped.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>>\ <p>No time to worry about that. You still had five rounds. She'd landed one hit, but you had an advantage- she had to reload. You could just keep shooting.</p> <p>You took a deep breath and pointed your revolver at her again, struggling to steady the tremor in your hands. This was your best chance. She pulled the bolt back and chambered another round, and you pulled the trigger. And... nothing. She was fine. Your stomach dropped.</p> <</if>>\ <p>Getting shot was a familiar feeling by now, but the location made all the difference. You only had a moment to clock where she'd hit you. Your legs failed and your gun clattered to the pavement. Blood was gushing from a hole in your chest.</p> * [[This time, there's no miracle doctor to rescue you.|Test Dead]]<p>You whip around to aim your gun at the guy. Over his shoulder, you can see KC's wide eyes staring you down. You aim, you fire, and he's down. And through the ringing in your ears, you hear another distant bang.</p> <p>Getting shot was a familiar feeling by now, but the location made all the difference. You only had a moment to clock where she'd hit you. Your legs failed and your gun clattered to the pavement. Blood was gushing from a hole in your chest.</p> * [[This time, there's no miracle doctor to rescue you.|Test Dead]]<p>You could feel where the guard was standing behind you, even without looking. The waves, the air pressure, something. The gun was aimed at KC. He wasn't looking at you. He wouldn't know what hit him, if you were quick enough. This was your chance.</p> <<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <p>A rifle is certainly not the most agile of weapons, but like a skilled hunter<<if $identity.includes("nomad")>> lurking in the dead forests of the Western mountains, aiming at a prized buck<</if>>, you knew this machine well. Its stock had worn its place in your shoulder, your finger twitched sometimes, curling around an invisible trigger. In less time than it'd take to notice and react, you'd gotten it off your shoulder and in position staring the guy in the face.</p> * [[You pull the trigger.|Test Speed Shoot]] <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>The humble shotgun. An inelegant firearm, some would argue. You wouldn't agree. Your hands were worn in the shape of this weapon, and it was worn into the shape of your hands. The metal no longer chafed your skin, the wood was polished by wear. In less time than it'd take to notice and react, you'd gotten it off your shoulder and in position staring the guy in the face.</p> * [[You pull the trigger.|Test Speed Shoot]] <<elseif $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>>\ <p>Your pistol was designed for this. In some boardroom a hundred years ago, people had pointed at diagrams with long metal rods and discussed for hours the exact curves of its grip, the placement of its sights, the way your finger slid into the groove of the trigger. The perfectly engineered 20th century killing machine, at your hip. In less time than it'd take to notice and react, you'd drawn, aimed, staring him in the face over your sights.</p> * [[You pull the trigger.|Test Speed Shoot]] <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>>\ <p>This was exactly the kind of thing you'd see in an old western. The sun at high noon, ash blowing in the wind around the handsome hero<<if $outfit.has("cowboy hat")>> in <<print $pro.their>> fancy hat<</if>> with a revolver at their hip. A test of speed and marksmanship. The quick draw. As fast as the guys wearing white on the television, you had your firearm drawn and whipped it around to aim at your foe.</p> * [[You pull the trigger.|Test Speed Shoot]] <<elseif $heldweapon.has('combat knife')>>\ <p>This is what your ancestors did, before the invention of gunpowder, when everybody ran around in sweaty armour hitting people with swords. A deep, primal instinct. //Stab//. You pulled it from its sheath, your teeth gritted, your fingers wrapped tight around the grip. In less time than it'd take to notice and react, you were upon him.</p> * [[You stab him. Several times.|Test Speed Stab]] <<elseif $heldweapon.has('spiked bat')>>\ <p>This is what your ancestors did, before they had metal and gunpowder and industry. Before they even started flaking rocks off and lashing them to sticks, the original weapon- bashing a gazelle over the head with the stick itself. Your hand gripped the handle of your bat, and you whipped around, ready to strike.</p> * [[You whack his skull with your bat.|Test Speed Bash]] <</if>>\<p>You pulled the trigger, and for a just a moment, the world went silent. Your ears rang. There was a whole lot of blood gushing from the hole in his head, some brain matter too. The guard's body slumped to the floor inelegantly. Your hearing cut back in just in time to hear the crack of his skull against the pavement. He wouldn't be able to feel that, at least.</p> <p>Before you could properly take in the horror of what had just happened, you lurched back as a bullet whizzed past your head. The sniper. Shit. KC had already dived for cover, back against the husk of a car parked at an odd angle on the road. You should probably do the same.</p> * [[You run to the car where she's hiding.|Test Cover KC]] * [[You duck behind the car that's closer to you.|Test Cover Close]]<p>The force of your body against his knocked the guy to the ground in an instant. The gun skittered off along the pavement. He struggled against you as you straddled him, holding his shoulder down with one hand, the other raised above your head. He was grabbing at your arm, trying to keep you from getting the knife into his soft flesh. Good luck with that.</p> <p>All this horseplay meant that your first strike missed his vital organs, lodging into his shoulder instead, yielding a distressed scream. As you went to strike again, though, you heard the distinct whistle of a bullet whizzing straight past your head. The sniper. Fuck. You were right out in the open.</p> * [[Run for cover.|Test Cover Close][$temp3 = "guard living"]] * [[No... finish him off.|Test Finish Dead]] * [[Use his body as a shield.|Test Speed Shield]]<p>There was a sickening crack as your bat was stopped mid-swing. The guy's head was held at an odd angle. Blood leaked from his hairline. His eyes were distant. This certainly was an effective weapon.</p> <p>But after that split second, a problem made itself clear to you. His body slumped to the ground and brought you with it. The nails hammered into your bat were stuck in his skull. And then worse news. You heard the distinct whistle of a bullet whizzing past your head. The sniper. Fuck. You were right out in the open, and your weapon was stuck.</p> * [[Run for cover.|Test Cover Close][$temp1 = "unarmed"]] * [[Try to pull the bat out of his head.|Test Bat Dead]]<p>No time to worry about that. You had to finish him off.</p> <p>Your knife moved as if of its own volition. Your body was overcome with it. This urge to kill. You raised your arm above your head and brought the knife down, once, twice, three times. Thick red liquid spurted from a hole in his chest, drenching the front of your body in warm blood. He'd stopped moving, finally.</p> <p>And then everything went black, as a bullet collided with your skull.</p> * [[Maybe you shouldn't have gotten so bloodthirsty.|Test Dead]]<p>Shit, shit, shit. You tried to wrench it free, to no avail. Angling it so his head was on its side, you braced your foot against his neck, feeling a cracking underneath as parts of his skull moved unnaturally. Breath held, putting all your force into it, you pulled back as hard as you could on the handle of the bat. Another crack, and it erupted out, taking a solid chunk of brain with it.</p> <p>You didn't have much time to consider how gnarly that was. As you stood over his body, triumphant, the contents of your own brain joined his.</p> * [[Maybe you should have been more worried about that sniper.|Test Dead]]<p>You grappled with him a few more seconds, trying to get a good grip on the guy's shoulders. In the distance, the sniper was lining up her next shot. You had to time this just right, without even being able to see what was going on. But you got ahold of him, and this was your only chance. With all the force contained in your <<print $player.bodytype>> body, you rolled over to the side, clambering with him, getting him on top of you. For a split second, the look in his eyes was one of triumph, as if he'd managed to get the upper hand. It was replaced by a distant, empty stare and barely parted lips as the bullet that was meant for you lodged into his skull.</p> <p>You cast his body off, heart racing, weapon gripped in your hand, and sprinted to cover.</p> * [[Now what?|Test Cover Close]]<p>Your hands trembled and sweat dripped from your brow in the hot sun. This was your only chance, and you weren't exactly confident in it. But you had to try.</p> <<if $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>>\ <p>A rifle was probably the worst possible option for this kind of maneuver. In one fluid motion, you were going to have to get it off your shoulder, get your hands in the right positions, aim it accurately, and shoot. At least you had a bullet chambered and the safety off, so it wasn't impossible.</p> <p>But it might as well have been. The strap snagged on your shoulder. Your hands struggled to find the right positions, scrambling to locate the trigger. But you still hadn't gotten it by the time the guard had whipped his gun around to face you. Shit.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>\ <p>Your shotgun was a practical thing, good at close range. It was also a little awkward, bulky, unwieldy. The process of getting it off your shoulder and into your hands was an inelegant one. You fumbled with it, your hands grasping blindly to try to find the trigger. No luck. You hadn't even gotten it in position by the time the guard had whipped his gun around to face you. Shit.</p> <<elseif $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>>\ <p>Your pistol was engineered for this. The greatest minds of the 20th century came together to create the ultimate killing machine- small, compact, deadly. A device that you could kill a man in an instant. Your hand wrapped around its grip, fumbling to find the trigger as you pulled it from its holster and... it fell. On the ground. You thought you had a good grasp on the thing, but your fingers must have been a little slippery. And by now, the guy had whipped around, and you had a gun to your face.</p> <<set $temp1 = "unarmed">>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>>\ <p>Old westerns made such a big deal out of the art of the quickdraw. Until now, you'd never really known why. It didn't take an expert to pull a gun out of its holster and shoot it. You just... did it.</p> <p>But now, the reason was pretty clear. Your hand fumbled with the gun on your hip, pulling it from its holster, and... it slipped. And fell. On the ground. And now there was a gun aimed at your face.</p> <<set $temp1 = "unarmed">>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('combat knife')>>\ <p>As far as you were concerned, there was one big advantage to knife. Speed. You could pull it from its sheath and have it to an opponent's throat in mere moments. Except... well, no, there was a big issue with knife, and it was the fact that it was small and goddamn fiddly. You got it out of its sheath easy enough, but your fingers were a little bit slippery, and the thing just tumbled to the ground and skidded away. And now there was a gun aimed at your face.</p> <<set $temp1 = "unarmed">>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('spiked bat')>>\ <p>You'd think that a thing designed to collide with flying balls and hurl them hundreds of feet away from you would be fast. Turns out that when you hammer several dozen nails into a piece of sporting equipment, it messes up the aerodynamic qualities a little bit. You swung... and missed. And by the time you'd hefted it over your shoulder to try again, you had a gun aimed at your face.</p> <</if>>\ * [[New plan! New plan! Fucking surrender! Leave!|Test Surrender][$temp2 to "fought back"]] * [[New plan! New plan! Fucking tackle him!|Test Tackle]]<p>"Okay, okay, holy shit, let's take this a step back," you squeaked out. This was not going as planned, not in the slightest. "We are clearly outmatched here. Let's just... leave in peace."</p> <p>Having gotten to cover by now, KC shouted from behind him, "We're not leaving without Ozzy, asshole."</p> <p>Ah, fuck. Now what?</p> * [[“You're not leaving without Ozzy. I'm out of here. Fuck this.” (This decision can't be undone)|Test Abandon]] /* [[“How about I take his place, then!”|Test Volunteer]] */<p>"Go ahead." The guard gestured with his head. He had this amused little grin on his face, glancing over at KC and back at you. "Get outta here, stranger."</p> <p>KC didn't even say anything. She just glared at you as you backed up. It was a look that communicated about as much are any words- leave if you want, but never show your face again. You were making an enemy right now.</p> <p>And leave you did. Walking past the picked-apart automobiles, past piles of ash and rubble littering the streets. Walking past Ozzy's car, because KC had the keys. It was gonna be a bit of a trek back to the city, but it was worth it to not get a bullet between your eyes.</p> <p>That long walk was long enough to really contemplate your decision, and probably long enough for whatever was going to play out back there to play out. You were a little curious, but not too curious. And you'd probably never find out. You'd just made an enemy today.</p> <p>An hour or so later, you waved to Pistol as you walked back through the checkpoint and into the city.</p> * [[And away from the Lamplighters forever. Probably.|Red Light District]] <<SetFlag "BrokenOath">>\ <<SetFlag "LamplighterEnemy">>\<p>If weapons weren't enough, all that was left to handle this situation was brute force. <<if $skill.brawn gte 1>>And brute force was your specialty.<<else>>Brute force was not your strong suit, but tough times call for pretending to be tough.<</if>> <<if not $temp1 == "unarmed">>You dropped your <<for _item range $heldweapon.array>>_item<</for>> and <<else>>You <</if>>launched yourself at the guy as hard as you could manage, knocking him to the ground and knocking the gun out with it. No powder, no steel. Hand to hand.</p> <p>You had the immediate leg up, given that nobody could possibly expect this turn of events. Holding him down as best as possible with one hand on the collar of his shirt, your other hand pummelled his face. Sweat dripped from your forehead and your breath was ragged and panting.</p> <p>Then, the sound of a bullet whistled past your head. Shit. The sniper.</p> * [[Run for cover.|Test Cover Close][$temp3 = "guard living"]] * [[Use his body as a shield.|Test Speed Shield]]<p>As fast as your little legs could carry you, you sprinted past the corpse and dove behind the old car next to KC. Just in time for another bullet to lodge into the vehicle's frame, barely missing you. Phew.</p> <p>KC did not look relieved. Her eyes were wide and her hands fumbling with her shotgun. "This isn't good, <<if def $nickname>><<print $nickname>><<else>><<print $player.name>><</if>>. This is really, really bad."</p> <p>"It's fine," you tried to reassure her, although your voice was a bit shaky too. "One down, only a few more to go."</p> <p>"And how exactly do you plan on accomplishing that last part?<<if not $heldweapon.has("hunting rifle")>> Neither of us can hit that sniper from here.<</if>>"</p> <ul>\ <<if $heldweapon.has("hunting rifle")>>\ <li> [[“I'll take out the sniper. She's not the only one with a scope.”|Test Cover Shoot][$temp2 = "with KC"]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“Now that we've taken out one of her men, let's try to reason with her.”|Test Cover Reason][$temp2 = "with KC"]]</li> </ul>\<p>This was far from good shooting conditions, but this rifle wasn't meant for good shooting conditions. It was meant for lying among the brush, aiming over grass and between trees, a deer in the sights. By comparison, you had very little to worry about. The sniper was obscured a little by the angle and her own rifle, so a body shot, ideal as it would have been, was impossible. Instead, you were going to have to aim for her head. Just as immediately deadly, but a harder target.</p> <ul>\ <li> <<link 'You take aim at the sniper up on the wall. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>'>><<precisionroll 8 "Test Cover Shot Success" "Test Cover Shot Failure">><</link>></li> </ul>\<<if $temp2 == "with KC">>\ <p>"Do you really think that's going to work?" KC hissed, hugging the wall closely to avoid getting shot.</p> <p>You shrugged. There wouldn't be time for a second shot.</p> <p>Taking a deep breath and moving your hands to the familiar grooves of your rifle's stock, you lifted it up over the trunk of the car, nestling it against your body and peering through the scope. Through the distortion of the lens, you could see her lining up her shot. One try.</p> <p>Teeth clenched, you pulled the trigger. The recoil shoved you back slightly, and lifted the scope just enough that you lost sight of her. By the time you focused back on the wall, her seat was empty. Bingo.</p> <<if $temp2 == "with KC">>\ <p>In a hushed tone, KC muttered, "That was fucking good. I guess I picked the right person, huh?"</p> <p>"Just doing my job." He landed with a thud on a jutting out car underneath, his limbs a flailing mass, and then toppled off that car onto the concrete below.
