"You do realize I have an entire compound's worth of people, right?"</p> <p>"And you're gonna get more of them killed? For //Ozzy?//" Quite a rude way for her to phrase it, but KC seemed fucking exhausted.<<if Flag("KCShot")>> And she also had a bullet in her shoulder. That probably wasn't helping.<</if>></p> <p>"Fine." Mercy dug the toe of her boot under Ozzy's side and pushed hard enough to roll him off the edge of the platform. He landed with a thud on a jutting out car underneath, his limbs a flailing mass, and then toppled off that car onto the concrete below. By all means, he should have probably broken several bones, but instead he scrambled to his feet and rushed towards the two of you. His saviours. Kind of.</p> <p>"Ozzy, are you okay?" There was some genuine concern in KC's voice, albeit the kind of concern you'd have when you found out your teenage son had gotten arrested.</p> <p>"I'm fine." He was banged up, rubbing one of his elbows, but alive. With an eyebrow raised, he turned his attention to you. "Who's the new guy?"</p> * [[“The 'new guy' saved your damn life. Do I not get a thanks for that?”|Test New Guy]] * [[Don't be a dick. Just introduce yourself politely.|Test Polite]] <<SetFlag "TestRunShotEveryone">>\<p>"Are you insane," KC hissed. "Don't shoot unless you have to. I shouldn't have to tell you that."</p> <p>You were undeniably a hero here, but being told off like that made you feel a little like a scolded dog. "Fine, jesus..."</p> <p>KC shook her head and turned away. She wasn't going to let you take the lead here<<if Flag("KCShot")>>, gunshot wound or not<</if>>. "Mercy... do you want more of your people to die for //Ozzy// of all people, or are you going to let us go?" Her tone was less angry and more exhausted. She didn't //want// to fight.</p> <p>Staring down at you from on high, Mercy was unreadable. Her lips had curled into a frown, and her eyes panned back and forth between the two of you. "I'm going to be honest, I didn't really expect that." She still had a haughtiness to her voice, even now.</p> <p>"Just hand him over."</p> <p>After a moment of consideration, Mercy dug the toe of her boot under Ozzy's side and pushed hard enough to roll him off the edge of the platform. He landed with a thud on a jutting out car underneath, his limbs a flailing mass, and then toppled off that car onto the concrete below. By all means, he should have probably broken several bones, but instead he scrambled to his feet and rushed towards the two of you. His saviours. Kind of.</p> <p>"Ozzy, are you okay?" There was some genuine concern in KC's voice, albeit the kind of concern you'd have when you found out your teenage son had gotten arrested.</p> <p>"I'm fine." He was banged up, rubbing one of his elbows, but alive. With an eyebrow raised, he turned his attention to you. "Who's the new guy?"</p> * [[“The 'new guy' saved your damn life. Do I not get a thanks for that?”|Test New Guy]] * [[Don't be a dick. Just introduce yourself politely.|Test Polite]] <<SetFlag "TestRunShotEveryone">>\<p>Ozzy seemed taken aback by your hostility, hands flying up as if in surrender. "Jeez, tough guy. Just askin' a question."</p> <p>KC glared at you as she led you both back to the car<<if Flag("KCShot")>>, limping slightly and cradling the wound in her shoulder<</if>>. "This is our potential newest recruit, Oz. Emphasis on //potential//."</p> <p>"It's <<print $player.name>>." These people were the definition of ungrateful. You'd just expertly maneuvered them out of a deadly situation, and they were whining about your tone? Ugh.</p> <<include "Test Get In Car">> <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-5)>>\<p>"I'm <<print $player.name>>. Nice to meet you."</p> <p>Ozzy grabbed your hand for a somewhat unexpected handshake, and his strong grip was similarly unexpected. "Ozzy. Same to you."</p> <p>KC led you both back to the car<<if Flag("KCShot")>>, limping slightly and cradling the wound in her shoulder<</if>>. "This is our potential newest recruit, Oz. So far, <<print $pro.they>><<if $pro.they == "they">>'re<<else>>'s<</if>> doing pretty well for <<print $pro.themselves>>."</p> <p>"Oh, sick." He seemed a little surprised, but not too surprised.<<if $skill.savvy gte 1>> Their no-hire policy was maybe exaggerated a little.<</if>> "I'll have to show you the ropes when we get back. Oh, and I'm not //officially// the weapons guy, but I can give you a hand with 'em. You'll have to show me what you're packing back at base." The innuendo was probably not intended.</p> <<include "Test Get In Car">><<if Flag("KCShot")>>\ <p>"I think we have more pressing concerns to deal with," KC grimaced as she opened the back door. It was taking her considerable effort to do even that much lifting. "Fuck... this hurts."</p> <<if $pocket.has("Med Kit")>>\ <p>You turned to Ozzy, who was certainly beat up, but not in quite such terrible shape. "Can you drive? I think I'm going to need to patch her up."</p> <p>"Oh, yeah," the guy muttered, grabbing the keys from KC's outstretched hand. "I'll get it. You take care of her."</p> * [[You climbed into the back seat with KC.|Test Back Seat Medic]] <<else>>\ <p>"Oh... yeah." She was going to need medical attention pretty damn fast for that wound, and neither of you were equipped to give her that right now. You should probably get back to the headquarters as soon as possibly.</p> <p>KC winced as she held the keys out for Ozzy. "Can you drive? I can't, and I don't think our new friend here can either."</p> <p>"Yeah, I can get it." Ozzy wasn't in the best shape either, but he grabbed the keys and started off towards the driver's seat. "I've got it."</p> * [[You climbed into the back seat with KC.|Test Back Seat]] <</if>>\ <<else>>\ <p>Ozzy's' focus turned to the car. His car. Luckily, it was a foot or so away from having slammed directly into a building. "I hope you took care of my ride, KC. But this parking job isn't inspiring confidence."</p> <p>She tossed him the keys, which smacked him in the chest as he scrambled to catch them. "Your car's fine, Ozzy. Now take us home, will you?"</p> * [[You climbed into the back seat with KC.|Test Back Seat]] <</if>>\<p>KC took a seat in the back and shrugged the leather jacket off her shoulders, laying it and her shotgun down at her feet. As soon as it was off, the wound's severity became apparent. She had on a tank top that used to be white, but now the whole left sleeve and down the front of her chest was stained a bright red. The sleeve was partially ripped where the bullet had entered her body, hanging by a few threads. And the wound itself... it wasn't the worst you'd ever seen. But it certainly wasn't good.</p> <p>You crawled in next to her, balancing your left knee on the worn leather seat and your right foot on the floor. Wordless in the front, Ozzy turned the keys and the engine sputtered to life. He started pulling out slow, and you found it easy enough to brace yourself and keep still as you rifled through your med kit.</p> <ul>\ <<if $pocket.has("Painkillers")>>\ <li> [[You get her one of your painkillers.|Test Painkiller]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[You rip the rest of the sleeve to get access to the wound.|Test Sleeve Rip]]</li> <li> [[You gently move her sleeve off to the side to get access to the wound.|Test Sleeve Move]]</li> </ul>\<p>You popped open the lid on the glass bottle, rattling out a single red pill. This stuff was pretty good at keeping you out of pain, so it would hopefully do the trick for KC too.</p> <p>"Can you swallow this dry? I don't have any water right now."</p> <p>She held her good hand out, and as soon as you'd dropped the pill into her palm, she slapped it to her mouth and swallowed. "Fuck, thank you. Hope that thing is strong."</p> <p>Okay. Your patient wouldn't be in quite as much pain soon. To the task at hand...</p> <ul>\ <li> [[You rip the rest of the sleeve to get access to the wound.|Test Sleeve Rip]]</li> <li> [[You gently move her sleeve off to the side to get access to the wound.|Test Sleeve Move]]</li> </ul>\ <<drop $pocket "Painkillers" 1>>\ <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(15)>>\<p>You gripped either side of the tank top's sleeve with your hands, feeling the blood squish between your fingers. With a strong yank, you severed the last few threads, leaving the bottom half to dangle loosely over her chest and the top half to fall behind her back.</p> <<if $attraction.kc == true>>\ <p>"You could ask before ripping my clothes off next time," KC muttered, trying to grin through the pain.</p> <<else>>\ <p>"That was a good shirt... what a shame." KC tried to grin through the pain.</p> <</if>>\ <<include "Test Crash Medicine">><p>Your fingers grasped the fabric of her sleeve and pulled it down over her shoulder. <<if $attraction.kc == true>>She made eye contact with you as your hand brushed against her skin. "Damn, that hurts," she muttered, though her heart wasn't in it.<<else>>She grimaced as it brushed against her wound, muttering, "Damn, that hurts."<</if>></p> <<include "Test Crash Medicine">><p>There was no exit wound, meaning the bullet was still lodged in her shoulder. But running your hands along her collarbone, you could feel that the bones were intact. With your rudimentary knowledge of the skeleton, you could be pretty certain that it hadn't collided with any bone at all. It was just under the skin. Buried somewhere in the muscle.</p> <p>"You're going to have to get that bullet removed, but I can't do that in a moving car," you explained to her as calmly as possible. "For right now, I'm going to leave it as is and just pack it to keep it from bleeding any more. Okay?"</p> <p>"Yeah," she muttered, her teeth gritted. "We've got a doctor back at base. She'll take care of it when we get back."</p> <p>You nodded. Good. For now, you just needed to stabilize it.</p> * [[You wrap her shoulder with bandages.|Test Bandage Wrap]]<p>"This is gonna hurt a little." You doused a small cloth with a little alcohol, and carefully pressed it to the site of the wound. KC gripped the side of the leather seat, digging her fingernails in. Lifting the rag left the wound a lot cleaner, and without so much blood in the way, it seemed far less drastic. Just a hole. You could deal with a hole.</p> <p>You grabbed some gauze out of the kit, unravelling a good portion of it and looping it under her arms. She seemed to be able to lift her arms easy enough, so that was, again, a good sign. A few go arounds, and you couldn't even see any blood seeping through. That was good enough for now. A safety pin in the end, a pair of bandage scissors to snip it off from the roll, and you were done.</p> <p>"Thanks, <<print $player.nickname>>," KC panted as she leaned forward in her seat. "You did good. We're all alive. We're gonna be fine."</p> <<if $heldweapon.has("knife")>>\ <p>You paused for a moment, waiting for her to get comfortable again. And then you pulled the knife from its scabard. "So... looks like this little guy did better than you thought, huh?"</p> <p>KC looked to the knife, and then back at you, and then back at the knife. Her upper lip was curled into a grimace. "The knife?"</p> <p>"The knife came in handy, didn't it?"</p> <p>She kept staring, and then let out an exhasperated sigh. "Yeah, okay, sure. Your knife is //fine//. You can keep the knife."</p> <</if>>\ <p>In the driver's seat, Ozzy pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]]<p>You all piled into the electric blue vehicle, with nary a scratch on it from KC's quick maneuver on the road. From the back, you watched as Ozzy ran his skinny fingers along the dash, and then caressed the wheel. "Okay... she's fine //now//, but I'm telling you. No more driving my car, KC.<<if Flag("KCShot")>> And don't bleed on the leather, please.<</if>>"</p> <<if $heldweapon.has("knife")>>\ <p><<if Flag("KCShot")>>"You think I can control that?" And then you pulled the knife from its scabard. "So... looks like this little guy did better than you thought, huh?"</p> <p>KC looked to the knife, and then back at you, and then back at the knife. Her upper lip was curled into a grimace. "The knife?"</p> <p>"The knife came in handy, didn't it?"</p> <p>She kept staring, and then let out an exhasperated sigh. "Yeah, okay, sure. Your knife is //fine//. You can keep the knife."</p> <p>From the front, Ozzy called back, "I like your knife, <<print $player.name>>!"</p> <p>"Oh, shut up." KC shook her head, grumbling something under her breath. "Hey, why didn't you bring the damn car with you anyway? Would've saved us all a lot of trouble."</p> <<else>>\ <p><<if Flag("KCShot")>>"You think I can control that?" KC winced, shuffling around in the seat to find some kind of comfortable position as the car revved to life.<<else>>"I'll leave your stupid car alone, okay?" KC eschewed a seatbelt, kicking her feet up on the back of his seat in defiance.<</if>> "Why didn't you take the damn thing with you, anyway? You might not have gotten caught then."</p> <</if>>\ <p>Ozzy turned 180 degrees to look out the back window between the two of you, turning the wheel all the way and backing up slowly to try to get out of the tight situation you'd been left in. "Expanse doesn't have good road access, and I didn't want these fuckers commandeering my ride while I was inside." Despite being a little injured still and probably quite out of it, this guy was a good driver. He only needed one fluid movement to get out of this bind, and then the car was back on the road heading far away from this place.</p> * [[“What is 'Expanse'?”|Test Ozzy Expanse]] * [[“Why'd you take this gig if you knew it was going to be dangerous?”|Test Ozzy Gig]]<p>"So, before it became unlivable, the Graveyard used to be this big metropolitan area. A massive old world city where people lived and worked. And right at the heart of the city, there was this big... well, research complex." Ozzy's voice was getting noticeably higher as he spoke, his excitement building. This wasn't just an interest, it was a fascination for him. "It was one of the biggest labs in the world, started who knows how long ago by some really smart guy who patented some stuff. They developed all kinds of tech with radio waves."</p> <p>KC raised an eyebrow. "You mean... radios?"</p> <p>"No, no, other stuff too! They had these phones, cell phones, you could use without wires. They would send the audio over the air with radio waves! But... not like how a two way radio works. It was different."</p> <<if $identity.includes("machinist")>>\ <p>Cell phones! You'd heard of those, seen a couple of them too in your day. The towers that made them work had long since gone silent, so they were basically just fancy bricks now. The cost of using new tech, you supposed. "Okay, so they made cell phones?"</p> <<else>>\ <p>"So you went to a place that made fancy radios?" You had to admit that you were a little bit puzzled.</p> <</if>>\ <p>In his rear view mirror, you could see Ozzy frown and furrow his brow. "Uh... yeah. That's basically it. The company was called 'Expanse Radio Communications Technology.' This lab... let me tell you, it was full of cool shit. But the client just wanted one thing."</p> * [[“What was that?”|Test Ozzy Amp]]<p>"How much do you know about tech, <<print $player.name>>?"</p> <<if $identity.includes("machinist")>>\ <p>Your eyes lit up at the question. "A lot. I worked in machine repairs up North."</p> <p>Ozzy nodded approvingly, a calm smile spreading across his face- happy to find a kindred spirit. "Okay, so you've probably got some idea of how radios work, then. The client hired me to hunt for this experimental piece of tech, this RF power amp that uses silicon in a special way. Supposed to be really powerful and efficient."</p> <<elseif $skill.savvy gte 1>>\ <p>"A decent amount. I've tinkered with it."</p> <p>Ozzy nodded approvingly. "Okay, so radios? You familiar with how they work? The client hired me to hunt for this experimental piece of tech, this RF power amp that uses silicon in a special way. Supposed to be really powerful and efficient."</p> <<else>>\ <p>"Um..." You trailed off, racking your brain. Yeah... not much tech knowledge up there.</p> <p>"Okay, okay, let me explain then," Ozzy started. There was a wide grin on his face. This guy //loved// telling people about technology. "So your radio, it takes radio signals from the air, these waves that are all around us all the time. And it converts those into sound. But where do the radio waves come from?"</p> <p>"A radio station?"</p> <p>He stuttered for a moment. "Well, //yes//, but... at the radio station, where do they come from?"</p> <p>"The tower."</p> <p>"A //transmitter//. They come from a transmitter." Ozzy adjusted his rear view mirror, and the little fuzzy dice swung back and forth, landing together on snake eyes. "But the transmitter can only put out little tiny radio waves. So you add an amplifier. And the better the amplifier, the stronger the signal, and the further away it goes. The one they wanted was a crazy powerful amplifier, some weird experimental shit."</p> <</if>>\ <p>"The client wanted... a radio amplifier?" That was an unusual request for a mercenary organization.</p> <p>The car went over a bump in the road, and everybody braced themselves as you jumped up and were knocked back down into your seats. When he regathered his composure, Ozzy muttered, "They were paying good money, too. But those Motorheads... well, they weren't gonna let me go with the goods."</p> <p>"Great," KC interrupted, her voice dripping with sarcasm. "So you come all the way out here, get yourself captured, we nearly die trying to rescue you, and you're not even gonna get paid for it?"</p> <p>Ozzy shook his head. He wasn't okay with her implications. But he wasn't going to keep arguing. He pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]]<p>"Y'know that weirdo cult in town?" He said this with such a flippant tone, like the weirdo cult was just a normal fixture of life in Signal Hill.</p> <<if $playedleads.includes("crossroads")>>\ <p>"I think I'm familiar." He was almost certainly talking about Levi. You weren't sure whether the label of cult was appropriate, but it was probably warranted.</p> <<else>>\ <p>"I'm new in town," you explained, "I have no clue what you're talking about."</p> <p>"There's this cult that's been operating in the city for like... five or six years now, all underground," KC explained. "Some Northern shit, saints or whatever. I don't know."<<if $identity.includes("devotee")>> Oh... so they're just talking about, like, normal Northern religion. That wasn't particularly respectful.<</if>></p> <p>"I get it. Go on."</p> <</if>>\ <p>"Okay, so, a lot of people think they just disappeared. Their leader used to be one of those... y'know, the kind of person you see on the street and cross to the other side of the road. Weird motherfucker who always covered their eyes." <<if $outfit.has("blindfold")>>He realized how awkward the thing he'd just said was and corrected himself, "Y'know, not that it's weird to cover your eyes! They were weird, and also covered their eyes! Two different things. Anyway..."<<else>>He mused out loud, "I don't know how the hell you'd get around with your eyes all covered up like that. "Get to the point, please."</p> <p>"Okay, sheesh." He carried on. "A couple months ago, they just dropped off the map. Leader, and the whole cult. A lot of folks thought the militia took 'em out in secret, or they up and left the city. But I've got a guy on the inside, and not only are they still here, but they pay //real well//."</p> * [[The person he's describing is an augur. That's... interesting.|Test Augur]] * [[Who cares about the cult? You want to know about the job.|Test Ozzy Job]]<p>Augurs were like the top of the religious hierarchy up North, if you could call it such a thing. Holier than the ministers who arranged usual worship, secluded from regular society. They had a connection to the //cadavre divin// identified in youth and fostered by a strenuous initiation process. Covering their eyes was a matter of preventing attenuation.<<if $identity.includes("augur")>><<for _item range $outfit.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("glasses")>><<set $temp5 = true>><</if>><</for>><<if $temp5 == true>><<if not $outfit.has("blindfold")>> Typically that would be some kind of cloth draped over or wrapped around the head, but you made do with unconventional methods.<<else>> You wore a similar thing, although your blindfold was a little less traditional and more modern- this person probably wore a loose sheet of cloth pinned to a headdress.<</if>><<else>> You didn't personally adhere to that requirement. It was... complicated.<</if>><</if>></p> <<if $identity.includes("devotee")>>\ <<if $identity.includes("augur")>>\ <p>Another augur, all the way down here in Signal Hill? It wasn't unheard of for an augur to abandon their church- after all, you were here. But this was certainly unconventional. You had to wonder whether they travelled, like you did, or whether there was some kind of splinter religion here of all places. Odd.</p> * [[But back to the conversation at hand.|Test Ozzy Job]] <<else>>\ <p>An augur rarely abandoned their church. It was rare to even see them in person in the North, let alone encounter one living so far away from home, away from the structure of their worship.</p> <p><<if $player.gender == "androgyne">>You knew all this for a reason- you'd lived through at least part of the process. But had you officially become an augur?</p> <<include "augur">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "augur" "Augur">><<goto "Test Ozzy Job">><</link>> / [[NO|Test Ozzy Job]] """---"""</h1>\ <<else>>\ * [[But back to the conversation at hand.|Test Ozzy Job]] <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <<else>>\ <p>You weren't exactly the most religious person around, but you knew enough to know that this was strange. An augur rarely abandoned their church. It was rare to even see them in person in the North, let alone encounter one living so far away from home, away from the structure of their worship. You had to wonder why they'd come here.</p> * [[But back to the conversation at hand.|Test Ozzy Job]] <</if>>\<p>KC was staring daggers into the back of his head. "You've been taking jobs from the fucking cult weirdos? What the hell, Oz!"</p> <p>"I get it, I get your concern, but it's fine! I trust my guy!"</p> <<if $playedleads.includes("crossroads")>>\ <p>"Is your guy named Levi, by any chance?" You had a hunch.</p> <p>And your hunch was confirmed. "Yeah, that's him. What, you know him?"</p> <<if Flag("LostFinger")>>\ <p>"Well, he cut my finger off." You held up your hand to reveal <<if Flag("ReattachedFinger")>>the gnarly stitches where your finger had been reattached.<<else>>the stump where your pinky finger used to be.<</if>> Not pleasant to look at, but it got the idea across.</p> <p>Ozzy went silent for a good moment, distracted from his driving, looking at you in the rear view. "That's not good, huh?"</p> * [[“Honestly, after the part where he cut my finger off he seemed nice enough.”|Test Finger Nice]] * [[“Yeah. He was a psycho. Maybe you shouldn't work with him.”|Test Finger Psycho]] <<else>>\ <p>You considered it for a second. Now that you'd met Levi on your own terms, was he really the kind of person you were okay supporting? Or even if not... was it worth rocking the boat?</p> * [[“I've met him. He seems fine to me, KC.”|Test Levi Nice]] * [[“You shouldn't be working with him. Trust me, he's a real psycho.”|Test Levi Psycho]] <</if>>\ <<else>>\ <p>"You can trust 'your guy' all you want, Ozzy, you still shouldn't be taking dangerous jobs like this from cultists." KC was shaking her head in disbelief. "I can't believe you. From now on, I'm vetting all your jobs first."</p> <p>Gripping the wheel and grumbling in annoyance, Ozzy shook his head. He was upset, sure, very upset. But he wasn't going to keep arguing. He pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]] <</if>>\<p>"Gonna be honest, that's a really fucked up thing to say, chief," Ozzy announced. "KC, your friend here has really convinced me of the error of my ways. I don't think I can spare a finger."</p> <p>"Good." She seemed content. And she also side-eyed you, like you were crazy. Maybe you were. You just defended a man who cut your finger off, so like. It would be a fair assumption.</p> <p>Presumably wanting to clear the awkward energy in the air, Ozzy pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(-5)>>\<p>"Uh... yeah. Gonna be honest, I didn't take him for the chopping fingers off type, but..." Ozzy trailed off. He probably realized that this made him look pretty bad. Going around his colleague's backs to take a lucrative job from a psychopath was questionable at best. "Y'know, KC, maybe you're right!"</p> <p>"I usually am." She seemed content. And she gave you an approving nod- you leant her a hand here, and it was appreciated.</p> <p>Presumably wanting to clear the awkward energy in the air, Ozzy pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]] <<set $relationship.kc to $relationship.kc.fm(5)>>\<<if $relationship.kc gte 65>>\ <p>KC frowned. "Really? Are you sure?"</p> <p>"Yeah, I've worked with him myself. He can be a little intense, but he's a good guy. And I think he's good for the money."</p> <p>"See, KC?" In the rear view mirror you could see Ozzy grinning. "I told you, it's good money from a reliable person. They can believe in the Easter bunny for all I care."</p> <p>She was silent for a moment, staring out the window, lost in thought. And finally she muttered, "Okay. But only if you run it past me first."</p> <p>What a win! And Levi would probably be happy with this turn of events, too. Equally triumphant, Ozzy pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]] <<SetFlag "LamplightersLikeLevi">>\ <<else>>\ <p>KC shook her head, leaning back into the leather seat and crossing her arms. "Thanks for your input, but you're not even a Lamplighter yet. Your words don't mean much here."</p> <p>Ow. That stung.</p> <p>"C'mon, KC," Ozzy argued. "Who cares what they believe? It's good money, and they're good people."</p> <p>"You can be as accepting as you want, Ozzy, you still shouldn't be taking dangerous jobs like this from cultists." KC was shaking her head in disbelief. "I can't believe you. From now on, I'm vetting all your jobs first."</p> <p>Gripping the wheel and grumbling in annoyance, Ozzy shook his head. He was upset, sure, very upset. But he wasn't going to keep arguing. He pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]] <</if>>\<p>KC shot a quick glare at the driver's seat, where Ozzy was gripping the steering wheel tight. "Hey, Ozzy? I think maybe you're a bad judge of character."</p> <p>"Maybe your new friend is a bad judge of character, huh?"</p> <p>"I'm inclined to trust the person telling me the creepy cultist is crazy." With a long sigh, KC leaned forward to rest her forearms on her knees. "Ozzy, after all this, can you please let me vet your missions ahead of time?"</p> <p>He was gripping the steering wheel even tighter. "Fine." Presumably wanting to clear the awkward energy in the air, Ozzy pressed the button to turn the radio on.</p> * [[And staticky sounds fill the cab.|Test Home Radio]]<p>The three of you sat in silence for the rest of the ride, The Signal washing over you. In between runs of classic rock and synth pop, the warm voice of the announcer declared, "Today's a good day to be alive, folks. The wastes are calm, the sun is hot, and the world is quiet. And whether you're on the assembly line or the front line, you're here with me, listener. Ain't that a beautiful thing?"</p> <p>Outside the window, between the megaliths, you could see the sky- bright, blue fading inexorably towards violet. The sun cast white gleams along the edges of a few stray clouds, illuminating them from within.</p> <p>"With a day as beautiful as this one, listeners, I feel like I can look up in the sky and I'm seeing what they saw, say, 70 years ago. Do you think they were thinking of us too? I like to think so." You were far enough away from Signal Hill that his voice was fuzzy around the edges. "Speaking of which, here's Everybody Wants to Rule The World by Tears For Fears. Enjoy."</p> * [[And as much as you can, you do.|Test Meeting]]<p>When Ozzy finally pulled up to the Lamplighter HQ, you turned to look at KC. She was still staring outside, lost in thought, her big, coily coif making it hard to see what she was looking at. Probably nothing in particular.<<if Flag("KCShot") and $identity.includes("medic")>> With her jacket off, you could see a number of moles on the back of her shoulders, like stars scattered across soft skin.<</if>> "So am I in, KC?"</p> <p>She took a beat and then turned to you, her brow furrowed. "We're gonna be having a meeting in the lounge soon. Show up."</p> * [[“That doesn't answer the question.”|Test Meeting Later][$temp6 = true]] * [[“Okay. I'll see you there.”|Test Meeting Later]]<<if $temp6 == true>>\ <p>"It wasn't supposed to." The car pulled into the garage, and she cracked the door open. "I'll see you soon."</p> <<else>>\ <<if $relationship.kc gte 65>>\ <p>"Looking forward to it." The car pulled into the garage, and she cracked the door open. "I'll see you soon."</p> <<else>>\ <p>She was silent for a good long moment. The car pulled into the garage, and she cracked the door open. "I'll see you soon."</p> <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <p>Ozzy nodded to you as you stepped out. "Thanks for the rescue. Looking forward to working with you!"</p> <p>And with that, you were finished your first official job as a mercenary in Signal Hill.</p> * [[It could only go up from here.|Test Finish]] <<addlead "boardmeeting" "Board Meeting">>\<h1>"""----""" STORY COMPLETE """----"""</h1> <h5>[[CONTINUE|Lamplighter HQ Hub]]</h5> <<completelead "testrun">>\ <<if not Flag("TestRunIntern")>>\ <<if not Flag("TestNoPaycheck")>>\ <<addwealth "small">>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <<SetFlag "TestRunIntern" false>>\ <<SetFlag "TestNoPaycheck" false>>\ <<unset $temp>>\ <<unset $temp1>>\ <<unset $temp2>>\ <<unset $temp3>>\ <<unset $temp4>>\ <<unset $temp5>>\ <<unset $temp6>>\<br> <div class="center"><h2>This game contains mature language, violence, explicit sexual content, and use of drugs and alcohol. Viewer discretion is advised.</h2></div> <h1>"""---""" [[UNDERSTOOD|Intro]] """---"""</h1><p>You lay there on the ground, bleeding into the ash from a hole in your side, staring up at the blazing red of the sunless sky. All sound except the buzzing in your ear had stopped a few minutes ago, and lord knows the buzzing wasn't gonna stop till you kicked the ol' bucket. And given that you couldn't move, that would probably be soon.</p> * [[How did you even get here?|Intro 2]] <<pickup $handmade "knit hat" 1 "simple headscarf" 1 "horned headdress" 1 "trinket "pencil skirt" 1 "slit miniskirt" 1 "beaded bracelets" 1 "bangles" 1 "silk gloves" 1 "high heels" 1 "ugg boots" 1 "crocs" 1 "oxfords" 1 "timberland boots" 1 "strappy heels" 1>>\<p>The caravan job. That's how. It was way overpaid- just accompany the cargo South, South along the old abandoned highway and through the ash-wastes until you spotted the towering beacon of the city. Signal Hill.</p> <p>Your average shipping job would involve loading hundreds of pounds worth of salted meat into an old gutted pickup and walking for miles through the blasted wasteland alongside the horses. The cargo for this one, though? Nothing. One box made of particleboard bound with tape and caulk, oblong, small enough to fit between the console and the trunk of an old sedan.</p> <p>It's a good gig. But that wasn't what this was about, was it? No. Caravans are a good gig for drifters, but drifting wasn't your plan. The city was. You wanted to start anew, start again in the city of lights.</p> * [[Why are you here?|Class]]<h1>WHY ARE YOU HERE?</h1>\ * [[Not much work back home for mechanical types. Here, though? Plenty of machines out here, maybe too many.|Confirm][$class to "savvy"]] * [[That old place? Got bored of it. This city has the excitement you really crave. Until you get bored of this, too.|Confirm][$class to "glam"]] * [[You shoot things for a living. You just go where the money goes. Or more accurately, where the bullets need to go.|Confirm][$class to "brawn"]] * [[You're in tune enough with the universe to know where you're needed. You hear its signal. It's calling you here.|Confirm][$class to "signal"]] <<dropall $wardrobe>>\ <<dropall $outfit>>\ <<set $skill.savvy = 0>>\ <<set $skill.brawn = 0>>\ <<set $skill.glam = 0>>\ <<set $skill.signal = 0>>\<<if $class is "savvy">>\ <h2>SAVVY</h2>\ <p>A savvy person is mechanical, practical, grounded. You might have worked as a mechanic or engineer back home, and maybe you're looking to do the same out here. Fixing shit for the rich can get you a pretty penny, but don't get too cocky. You'll never be like them. They're a different sort than you.</p> <p>You get to start with one weapon of your choice and practical or handmade clothing. Your savvy starts at 1.</p> <<elseif $class is "brawn">>\ <h2>BRAWN</h2>\ <p>Brawn is all about intimidation- and if it comes to it, violence. You might have worked as a hired gun or military person back home, and lord knows there'll be work for you out here. There's always work for somebody who can semi-competently wield a gun. Y'all are disposable, after all.</p> <p>You get to start with one weapon of your choice and armoured or practical clothing. Your brawn starts at 1.</p> <<elseif $class is "glam">>\ <h2>GLAM</h2>\ <p>Glam is all about aesthetics and presence. You might have come from money, or perhaps are an artist or entertainer. Even if you aren't loaded, you'll find you fit in just fine with the people at the top of the ladder. They're all looking for the same thing you are.</p> <p>You get to start with one weapon of your choice and luxury or fetish clothing. Your glam starts at 1.</p> <<elseif $class is "signal">>\ <h2>SIGNAL</h2>\ <p>Signal is being freaky, in tune with the background radiation that surrounds us all. You might have used it for some sort of divination, or perhaps... more nefarious purposes. Whatever your purpose in life, you'll find plenty to do here. The signal's all over, everywhere you look.</p> <p>You get to start with one weapon of your choice and fetish or handmade clothing. Your signal starts at 1.</p> <</if>>\ Are you sure about your choice? <h1>"""------""" [[YES|Weakness]] / [[NO|Class]] """------"""</h1><<silently>>\ <<if $class is "savvy">> <<set $skill.savvy to 1>> <<elseif $class is "brawn">> <<set $skill.brawn to 1>> <<elseif $class is "glam">> <<set $skill.glam to 1>> <<elseif $class is "signal">> <<set $skill.signal to 1>> <</if>> <</silently>>\ <h1>WHAT ARE YOU WORST AT?</h1>\ <<if $skill.savvy isnot 1>>\ * [[I'm flighty, uncertain, ungrounded. <h1>"""------""" [[FINISHED|Appearance]] """------"""</h1> <<silently>> <<if $skill.savvy == 1>> <<merge $wardrobe $practical>> <<merge $wardrobe $handmade>> <<elseif $skill.brawn == 1>> <<merge $wardrobe $practical>> <<merge $wardrobe $armoured>> <<elseif $skill.glam == 1>> <<merge $wardrobe $luxury>> <<merge $wardrobe $fetish>> <<elseif $skill.signal == 1>> <<merge $wardrobe $handmade>> <<merge $wardrobe $fetish>> <</if>> <</silently>>\<p>Signal Hill takes place in an alternate universe where the world ended in 2005. With almost two decades of history erased and almost five rewritten, the landscape in terms of gender identity is very different from our own.</p> <p>Here's a quick glossary of gender terms //as they are used in Signal Hill// (if you wanna know how they work in real life, idk, Bing it or whatever). Not all of these are explicity options- just things you might need to know.</p> * ''TRANSGENDER'': Anyone who identifies with or performs a gender outside the one expected of them. * ''TRANSSEXUAL'': A synonym of transgender, most often used by the politically radical. Transgender just lacks that //kick//. * ''GENDERQUEER'': Anyone who identifies with or performs gender in a way that's queer. Usually denotes somebody who doesn't conform to maleness or femaleness. * ''GENDERFUCK'': Intentionally bucking gender norms. The raddest of the radical transsexuals. * ''AGENDER'': A person who doesn't give a shit about all of this. * ''BIGENDER'': A person who's got a little male and a little female in them. * ''ANDROGYNE'': A culturally specific third gender from the North characterized by androgyny and concealment of the body. Only granted through a complex religious initiation ritual, so like. Maybe skip out on this one for your first playthrough.<<silently>> <<set _bodyoptions = ["petite", "lanky", "slim", "toned", "muscular", "burly", "curvy", "chubby", "stocky", "fat"]>> <<set class="weapon-grid-top"> <div class="image-weapon"><img src="images/square.png"></div> <div class="title-weapon"> <h2><<link "HUNTING RIFLE">> <<pickup $heldweapon "hunting rifle" 1>> <<set $currentweapon = {precision: 2, speed: 0, power: 2, value: 3}>> <<goto "Weapon Confirm">> <</link>></h2> A hefty bolt action rifle with a wood stock and scope. Rudimentary sniper rifle, small enough to carry around. </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid-bottom"> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>2</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>0</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i>2</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i>3</div> </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid"> <div class="weapon-grid-top"> <div class="image-weapon"><img src="images/square.png"></div> <div class="title-weapon"> <h2><<link "SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN">> <<pickup $heldweapon "sawed-off shotgun" 1>> <<set $currentweapon = {precision: -1, speed: 0, power: 3, value: 3}>> <<goto "Weapon Confirm">> <</link>></h2> A double barrel shotgun with a shortened barrel, reducing weight and increasing spread. </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid-bottom"> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>-1</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>0</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i>3</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i>3</div> </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid"> <div class="weapon-grid-top"> <div class="image-weapon"><img src="images/square.png"></div> <div class="title-weapon"> <h2><<link ".44 MAGNUM REVOLVER">> <<pickup $heldweapon ".44 magnum revolver" 1>> <<set $currentweapon = {precision: 1, speed: 2, power: 2, value: 2}>> <<goto "Weapon Confirm">> <</link>></h2> A large bore six-shooter with a classic design. Wielding it can make anybody feel like a cowboy. </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid-bottom"> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>1</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>2</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i>2</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i>2</div> </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid"> <div class="weapon-grid-top"> <div class="image-weapon"><img src="images/square.png"></div> <div class="title-weapon"> <h2><<link "SEMI-AUTO PISTOL">> <<pickup $heldweapon "semi-auto pistol" 1>> <<set $currentweapon = {precision: 0, speed: 3, power: 1, value: 2}>> <<goto "Weapon Confirm">> <</link>></h2> A sleek, black 9mm handgun with a sizeable magazine, for those who prefer quantity over quality. </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid-bottom"> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>0</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>3</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i>1</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i>2</div> </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid"> <div class="weapon-grid-top"> <div class="image-weapon"><img src="images/square.png"></div> <div class="title-weapon"> <h2><<link "COMBAT KNIFE">> <<pickup $heldweapon "combat knife" 1>> <<set $currentweapon = {precision: 1, speed: 2, power: 1, value: 1}>> <<goto "Weapon Confirm">> <</link>></h2> A large, fixed-bladed knife with a curved edge and serrated spine. Good for stabbing and survival. </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid-bottom"> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>1</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>2</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i>1</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i>1</div> </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid"> <div class="weapon-grid-top"> <div class="image-weapon"><img src="images/square.png"></div> <div class="title-weapon"> <h2><<link "SPIKED BAT">> <<pickup $heldweapon "spiked bat" 1>> <<set $currentweapon = {precision: 0, speed: -1, power: 3, value: 1}>> <<goto "Weapon Confirm">> <</link>></h2> A hefty wooden baseball bat with long nails embedded in it at wild angles. Not pleasant to be hit with. </div> </div> <div class="weapon-grid-bottom"> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>0</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>-1</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i>3</div> <div class="weapon-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i>1</div> </div> </div><h1><<for _item, _amount range $heldweapon.table>>_item<</for>></h1>\ <div class="pseudo-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>$currentweapon.precision</div>\ PRECISION measures how easily you can aim at targets. <div class="pseudo-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>$currentweapon.speed</div>\ SPEED measures how quickly you can shoot, reload, or swing the weapon. <div class="pseudo-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i>$currentweapon.power</div>\ POWER measures how much damage the weapon does on a single hit. <div class="pseudo-statbox"><i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i>$currentweapon.value</div>\ VALUE is the wealth the player needs to have to buy the weapon. <h1>"""------""" [[CONFIRM|Character Creation Confirm]] """------"""</h1><div id="confirm">\ <h1><<print $player.name>> <<print $player.surname>></h1>\ <h4 style="text-align: center">$pro.they/$pro.them</h4>\ <div class="display">\ <div class="skillbox" title="Resourcefulness, mechanics, and practicality.">\ $skill.savvy <div class="skillname">\ <i class="fa-solid fa-brain"></i> </div>\ </div>\ <div class="skillbox" title="Intimidation, strength, and power.">\ $skill.brawn <div class="skillname">\ <i class="fa-solid fa-hand-fist"></i> </div>\ </div>\ <div class="skillbox" title="Presence, aesthetics, and charisma.">\ $skill.glam <div class="skillname">\ <i class="fa-solid fa-heart"></i> </div>\ </div>\ <div class="skillbox" title="Attunement, connectedness, and intuition.">\ $skill.signal <div class="skillname">\ <i class="fa-solid fa-tower-broadcast"></i> </div>\ </div>\ </div>\ </div> <h1>"""---""" [[CONTINUE|Tutorial Offer]] / [[RESTART|Class]] """---"""</h1>\<p>If this is your first time playing Signal Hill, looking over the tutorial is highly recommended. If you're a returning player, or just like living on the edge, feel free to skip it. Don't worry- you can always click the question mark in the upper right hand corner to check it out again.</p> <h1>Would you like to read the tutorial?</h1> <h1>"""------""" [[YES|Intro Tutorial]] / [[NO|Intro 3]] """------"""</h1>\<h1><span style="float: left">[[Done|Intro 3]]</span>\ <span style="float: right; text-align: right">\ <<link "Leads">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Leads Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Skills">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Skills Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Weapons">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Weapons Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>> <<link "Identity">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Identity Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "Wealth">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "Wealth Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>>\ /\ <<link "XP">>\ <<replace "#tutorial">><<include "XP Tutorial">><</replace>>\ <</link>></span></h1> <hr> <div id="tutorial"><<include "Tutorial Intro">></div><h1>"""-----""" THE AMBUSH """-----"""</h1>\ <p>You'd been travelling this road for days alongside the other caravaneers. They were all hardened by years of this work, drifters, knew the routes like they knew the insides of their eyelids. Knew where to move to avoid the things that lurked beyond the horizon. That didn't stop the groaning. The sun beat down on your backs. Warm sweat dripped from your forehead<<for _item range $outfit.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("tops")>> and stained your _item<</if>><</for>>. The static hum was bright and crisp against the stillness of the evening air. The only sound for miles was the car radio, old guitar and heavy drums fading in and out amidst a shroud of fuzz. The screen flickered, casting the cargo in bright green.</p> <p>By the time the city came over the horizon in the South, the sun was retreating, replaced by a new and vibrant glow.</p> * [[Signal Hill. Holy ground.|Intro 4][$beau]] * [[Signal Hill. A new life.|Intro 4]] * [[Signal Hill. Garish, desolate.|Intro 4]] <<dropall $wardrobe>>\ <<if $player.gender isnot "man">>\ <<set $attraction.push("kc", "reese")>>\ <</if>>\ <<if $gameversion == "Patreon">>\ <<completeachievement "patreon" "Thanks for your support!">> <</if>><p>Framed by far-off constructs of chrome and glass that gleamed in the waning sunlight, Signal Hill was a jumble of wires and scrap metal rising out of the ash. Vibrant reds, blues, and greens reflected off the haze of diesel exhaust that hung over it. Alight like a burn pit. Rising out of its center, a tall spire of thin metal with barbs shooting out in regular angles. The radio in the car sung back to it in the voice of an ancient crooner.</p> <p>For a moment, you were entranced by the sound.</p> <p>//This is a skilled move. The numbers on the dice will show what the target is, and the symbol next to it is the skill you're rolling with.//</p> * <<link 'It is distracting. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-brain"></i>'>>\ <<savvyroll 6 "Intro Noticed" "Intro Distracted">>\ <</link>>\<p>But you could still make out the sound of heavy footsteps off to the east. Notable. There hadn't been another soul for miles, apart from the other caravan guards. For a moment terror gripped your heart, before it yielded to confusion- you wouldn't be hearing it if one of those //things// were here. You'd be gone already, probably. Sure enough, as you cast your eyes towards them you saw that it was //people// approaching.</p> <p>From the look of them, whoever was approaching you meant business. About five guys dressed in some semblance of military garb, all body armour and vests and pouches like GI Joes. In their hands, gunmetal black rifles like the movies, ominous and hefty. From the way the guy at the front was looking at you, you got the strong feeling their intentions weren't pure.<<if $skill.signal == 1>> His presence interrupted the soundscape, a new frequency that made your hands cold and your ears sting.<</if>></p> <p>The man walking in front of you was down before you could properly react. You nearly tripped over his body crumpled unceremoniously on the ground. The contents of his jugular covered the powder blue Camry in glittering red spots.</p> <p>There was only a split second to react.</p> * [[You try to hide behind the car.|Intro Hide]] * <<link 'You drop and play dead. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-four"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-hand-fist"></i>'>> <<brawnroll 8 "Intro Play Dead" "Intro Fail Dead">>\ <</link>>\<p>You still had time. Time to get the fuck out of here? No. All there was for miles was the ash-wastes, bright and open and empty. Nobody's fast enough to outrun the trigger of a fully automatic M16. The only thing you could do was dive behind the car and <<for _item range $heldweapon.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("ranged")>>try to... well, get them back.<<else>>hide for your life.<</if>><</for>></p> <p>Glass shattered right next to your head as you ducked behind the trunk, showering you in glittering shards. The only intact window wasn't so intact anymore. Another guy, you think they called him Junior, was crouching right next to you. He had a 9mm in his right hand.<<if $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>> Same make and model as yours, old military issue shit that's all over the place now.<</if>></p> <ul>\ <li> [[You try to stay out of sight.|Intro Stay Hidden]]</li> <<for _item range $heldweapon.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("ranged")>>\ <li> [[You ready your gun.|Intro Shoot]]</li> <</if>><</for>>\ </ul>\<p>It was an agonizing wait. Your body wanted desperately to get up and run, but you quelled the urge. <<for _item range $heldweapon.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("ranged")>>You couldn't just come out shooting against, what, five guys with assault rifles? Terrible idea.<<else>>You had nowhere to run. This was a bad position to be in, but there wasn't a better one on offer.<</if>><</for>></p> <p>After what was probably only a few seconds, the bullets stopped flying. You held your breath. Beside you, Junior took the opportunity. One last stand in the face of the reaper, a fifteen bullet hail mary against the weight of the world.</p> <p>After one shot, his body slumped down next to you. You could feel flecks of blood showering against your exposed skin. You didn't look over at him. Nobody wants to see what a gun like that can do to a man's skull.</p> * [[Just stay calm, you think.|Intro Calm]]<p>You could hear chatter over the static buzz in the otherwise quiet evening. "Yeah, it's here," one gruff voice called out. "Then crack the fucking lid, man," another shouted.</p> <p>Another voice, commanding and cold, silenced their chatter. "Get the horses moving towards the depot," he instructed them. He was standing just around the other side of the trunk, sending a shiver down your spine. <<if $skill.signal == 1>>The static hummed louder as he stepped closer, nearly blocking out the sound of his voice. <</if>>"If we open it, we open it there. Better not to expose the cargo to any unnecessary stress."</p> <p>No matter how calm you tried to stay, it wasn't going to help when you were right in the line of fire. The commander stepped out around the vehicle to inspect the corpses and you came face to face with him. All dressed in dark body armour, scrounged but still powerful, with a pistol at his hip and a rifle in his hands. His skin was rosy and dusted with freckles, but his face was far from cheery. The softness of his features and his head-up-his-ass military hairdo came together with the bulky armour and short stature to give him the air of a kid in his dad's uniform. But that cold stare, like a hunter looking at prey. No, like a cat looking at a fly. Jesus christ.</p> * [[And then he shoots you.|Intro Downed]] <<SetFlag "SeenWolfe">>\<<if $heldweapon.has('semi-auto pistol')>><p>You fumbled with the safety on your pistol- normally you were a lot faster with this, but your hands were shaking like a leaf. There was already a round in the chamber, right? Yeah, of course. You always kept it loaded. You had to keep it loaded. Just in case of things like this.</p> <p>A deep breath. Steadying your grip. One of them was just on the other side of the car. Another, near the trunk. If you were fast enough maybe you could take them all out before they started firing again.</p> <p>Their chatter was at its peak. Their guard was down. Now or never. You launched up, trying to keep most of your body behind cover while aiming your pistol at the group of guys. Fifteen rounds.</p> * <<link 'You take the shot. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>'>> <<precisionroll 10 "Intro Gun Fire" "Intro Gun Fail">>\ <</link>>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('hunting rifle')>><p>You fumbled to get your rifle's strap over your head, quick and efficient, without being seen or heard. Harder than it seems. By the time you got it free, you could hear footsteps approaching. Now or never.</p> <p>A deep breath. You positioned the butt of the rifle squarely against your shoulder, preparing to take the shot. One of them was just on the other side of the car. Another, near the trunk. If you were fast enough maybe you could take them all out before they started firing again. Yeah, no. Fat chance.</p> <p>Their chatter was at its peak. Their guard was down. Now or never. You launched up, propping the barrel up over the busted-out window of the car, straight over the cargo and through the other window. Staring through the scope, you aimed at the first guy you saw.</p> * <<link 'You take the shot. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>'>> <<precisionroll 10 "Intro Gun Fire" "Intro Gun Fail">>\ <</link>>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('.44 magnum revolver')>><p>You fumbled with your revolver for a moment, feeling its heft in your hands. Sturdy, reliable. Six bullets, five guys. No fucking way you were getting out of this alive. Maybe you could steal the 9mm off Junior's corpse, if you managed to get through all six rounds before joining him.</p> <p>A deep breath. Steadying your grip. One of them was just on the other side of the car. Another, near the trunk. If you were fast enough maybe you could take them all out before they started firing again.</p> <p>Their chatter was at its peak. Their guard was down. Now or never. You launched up, trying to keep most of your body behind cover while aiming your revolver at the group of guys. Six rounds.</p> * <<link 'You take the shot. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>'>> <<precisionroll 10 "Intro Gun Fire" "Intro Gun Fail">>\ <</link>>\ <<elseif $heldweapon.has('sawed-off shotgun')>>You fumbled to get your shotgun out of its holster. The barrel was short, but it was still a hefty contraption. Sliding the lever to the side you broke it open just to confirm it was loaded- yeah. Two shells, five guys. No fucking way you were getting out of this alive. Maybe you could steal the 9mm off Junior's corpse, if you managed to get through both rounds before joining him.<p> <p>A deep breath. You positioned the butt of the shotgun squarely against your shoulder, moving your finger to the trigger and your other hand gripping near the end of the barrel. One of them was just on the other side of the car. Another, near the trunk.</p> <p>Their chatter was at its peak. Their guard was down. Now or never. You launched up, propping the barrel up over the busted-out window of the car, straight over the cargo and through the other window. You aimed the sights at the closest guy, intent on using every little bit of buckshot to your advantage.</p> * <<link 'You take the shot. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-five"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i>'>> <<precisionroll 10 "Intro Gun Fire" "Intro Gun Fail">>\ <</link>>\ <</if>>\<p>One shot. You saw the guy stagger backwards. <<if $currentweapon.power gte 2>>After a moment of shock, he was down.<<SetFlag "KilledJared">><<completeachievement "ripjared" "RIP Jared">><<else>>His hand went to his thick bulletproof vest, where the bullet had ricocheted off and left noticeable damage.<</if>> Around him, the other guys in their GI Joe outfits jumped into action. Your ears rang from the initial shot without any ear protection, but you could still hear the rain of bullets against the metal of the car between you.</p> <p>You shielded your head in time before it got blown open, but as you crouched under cover, you felt a sudden burning pain in your lower abdomen. Just below your belly button, and a little to the right. You grabbed at it instinctively, and warm blood poured out over your fingers like a waterfall. There was a hole torn straight through the metal. Fuck.</p> * [[Is this it? Curtain call for you? The end of everything?|Intro Crisis]] * [[Yeah, no. You just pass the fuck out.|Intro Pass Out]]<p>One shot. It whizzed over the guy's shoulder. He turned. He saw you. Fuck. They all saw you now. Their bullets rained down like raindrops from heaven, pelting the car and, miraculously, not pelting you. Until you felt a single hard impact on your side. Fuck.</p> <p>You tried to cover it, tried to hold the wound shut, but it had torn straight through your torso. Blood was pouring over your fingers and down your side.</p> * [[Is this it? Curtain call for you? The end of everything?|Intro Crisis]] * [[Yeah, no. You just pass the fuck out.|Intro Pass Out]]<p>Some ancient advice crossed your mind in that split second, beamed directly from some old television PSA recorded on one of your childhood tapes. Or maybe you got it from a wizened old ex-military asshole over a pint of gin. Shooters don't normally shoot dead people. Smear yourself in blood, lay there like a possum rotting in the summer heat.</p> <p>You're out in the open, not hidden enough to roll in blood and really seal the deal. But you've seen enough sorry fucks get shot to know what it looks like. Unless you're getting hit with a sawed-off from a couple inches away, the velocity of a tiny piece of lead isn't going to impact you like the stunt-men on tapes. You envisioned the thing entering your body, its casing fracturing from a tiny explosion just as it rips through your lung. You swayed for a split second before letting your body go limp, overcoming the urge to catch yourself. A cloud of ash rose around your face where your skull hit the ground hard.</p> * [[And so you wait.|Intro Wait]]<p>Some ancient advice crossed your mind in that split second, beamed directly from some old television PSA recorded on one of your childhood tapes. Or maybe you got it from a wizened old ex-military asshole over a pint of gin. Shooters don't normally shoot dead people. Smear yourself in blood, lay there like a possum rotting in the summer heat.</p> <p>You've gotta sell it. There'll be no blood, so they've gotta see it and know in their heart of hearts you've got a bullet in your lung. It's gotta be good. You can imagine what it must be like to get shot in the chest- matching it up to the rhythm of the rifle fire, you fell back against the car before crumpling to the ground. That's what it must be like. Yeah.</p> * [[And so you wait.|Intro Wait][$failed to true]]<p>The wait was agonizing. Especially given that your eyes were closed. Gunshots, screaming, chaos. The buzzing static. A smooth hip-hop jazz fusion playing over the car radio. You could feel the warmth of blood against your arm, trickling over from that poor son of a bitch's mangled carotid arteries. At some point, the gunshots stopped.</p> <p>You could hear chatter over the static buzz in the otherwise quiet evening. "Yeah, it's here," one gruff voice called out. "Then crack the fucking lid, man," another shouted.</p> <p>Another voice, commanding and cold, silenced their chatter. "Get the horses moving towards the depot," he said. He was standing just next to you, sending a shiver down your spine. <<if $skill.signal == 1>>The static hummed louder as he stepped closer, nearly blocking out the sound of his voice. <</if>>"If we open it, we open it there. Better not to expose the cargo to any unnecessary stress."</p> * [[They're robbing you, of course.|Intro Robbed]]<<if $failed is true>>\ <p>Without warning, you felt a sharp kick to the ribs. Not enough to break anything, but enough to sear in pain. "You didn't get this one, dumbasses," the commander told his men in a dry tone. "Do I have to do everything around here?"</p> <<else>>\ <p>Then you heard what you had been hoping not to. "Hit all of 'em one more time, just to be sure," their commander instructed. You could hear their footsteps as they walked around the car, and one guy close to you. The sound of his boots were heavy, close to your head.</p> <</if>>\ <p>The sound was loud enough to stun you for a second. It felt like you got a 20lb baseball dropped right on your abdomen, and then the burning started. A searing, burning pain right below your belly button and a little to the left. Your eyes snapped open, vision blurry as they welled up in tears, all that life-giving water streaming down the sides of your face<<if $player.cosmetics.includes("khol") or $player.cosmetics.includes("eye powder")>>, streaking your makeup with it<</if>>.</p> <p>You got just a brief glance at the guy standing over you, through a haze of tears. His gaze was cold and he had a face like a lynx, calculating and sharp. <<if $failed is true>>"Check the rest of them. Don't want this shit getting back to the General."<<else>>"Come on, let's get this back to the depot. The General's expecting us back by 10."<</if>> You were right. Military guys.<<if $skill.brawn == 1>> Or rather, militia guys. Signal Hill didn't have a proper military, neither did anywhere else. Smaller and disorganized citizen-led groups were the standard.<</if>></p> <p>A couple more shots rang out, and the guy stepped over your limp body, leaving you to die in the ash.</p> * [[And then you pass out.|Intro Pass Out]] <<SetFlag "HeardGeneral">>\<p>So distracting that you didn't notice anything was off until the shots rang out. The guy in front of you was down before anybody could react, a hole in his side and then a bullet ripping through his throat. You nearly tripped over his body crumpled unceremoniously on the ground. The contents of his jugular covered the powder blue Camry in glittering red spots.</p> * [[You were next.|Intro Downed]]<p><<if $player.markings.includes("bullet scar")>>Being shot was nothing new. <<else>>It didn't feel like getting shot //should// feel. <</if>>The initial impact was like being struck with a baseball. No sharp pain, no burning pain. That would come later.</p> <p>You weren't hit directly in your windpipe, or maybe you'd be down in an instant like that other guy. Instead, you had a second to think about it. Your hand went to your abdomen, right to the left of your belly button and a little below. Blood was pouring out over your fingers from the wound, a red waterfall streaming down your leg.<<if $skill.glam == 1>><<for _item range $outfit.array>><<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("bottoms")>> Your _item was gonna be ruined after this. Dammit.<</if>><</for>><</if>></p> * [[Is this it? Curtain call for you? The end of everything?|Intro Crisis]] * [[Yeah, no. You just pass the fuck out.|Intro Pass Out]]<<if $skill.savvy == 1>>\ <p>No, no. You felt around the other side of your body, looking for an exit wound that maybe you couldn't feel yet. Yeah, there it was. Right on the other side of your back. It felt gnarly, but its existence was a godsend.</p> <p>If your spine had been hit, you wouldn't be upright right now. If your stomach was hit, you wouldn't be upright either. Your bladder could have been hit, ditto with your intestines. If you didn't bleed out, peritonitis was the main concern. Mortality rate, maybe 40% or so. Good odds. If you got treated. Which might be hard out in the middle of the ash-wastes.</p> * <<link "And //then// you pass the fuck out.">><<goto "Intro Pass Out">><</link>> <<else>>\ <p>Oh, lord, this was //it//. It was all over. All your hopes and dreams, all your life plans (not that you necessarily had any of those). All gone in the time it took to squeeze a trigger. And now your body was gonna be left out in the ash-wastes to feed the turkey vultures and blow flies. What was the point of any of this? You might as well have-</p> * <<link "And //then// you pass the fuck out.">><<goto "Intro Pass Out">><</link>> <</if>>\<p>Your mind was enveloped in a deep, calm nothing. Void all around you, pressing in on you like the womb. The ash in your lungs was alight like a cigarette butt unceremoniously tossed in the streets, and the lines of an old radio play from your youth repeated in your mind like a broken record. Your body was twisting and shifting into the ground with every breath, endlessly spiralling in on yourself. And then the void was filled with colours that moved and shifted like you were. Sprites of red and blue and gold and some colours you didn't know the name for danced behind your eyelids.</p> <p>If this was what dying felt like, maybe it wasn't so bad. Less people shooting at you if you're dead. No need to worry about your next meal if you're dead. The only dead people you've met were pretty damn peaceful after a bullet got put between their eyes.</p> * [[You can feel yourself slipping away.|Intro Doc]]<p>Through blurry vision, you could see it- the spectre of death looming over you. A tall, broad-shouldered figure clad in a long black coat, with a wide brimmed hat and beaked mask. Like an old-timey doctor, you think. You don't know much about old-timey shit, apart from the fact that the doctors looked fucked up. Like this guy.</p> * [[Thank god, you just want it to be over.|Intro Kneel]] * [[No... you aren't ready to go yet...|Intro Kneel]]<p>Doesn't matter what you want. He was here for you.</p> <p>The figure kneeled down next to you, his face coming into greater detail as your eyes fluttered open a little further. A mask made of black hide stitched with heavy sinew and held together with metal rivets, with a single piece of curved glass sealed over the eyes like ski goggles and thick plastic straps around the back of his head. On either side of the black beak were cylindrical filters like that of a gas mask, with the leather cut and riveted together around them. Tassels of leather and beads hung from the brim of his hat.</p> <p>He reached towards your neck with one hand. Long fingers, like that of a piano player, thin and elegant and pale against black fingerless gloves. His index and middle finger pressed uncomfortably hard on the skin just below your jaw, like pressing into the muscle and bone below. Those fingers were a bit too warm and soft to be the grim reaper, you figured. Although who knows. Up North there's this death-saint, and she looks pretty damn warm and //very// soft.</p> * [[Maybe this is just a guy.|Intro Fate]]<p>The Lady Death, as she was called up North- that's who you'd imagine carrying your soul to purgatory, if you were to hallucinate such a thing. As a kid you saw her portrait every time you visited your uncle's home- her body gaunt and yet rosy, her hands crossed over her chest where a bullet pierced her heart as if lying in a coffin. Pale blonde hair spilled over her bare shoulders, and black tears were streaked down her face.</p> <p>//You've unlocked an identity. If you choose to take it, it'll say something about who you are as a person, and give you bonuses and drawbacks to match. You don't need to take every identity you stumble across- think of them as suggestions, based on the decisions you've made.//</p> <<include "devotee">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "devotee" "Devotee">><<goto "Intro Miracle">><</link>> / [[NO|Intro Miracle]] """---"""</h1>\<p>After a moment, his fingers left your neck and he stood to his feet. It was muffled by the mask, but you could just barely make out him saying, "Damn miracle this one's still alive." He gazed off towards the South, and as he turned, you could see a large backpack full of pockets upon pockets was slung over his shoulder. On his other, a rifle strapped to his back- a deep matte gray, with a long barrel and long scope. Designed for a sniper. A kind of spectre of death, you suppose.</p> <p>The man turned back towards your prone form, giving you an urgent nudge just below the ribs with the tip of his steel-toed boot. "Do you hear me? You aren't brain dead, right?"</p> * [[You try to respond.|Intro Speak][$temp = true]] * [[You can't even try.|Intro Speak]]<<if $temp == true>>\ <p>You opened your lips to speak. Your lungs felt so heavy. Words were just not in your wheelhouse right now. Maybe a coughing fit, if you had the energy.</p> <<else>>\ <p>You stared up at him, unable to even try to muster a word. Were you brain dead? Would you know? Would you feel, hear, see if you were brain dead? You'd never really considered it. Most people nowadays who are brain dead are also body dead.<<if $skill.savvy == 1>> In fact, if he was making the distinction, you'd wager he'd worked as a crash medic or clinic tech before.<</if>></p> <</if>>\ <p>The man let his bag fall from his shoulder and land with a thud on the ash next to you. A cloud of the stuff rose in the air around it, choking your lungs up even more. "If you are lucid, I'm sorry about this. It's gonna hurt."</p> * [[He isn't lying.|Intro Surgery]] <<unset $temp>>\<p>Producing an array of bandages and an impressively sharp curved needle threaded with blue nylon, he got to work on your body. The burning pain of the bullet hole came into sharp focus with every stab of the needle, although he moved in quick, practiced motions and clearly knew what he was doing. When the hasty work was done, he turned you on your side and kneeled behind you. The wound in your back was clearly worse, as indicated by his mumbled complaints about "Exit wounds... Nothing to even grab onto..."</p> <p>After you'd been thoroughly stitched back together, he shrugged off his long dark coat, revealing a practical western shirt and rugged denim jeans underneath- Levi's, covered in assorted denim patches where wear had eaten away at them. You drifted in and out of consciousness as he lashed your $player.bodytype frame into the trenchcoat like a cocoon with the arms tied around your chest, wrapped your legs together with a bungee cord, and secured a spare shirt from his bag in place under your head and neck.</p> * [[You aren't very lucid for this.|Intro Drag]] * [[You aren't lucid, but you are panicking.|Intro Drag]]<p>Whenever you came to, the world was dark. Rope dug into your armpits, your head was hanging back over your shoulders, and you could feel your feet bouncing against the uneven ground of the ash-wastes as you were dragged unceremoniously across the blasted desert. It was only fractions, of course. Flickers of life between long rests. No level of discomfort could keep you awake through blood loss-induced sleep. It could have taken five minutes or five hours. His muscles must have been burning after all this.</p> <p>The next time you woke up was under bright fluorescents, lying on a bare-threaded cot mattress, bandaged around the midsection with a needle hooked into your arm.</p> * [[Wake up.|Crash Medicine]]<h1>"""----""" NEW STORY """----"""</h1> <h5>[[CHECKUP|Checkup Leaving]]</h5><p>You reached for the brass doorknob and had to quickly back out of the way as the door swung open right in your face. On the other side, rushing out fast enough that he nearly bowled you over, was Doc. After a moment of flustered apologizing and regaining his composure, he muttered, "<<print $player.name>>! Um... fancy seeing you here."</p> <p>You took a moment to take in Doc's appearance. He was back in the long coat he wore when you first met him (luckily, not stained with your blood), loose and unbuttoned over a worn denim shirt. A leather belt with a large, garish brass buckle was holding up his jeans. It was decorated with the shape of a running horse. In his arms, he was cradling a large cardboard box.</p> <p>"What are you up to?" It occurred to you that apart from your first encounter, you'd never seen him leave the clinic. Married to his work.</p> <p>"I'm just making a quick delivery," he said, shifting to try to balance the box a little better in his arms. It was an awkward shape, a little too wide to comfortably hold. "Actually, would you like to come with? You've been in the city a while, I'd like to hear how you're finding it."<<if $skill.savvy gte 1>> He was definitely interested, yes- but probably a little more interested in your search for the mysterious cargo.<</if>></p> * [[“Sure, I can tag along.”|Checkup]] * [[“Yeah, I guess so.”|Checkup]]<p>Doc started off down the ashy, unpaved street, walking at a more leisurely pace to accommodate your presence. It was around mid-day and the sun was beating down on the ash-wastes harder than normal. Folks in the Row were mostly taking shelter. A few people were rushing through the streets with some place to go, but most were hidden under shady overhangs, sitting by open windows, toiling away at some menial task in the warm weather. An old woman sitting on a rocking chair waved to Doc as you passed, and he flashed her a wide smile and a polite nod.</p> <p>That box looked pretty uncomfortable to carry.</p> * [[“Hey, I can get that for you.”|Checkup Box]] * [[That's his burden to bear. You're just going on a pleasant walk.|Checkup Check In]]<p>"Oh." Stopping for a moment, Doc looked over at you, trying to assess the situation. <<if $skill.brawn gte 1>>He pursed his lips. "I suppose so." It took a little longer than it should have, shifting the thing in his arms to try to get enough of a grip to hand it over, but eventually you had taken the proverbial (and literal) load off his shoulders.<<set $temp = true>><<else>>He pursed his lips, looking over you. "I think I've got it, <<print $player.name>>. I'm stronger than I look, you know." Jeez. You were just trying to be nice.<</if>></p> <<if $temp == true>>\ <p>With the box in your arms, you could get a better idea of what was inside. The contents jingled pleasantly when they shifted, like the sort of wreath of bells you'd set up during holidays up North. It was far heavier than expected, though. Glass bottles, probably, full of some kind of liquid. Alcohol? Maybe. Or maybe medicine.</p> <</if>>\ <<include "Checkup Check In">>\ <<set $relationship.doc to $relationship.doc.fm(5)>>\<p>"So," Doc started, glancing over at you as the two of you strolled down the main street of Skid Row towards The Stacks. "It's been a little while. How have you been finding the city?"</p> <ul>\ <<if $wealth lte 1>>\ <li> [[“Well, I can't seem to find work. "Yes, you're not the only one with that problem, unfortunately. Have you looked into the power plant? I think they're usually hiring."</p> <p>You were absolutely not going to get a job at the power plant. That sounded hard and boring. And also wouldn't make for a very interesting story. "I thought there was plenty of work in the city. That's what they said up North."</p> <p>"Only for people desperate enough to accept it, I'm afraid." He had a quiet resignation in his voice. He operated a free clinic. He knew the people desperate enough to accept it.</p> <<if $leads.includes("testrun") or $playedleads.includes("testrun") or Flag("LamplighterMember")>>\ <p>"Well, I've gotten in with <<if $finishedleads.includes("lamplighters")>>that group of mercenaries you told me about.<<else>>this group of mercenaries outside the city.<</if>> It's going well, I think."</p> <<if $finishedleads.includes("lamplighters")>>\ <p>He nodded. But y'know. I've just gotta show them I'm capable."</p> <</if>>\ <<else>>\ <p>He frowned, once again glancing over at you to assess your expression. "You did, did you? That's... nice. He didn't elaborate any further.</p> <</if>>\ <<set $temp1 = "mercs">>\ <<elseif $leads.includes("waveform") or Flag("WorkingForYvette")>>\ <p>"I found some... interesting work in the Red Light District, so that's something at least." <<if $finishedleads.includes("roseandthorn")>>You were a little hesitant to tell him the specifics up front, given how he told you specifically //not// to get work there.<<else>>You were a little hesitant to share the specifics, unsure if this was supposed to be some kind of secret.<</if>></p> <p>"Oh. That's... nice." Doc kept his eyes fixed ahead of him, as if a little embarrassed by this turn in the conversation. "I hope you're keeping safe. We provide STD testing, I'd highly recommend doing that regularly."</p> <p>"Appreciate it, Doc." Awkward. At least he's concerned about your health, though. That's nice of him.</p> <<set $temp1 = "redlight">>\ <<else>>\ <p>"I swear to god, it's like every gig in this city requires you to jump through fifty hoops before you get paid," you muttered. That's not how that's supposed to work."</p> <</if>>\ <<include "Checkup Anyway">><<if Flag("ReattachedFinger")>>\ <p>"Oh, yes, of course." Doc furrowed his brow, looking over you quickly. He seemed to accept that response, oddly enough.</p> <<else>>\ <p>"Jesus, <<print $player.name>>. You lost a finger?" He started scanning your hands, quickly identifying the stump where your pinky finger had been. It's only been... a week, maybe."</p> <p>"It's a long story. I'll tell you later." He seemed to accept that response, oddly enough.</p> <<set $temp1 = "kidnapped">>\ <<include "Checkup Anyway">><p>"Wow. I'd say." An amused smile crossed his face. "You're doing better for yourself after a few days than I have been my whole life, by that metric!"</p> <p>"I guess I am!" You beamed. "You haven't been shot again, right?"</p> <p>"All in once piece. You should see the other guys, though." That made him smile.</p> <<set $temp1 = "gunfight">>\ <<include "Checkup Anyway">><p>"Well, I hope it's been eventful in a good way," he muttered, though it was clear from the look on his face that he knew that wasn't true. "Signal Hill can be a bit... rough. As I'm sure you've seen firsthand."</p> <p>"Yeah, tell me about it."</p> <<include "Checkup Anyway">><p>"Anyway." <<if $temp == true>>Doc adjusted the collar on his overcoat,<<else>>Doc adjusted the box in his arms,<</if>> veering off to the right, to where the unpaved roads of Skid Row blended into the cobbled streets of The Stacks. "I hope you've been getting yourself situated. Made anybody's acquaintance?"</p> <p>"Oh, plenty." Around you, the buildings were getting sparser and more spaced out, more permanent. Scrap metal and wood gave way to large, sold brick constructions. His concern was probably not misplaced.</p> <ul>\ <<if $temp1 == "mercs">>\ <li> <<link "“Well, there are those mercs we talked about.”">><<if $leads.includes("testrun") or $playedleads.includes("testrun")>><<if Flag("LamplighterEnemy")>><<goto "Checkup Lamplighters False">><<else>><<goto "Checkup Lamplighters True">><</if>><<else>><<goto "Checkup Lamplighters False">><</if>><</link>></li> <<else>>\ <li> <<link "“Well, I met up with these mercs.”">><<if $leads.includes("testrun") or $playedleads.includes("testrun")>><<if Flag("LamplighterEnemy")>><<goto "Checkup Lamplighters False">><<else>><<goto "Checkup Lamplighters True">><</if>><<else>><<goto "Checkup Lamplighters False">><</if>><</link>></li> <</if>>\ </ul>\ <<unset $temp1>>\<p>"The Lamplighters, you mean?" He pursed his lips. His heels clicked against the paving stones underfoot, these leather Western boots with patterns stamped into the sides. "Have you been working with them?"</p> <<if Flag("LamplighterMember")>>\ <p>"Yeah, I'm actually an official member now," you announced, a little pride in your voice. "Haven't taken any jobs yet, but y'know. I got in."</p> <<elseif $playedleads.includes("testrun")>>\ <p>"Yeah, I did a little mission with them.
