"Maybe. What kind of work are you looking for?"</p> * [[“I don't know. Quick, easy mercenary work?”|Crash Work][$temp to "merc"]] * [[“I mostly just look hot and have very few skills.”|Crash Work][$temp to "hot"]] * [[“Well, the easiest way would be to track down that cargo, right?”|Crash Work][$temp to "cargo"]]<<if $temp is "merc">>\ <p>"There's no shortage of work for mercenary types here." He said it with a neutral tone, yet his voice dripped with vitriol. It was obvious you were missing some kind of context, some politics that eluded you. "If you want to deal with good folks and don't mind working a little outside the law, I'd recommend seeking out the Lamplighters. They've got headquarters in the Graveyard down South."</p> <p>"Why's it called the Graveyard?" You could only assume he wasn't talking about a real graveyard. Although on second thought, a mercenary organization located in a graveyard would be rad as hell.</p> <p>The man shook his head. "The buildings look like graves. There's more to it, but, well..." He pursed his lips and gazed off into the corner of the room. Maybe you shouldn't have asked. "Signal Hill has a past. You'll figure it out."</p> <<addlead "lamplighters" "Lamplighters">>\ <<elseif $temp is "hot">>\ <p>He shook his head in polite disdain, a small smile spread across his thin lips. There was almost an implied //"At least you admit it."// But ever the professional, he intoned, "If you are so inclined... there is a Red Light District in town. Do with that information what you will." As if immediately regretting this, he added, "Stay away from The Rose and Thorn, though."</p> <p>You immediately perked up at the name. Classy yet sexy, like a pearl necklace laid over a bare chest. What could the thorn to their rose imply? An intriguing mystery. "Why shouldn't I go there, exactly?"</p> <p>"I'm sure you've run into your fair share of nasty folks up North, but down here in Signal Hill, pretty much everybody's looking to take advantage of you. Just take my advice." That did not reassure you at all. In fact it probably boldened you. This place sounded fucking //fun.//</p> <<addlead "roseandthorn" "Rose and Thorn">>\ <<elseif $temp is "cargo">>\ <p>An amused smile crossed his face. "You're planning to hunt down the people who almost shot you to death... and what? Steal it back?"</p> <p>Admittedly, this was a silly idea. In your state, you weren't going to be gunning down any armed men. "I can at least try to figure out who it was..." You were thinking of this on the spot. "The company accepting the delivery... they'd probably know what it was and who would want it."</p> <p>The man shrugged. "That documentation on your body that was soaked with blood, but I might be able to recover an address from it." You tried to sit up and winced in pain, earning a concerned shake of the head. "No... you need to take some time. When you've gotten settled and are feeling better, come to my office and we can discuss this."</p> <<addlead "consultation" "Consultation">>\ <</if>>\ <p>At this point, you were feeling pretty damn lucid. Whatever drugs you were on, they were working a treat to keep you from being in debilitating pain. You were still well aware that you were injured, but once you could get out of this cot and change back into your real clothes you'd surely feel much more like yourself.</p> <p>And speaking of acting like yourself (or not), it suddenly occurred to you that you'd been a little rude so far. You hadn't even asked this guy...</p> * [[“Sorry, I didn't catch your name?”|Crash Name]]<p>"Ah. Yes." The man straightened his shirt, as if trying to present the best possible version of himself to you. This, after you saw him wearing a freaky bird mask and cloak in the blasted ash-wastes. "You can just call me Doc. That's what most folks around here know me as."</p> <p>"So you're a doctor?" Not many of those around nowadays. People are good at killing, not so good at patching up the people who survive.</p> <p>"No." It was said with a bluntness you'd come to expect from Doc over the course of this conversation, but certainly wasn't the expected response. It was kind of a rhetorical question, actually. "No" wasn't supposed to be an option.</p> <p>You sat up, a little more carefully this time, wincing as the tube settled in place again.</p> * [[“Why did you do surgery on me if you're not a doctor?”|Crash Surgery]] * [[“Then what are you?”|Crash Druggist]] * [[“Wait, then why do people call you Doc?”|Crash Doc]] <<unset $temp>>\<p>"Doctors are expected to have formal medical training and swear by oaths of medical ethics," he explained, his tone as dry as usual despite this potentially concerning revelation. "It doesn't take either to learn to stitch somebody up. If you're looking for a real physician, well, my colleague Joyette is the person you're after."</p> <p>"So what, you're some kind of crash medic? Tech? Nurse?"</p> <p>"I consider myself a druggist."</p> <<if $skill.savvy == 1>>\ <p>You know that means, like, a pharmacist. Somebody who prescribes drugs. You're not a fucking idiot.</p> <<else>>\ <p>"So what, you do drugs for a living?" You aren't very bright.</p> <p>Doc gave you a stare like you'd asked him the exact right question to annoy him. "I develop and prescribe medicine." Yeah, no, that made more sense than your thing.</p> <</if>>\ * [[“Well, Doc, it's been nice to meet you.”|Crash Meet]] * [[“Thanks for saving my life, Doc.”|Crash Save]] * [[“Doc, has anyone ever told you that you have beautiful eyes?”|Crash Eyes]]<p>"I consider myself a druggist."</p> <<if $skill.savvy == 1>>\ <p>You know that means, like, a pharmacist. Somebody who prescribes drugs. You're not a fucking idiot.</p> <<else>>\ <p>"So what, you do drugs for a living?" You aren't very bright.</p> <p>Doc gave you a stare like you'd asked him the exact right question to annoy him. "I develop and prescribe medicine." Yeah, no, that made more sense than your thing.</p> <</if>>\ * [[“Well, Doc, it's been nice to meet you.”|Crash Meet]] * [[“Thanks for saving my life, Doc.”|Crash Save]] * [[“Doc, has anyone ever told you that you have beautiful eyes?”|Crash Eyes]]<p>"The people we treat here, they don't care what the difference is. I might as well be their doctor. So the nickname sticks." You get the sense, from how he speaks about them, that the people he treats wouldn't be able to afford a doctor if they wanted to.</p> <p>"What came first, the nickname or the bird mask?"</p> <p>He paused for a moment, as if feeling like he'd been put on the spot. "The nickname," he admitted. Doc's voice rarely strayed far from a sort of platonic ideal in tone, but this seemed like the closest he would get to sheepish.</p> * [[“Well, Doc, it's been nice to meet you.”|Crash Meet]] * [[“Thanks for saving my life, Doc.”|Crash Save]] * [[“Doc, has anyone ever told you that you have beautiful eyes?”|Crash Eyes]]<p>"Now, don't be too hasty to leave."</p> <<include "Crash Drugs">><p>"Oh. Yes." He seemed a bit uncomfortable. Perhaps not used to praise. "Don't thank me yet, though."</p> <<include "Crash Drugs">><p>"Please don't talk to me like that." He spoke in a very assured voice, making it as clear as can be that he wouldn't accept that kind of behaviour. Noted.</p> <<include "Crash Drugs">> <<set $flirt.doc += 1>>\<p>He turned to walk back across the room, close to the door. Now that you were sitting up a little, you could see it more properly- a small space, about as sterile as it could be in a world like this. Three walls were cheap white plaster, with only a plain blue curtain shielding you from the rest of the clinic. The floor was plain concrete marked from years of foot traffic. Close to the curtain. a large metal locker with the door open, revealing your clothing hanging inside.</p> <p>Doc approached the only other piece of furniture in here, a metal table pushed against the far wall. A few surgical tools- tubing, scissors, needles- were scattered across its surface. What he picked up was a glass vial that rattled with little white cylinders- pills. Drugs.</p> <p>"You'll need to take these. For the pain. And I will get you some antibiotics from the lab as soon as I can." Turning back to you, his expression was deadly serious. "I do not say this lightly. I will give you only what you need, and I will be monitoring your use. You will be off these in a week, and will not be recieving any more, understood?"</p> * [[“Yeah, sure thing, Doc.”|Crash Care]] * [[“Uh... yeah. I will definitely stop taking drugs when you tell me to. Absolutely.”|Crash Care][$temp == "hedonist"]] * [[“Don't worry, I'll find something more fun.”|Crash Care][$temp == "hedonist"]]<<if $temp == "hedonist">>\ <p>"I truly do not care what kind of recreational drugs you get involved with," Doc articulated. "But if you're looking to abuse my services, or sell off medications I give you in confidence, I will kindly ask you to leave."</p> <p>This is something he deals with a lot. You don't have to be a genius to judge that from the exhaustion in his eyes. He's had this conversation with at least two dozen people who've turned around and done exactly that. It's probably best not to push his boundaries. "Don't worry, I'm not going to sell that shit. I'll probably need it too badly anyway." That might be a lie. Who knows.</p> <</if>>\ <p>He cleared his throat. "That aside. If you wish to stay here for a little while, given the circumstances, I'll try to keep this bed open for you. If you have any more problems with the surgery site, or especially if you notice blood in your stool, speak to Joyette about it. She's usually in the clinic while I'm in the lab."</p> * [[“Thanks, Doc.”|Crash Complete]] * [[“I might, if I don't find something better.”|Crash Complete]] * [[“Free bed? Hell yeah.”|Crash Complete]] <<if not $temppocket == true>>\ <<pocket "Painkillers" 5>>\ <<set $temppocket = true>> <</if>>\ <<unset $temp>><p>Doc gave you a simple, polite nod and, after confirming you were stable and disconnecting you from the IV, he excused himself. Finally, you were left alone with your thoughts. And lord knows you had a lot of thoughts, now that you had a bit more blood going to your brain. New city. Bullet hole in your stomach. Broke. This was certainly a situation, what you'd found yourself in.</p> <p>Still... maybe you could make the best of it?</p> * [[You're certainly going to try.|Crash Finish]] <<set $temppocket = false>><h1>"""----""" STORY COMPLETE """----"""</h1> <h5>[[CONTINUE|Clinic Room]]</h5> <<set $temp = "wakeup">>\<h1>"""----""" NEW STORY """----"""</h1> <h5>[[DRESS UP GAMES|Dress Entrance]]</h5><p>You stepped inside the boutique and were stopped in your tracks by the tableau before you. The windows had all been opened, letting the warm breeze of the outside in. It rippled through diaphanous white curtains, which billowed throughout the room as if suspended in gently flowing water. The light from the chandelier refracted off its crystals, casting millions of shimmering points of light across the carpet. Everything a pale white or soft cream, a golden clock mounted above the doorway that led into the back, it was like the waiting room for Heaven.</p> <p>Through the waves of fabric, you could see Yvette leaning against the store's central counter. He blended in perfectly, a cream satin sash tied around his waist where a gossamer white blouse met a pair of billowy palazzo pants. His hand curled around the lip of the countertop, nails long and deep red. A rose, the same blood red as his lips, was pinned to his blouse.</p> <p>His eyes met yours, and he beckoned you closer with a curl of his finger. "<<print $player.name>>, it took you long enough! Come here, let me get a look at you."</p> * [[Excited, you approach him.|Dress Approach][$temp to "excited"]] * [[Reluctant, you approach him.|Dress Approach][$temp to "reluctant"]]<<if $temp == "excited">>\ <<if $attraction.yvette == true>>\ <p>This really was like a scene from a movie, set against the backdrop of billowing curtains. Except rather than seeing the beautiful ingénue from across the room, you supposed were the ingénue, about to be swept off their feet by the charming yet dangerous protagonist. Your step was almost a skip as you approached, ignoring the lick of the fabric against your cheek.</p> <p>"Eager, are we?" Yvette was clearly amused by your readiness. "That's good... we need to get to work!"</p> <<else>>\ <p>This place oozed luxury. And you were here. In it. Like a real customer. Except instead of paying money, you were going to be given free shit? Score!</p> <p>You strode up to Yvette, brushing aside the soft curtains as they licked at your flesh. "I'm here! I'm ready!"</p> <p>"Oh, so eager!" He was delighted by your willingness. "Well then, let's get going- we have some serious work to do."</p> <</if>>\ <<set $relationship.yvette to $relationship.yvette.fm(5)>>\ <<else>>\ <<if $attraction.yvette == true>>\ <p>Your heart was caught in your throat. You took a few unsteady steps towards him, surrounded by the billowing embrace of soft fabric that licked your cheek and brushed your arm. He flashed a mischievous smile. "Come on, I don't bite. We've got work to attend to!"</p> <<else>>\ <p>You were always nervous around him. How could you not be, with the way sharp teeth flashed behind his lips as he curled them into a smile? His presence resisted normalcy.</p> <p>Noting your hesitance, his frown turned to a pout. "Come on, don't be shy. We've got work to attend to!"</p> <</if>>\ <</if>>\ <p>"What kind of work?" What work could be done in a place like this? Apart from sewing. That was the typical work done in a boutique.</p> <p>"Do you think I'm getting you a new outfit out of the goodness of my heart?" He tittered, as if the idea was absurd. "Honey, I like you, but my policy is to never spend money on somebody unless I'm getting something in return."</p> <p>You pursed your lips. That sounded... <<if $temp == "excited">>exciting.<<else>>concerning.<</if>> "And what's that?"</p> <p>Reaching out a dainty hand, he grasped your wrist tight and began to pull you back behind the counter. Towards the back room. "All will be revealed in time! For now, let's get you dressed."</p> * [[And so you follow.|Dress Back Room]]<p>You followed past two large columns, into a little vestibule. Off to each side were small rooms with drapes pulled off to one side- a changing room on the left, a storage room on the right. But you passed both of those behind, into the bright warmth of the dressmaker's workshop.</p> <p>Scattered all across this room were tools, workbenches, mannequins full of in-progress works of art. And yet it was not a mess. No. It was pristine, like every little nook and cranny was cleaned to within an inch of its life. An open window cast rays of light down onto the center of the room, as if a spotlight was illuminating it- a stage. Well, not quite a stage- a small, raised wooden platform painted a smooth white, with dappled light from the outside settling on its surface. As if calling to you to step up there, perform.</p> <p>When the two of you entered, the seamstress herself looked up from her work. She was positioned at a pristine 70s sewing machine, all cream and angles with a blocky stripe of blue across its L-shaped frame. "Oh, finally, your little Northerner's here."</p> * [[That's you. You're the little Northerner.|Dress Judge]]<<styletest>>\ <p>Darling pushed a pair of gold wire-frame glasses down the bridge of her nose, her warm brown eyes looking you up and down. Judging you. For a solid minute, or at least that's what it felt like. The machine whirred in the background, stopped with its needle stabbed through a glitzy sequined fabric.</p> <<if _result == "fetish">>\ <p>Finally, after a breathless moment, she raised an eyebrow at Yvette. "I think <<print $pro.they>><<if $pro.they == "they">>'ve<<else>>'s<</if>> got the look already, hm? Evidently, you passed a test.</p> <<elseif _result == "luxury">>\ <p>Finally, she gave Yvette a dismissive shrug. He hooked a bit of the slinky sequin fabric she was working with under his nail, lifting it up and giving the glittery plastic a detached stare. "This kind of stuff was all the rage when we were kids, but I'm afraid you've gentrified it. It's not quite going to pass anymore."</p> <<else>>\ <p>Finally, she muttered under her breath, "I see what you mean." Her stare turned from curious to disapproving. You did not look //right//. $temp5>> <<unset $temp6>> <<unset $tempoutfit>> <<unset $tempoutfitname>> <</silently>>\<h1>"""----""" NEW STORY """----"""</h1> <h5>[[RIDE THE WAVEFORM|Wave Search]]</h5><p>You scanned the bustling streets for any sign of that club... bar... whatever it was that Yvette had told you to find. "Waveform." With a name like that, you were picturing some kind of nightclub for sure- some hippie club full of New Look rich folks drinking shit you couldn't afford and dancing to whatever trashy synth crap they made in a neighbourhood like The Heights. They would probably say something like "Hey man, you digging this beat?" even though the song playing sounded like radio interference and then offer you molly, or whatever rich people do at parties.</p> * [[You were SO excited.|Wave Find][$temp = "excited"]] * [[You were dreading this.|Wave Find][$temp = "dreading"]]<p>It took longer than you cared to admit, but finally you spotted it- unmistakable, glowing bright blue, the word WAVEFORM in some abstract font. Above and below it, more neon tubes extended at varying lengths, their tips forming the arc of a wave above and below the name. It was mounted to what was otherwise a quite ugly looking building, this big concrete box that resembled a warehouse more than a nightclub. But one thing about it really did remind you of a nightclub. The line. It was so long it almost blended in with the crowds walking by, snaking around the building's front and folding back on itself. At the front was a nasty looking bouncer, a mountain of a man in a black tank top with a shotgun at his hip and a look that said he could beat you so hard you'd forget your own name.</p> <p>This was... a conundrum. <<if $temp == "excited">>If you wanted to hang out in the cool kids club, you were gonna need to get around that line somehow.<<else>>If you wanted to get this over with, you were gonna need to get around that line somehow.<</if>> But how?</p> * [[Just... wait in line. Like a civilized person.|Wave Wait]] * [[You've got, like, VIP access. Presumably. Just go ask the bouncer to let you in.|Wave Bouncer]] <<unset $temp>>\<p>This really wasn't a very complicated problem. There was a line. Lines are where you wait for things. What were you, some kind of line skipping monster? You would //never// deign to skip a line like some kind of rich entitled bastard. Those nice people had clearly been waiting for a while, and it would be simply rude to cut in front of them.</p> <p>It wasn't too easy to identify the end of the line- at first you thought it was the girl in the sequin miniskirt who was drunk enough that she wasn't getting in, but then the guy behind her with the mohawk and all the spikes was //not// happy with you. To be fair, you assumed he was just passing by until he shoved you and told you to fuck off.</p> <p>Now settled into your //proper// place in line, and admiring the beauty of the social systems that protect us from the horrors of anarchy, you waited patiently for your chance to enter.</p> * [[And waited.|Wave Waiting]]<p>And waited.</p> * [[And waited.|Wave Eternity]]<p>Oh my god this was starting to feel like an eternity. How long was a line to get into a club //supposed// to take? Actually, how long had it been? It felt like at least a half an hour, but you were really bad at judging time, so it was probably only like five minutes. The longest five minutes of your life!</p> <p>The wait was interrupted when you felt a rough yank on your upper arm. You lurched to the side, barely catching yourself as you were dragged away like a dog on a chain. The person doing the dragging was none other than Yvette, who was storming towards the door with you tripping over yourself in his wake. "You fucking idiot! I've been looking for you for like five minutes now! You don't have to wait in line!"</p> <p>"B-but what about all the folks waiting in front of me?" You were flabbergasted. Were the people you were here to hang out with... rich entitled bastards?</p> <p>Yvette waved to the bouncer and flashed him a big smile as he passed through the door, bringing you with him. Before you could take in any of the surroundings, you were shoved into a coat closet and the door was shut behind you. Yvette clutched your shoulders and hissed, "I pay these people's salaries. Indirectly. And you are my date. You do not need to //wait in line//."</p> * [[Well, however it happened, you were inside now. Very inside. Inside a closet.|Wave Inside]]<p>You strolled up to the bouncer, ready to make your pitch. No, not strolled... sidled. Debatably even sauntered. The guy seemed unimpressed with your casual-yet-cool approach, possibly because you were skipping a line of at least 50 people waiting to get into this exclusive establishment. He was easily 6'7", with slicked back hair and a scar on his upper lip. "End of the line's over there," he said, his voice gruff and deep.</p> <p>"I'm, uh..." Now that you were standing here under him, getting stared down at, you were a little less certain about your approach. "I'm with Yvette. Yvette Valdez, you know? I'm with him."</p> <p>He chuckled, the edges of his lips turning up just slightly. "Yeah, and I'm with the fucking tooth fairy. She's great in bed. Get in line, kid."</p> * [[“No, seriously, I'm supposed to be meeting him here!”|Wave Insist]] * [[“He's going to be really pissed when he finds out you aren't letting me in.”|Wave Pissed]] * [[“He should be here any minute. Let's just wait and see.”|Wave Minutes]]<p>Your insistence was met with yet more chuckling, although (luckily) he didn't seem to consider you enough of a threat to beat you up. "You could come up with a more believable lie, next time. Like saying you're here to meet the owner of XElectrics."</p> <p>That was awkward. "Girl named Yasmin, right?"</p> <p>"Yes."</p> <p>"You're never gonna believe this..."</p> <p>Fortunately, you were saved from embarrassment by <<include "Wave Straight">></p><p>"I'm sure he will be," he nodded, still chuckling a little. "Kid, you shouldn't even fantasize about getting messed up with folks like that. Better to stick with what you know."</p> <p>The tiniest bit of rage was boiling up under the surface, your hands balled into fists and your upper lip curled back. "I'm a fucking professional, man. I'm being paid to be here. Let me the fuck in." That was only kind of a lie. You were being compensated in drinks and company, if you recalled correctly. Depending on the company, though, that was worth more than money.</p> <p>"How about you get in line with everybody else before //I// start getting real pissed off?"</p> <p>You could tell that you were really getting to him- in fact, you might have been in a little bit of danger. You probably looked like a child throwing a tantrum next to this guy. Luckily, you were rescued from your fate by <<include "Wave Straight">></p><p>The guy shrugged. "Go ahead. Wait." Given that you weren't trying to make your way inside, you didn't pose much of a threat just standing there.</p> <p>Actually, you did pose //some// kind of threat just standing there. After a couple minutes it started getting really fucking awkward for both of you to be standing in silence, feet apart, waiting for somebody that only half of you believed was going to show up.</p> <p>"You know, I know they're big celebrities and all, but you really shouldn't be idolizing people like that," the bouncer finally said, breaking the silence. "You should hear the kind of shit that Valdez gets up to. Real fucked up motherfucker."</p> <p>"Like what?" You weren't sure if you were asking out of fear or excitement. Probably a mix of both.</p> <p>He had a grave look on his face. "They say he kills the boys he dates and drinks their blood to keep himself youthful," the bouncer informed you, his voice totally serious. "I mean, you don't get skin that soft through natural means. It's pretty fucked-"</p> <p>The guy was interrupted by <<include "Wave Straight">></p>a voice from behind and a strong hand on your shoulder. "Hank, are you harassing my new boo? How many times do I have to tell you, that's my job." Yvette had impeccable timing.<br> <p>The look on the bouncer's face could just barely be called sheepish as you were steered past him and through the double doors. "He's straight," Yvette muttered in your ear. Before you could figure out what exactly that meant in this context, or even take in your surroundings, you found yourself being shoved inside a coat closet and having the door slammed behind you.</p> * [[Well, however it happened, you were inside now. Very inside. Inside a closet.|Wave Inside]]<p>In the darkness you could feel your back pressed up against a whole host of people's coats and bags, although you could barely see any of it. When your eyes adjusted, though, you could see Yvette somewhat clearly- he was certainly dressed up for the occasion, a strappy red velvet dress that clung tight to his body and came down to just above his knees. The hem was lined with white fur, and he had a matching fur stole draped over his arms. Between that and his usual silver screen-ready makeup, he was really rocking the 'rich widow who has no clue who shot her husband, officer' look.</p> <<styletest>>\ <<if _result == "luxury">>\ <p>"I'm glad you came prepared. This is an important mission."</p> <<else>>\ <p>"What on earth are you wearing?! My god, you're lucky you're cute. This is an important mission, you know!"</p> <</if>>\ <p>"You're really giving me mixed signals here! Is today work or play?" You felt like you were being recruited into something suspect.</p> * [[And you probably were.|Wave Probably]] * [[But it was probably nothing to worry about.|Wave Probably]]<p>Yvette's hands gripped your shoulders tight enough that you could feel his rings digging into your skin. It wasn't an urgent gesture, though- it was the type of grip you'd have on a misbehaving puppy when you grab it by the scruff of the neck. This tonal shift was jarring. You'd only ever seen him elegantly sipping wine while implying he was a murderer, so this casual affect was catching you off guard a little. "It is work that is play. Or play that is work. I just need you to make her like you, okay? Can you manage that?"</p> <p>You could sense that Yvette was antsy to leave (fair, given that you were in a closet- didn't seem like his natural habitat). You were probably only going to get one question in before you had to get to 'work,' so you considered it carefully...</p> * [[Ask what Yasmin's interests are.|Wave Interests]] * [[Ask what Yasmin's turn-ons are.|Wave Turn]] * [[Ask what not to do.|Wave Not]]<p>"So... what kind of stuff does this girl like?" You had to connect with her somehow, you should probably figure out what to talk about.</p> <p>He grimaced, his painted eyebrows contorted in exasperation. "I don't know, vodka? What is that supposed to mean?!"</p> <p>"Like... interests. Hobbies. Things she likes."</p> <p>"How should I know?" He threw his hands up in the air, as if you were asking him what happened after death or how the old world ended or some other unknowable nonsense. "That's not my department. How about you figure it out yourself?"</p> <p>Yvette was clearly not as good friends with her as he represented before. Either that, or her preferred form of friendship didn't rely much on 'knowing' people. Either way, it was a little offputting. But he was pushing you out the door, so you were going into this blind whether you liked it or not.</p> * [[Better get ready.|Wave Ready]]<p>"So... if I'm trying to //get with her//, what should I do?" If you were supposed to get on her good side, the easiest way would be to... get on her good side. As it were.</p> <p>"What does that mean?"</p> <p>Your shoulders slumped. "Like, if I want her to like me. If I want to impress her. What does she like in a //partner//, y'know?"</p> <p>Yvette stopped and stared at the ground for a moment, his fingers twirling one of the pearls on his necklace around. "Money," he finally concluded. "Just... buy her stuff. You did bring money, right?"</p> <ul>\ <<if $wealth lte 1>>\ <li> [[“Funny you should ask...”|Wave Broke]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> [[“I'm actually kind of broke.” (LIE)|Wave Broke]]</li> <li> [[“Yeah, I've got some spending money.”|Wave Spending]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>"Oh my god. You have to be kidding me."</p> <p>You couldn't believe that this was unexpected. "I'm literally here because I need money, Yvette! You're supposed to be paying me! I don't have any money!"</p> <p>Yvette reached into the purse he was wearing, this little matching velvet thing that hung on a gold chain over his shoulder. His hand came out with a frankly ridiculous wad of cash, something you'd probably never be caught dead carrying. He grabbed your hand, shoved the cash into it, and closed your hand gingerly over it. "Here. An allowance. I will expect to get back whatever you don't spend on her!"</p> <p>You struggled to get all this cash tucked away where it wouldn't be instantly stolen, because Yvette was already pushing you out the door.</p> * [[Better get ready.|Wave Ready]] <<set $wealthfrozen = $wealth>>\ <<addwealth "large">>\ <<set $temp = true>>\<p>"Thank god." He looked relieved that you hadn't come unprepared, even though he hadn't exactly told you how to prepare. "Just... buy her drinks, buy her drugs, fetch her stuff, agree to whatever she says. Do what she wants. Don't deviate."</p> <p>Those instructions were easy enough, although you were a little concerned now about what she might want you to do. And you weren't crazy about the idea of spending money to make what might wind up being the same amount of money. No time to worry about that, though, because Yvette was already pushing you out the door.</p> * [[Better get ready.|Wave Ready]]<p>"I'm a little worried about not being... offputting. What would make her really //not// like me?"</p> <p>Yvette stopped and stared at the ground for a moment, his fingers twirling one of the pearls on his necklace around. "Well... she's going to demand things from you. Don't say no, even if it seems like you should. Just do whatever she tells you to, and you'll be fine."</p> <p>"What kind of 'demands' do you mean?" That was ominous.</p> <p>"She's going to ask you to buy her stuff, fetch her stuff, do stuff for her... I don't know what exactly, it's just her thing. It's a test. If you pass, she'll like you. If you say no, she won't."</p> <ul>\ <<if $wealth lte 1>>\ <li> [[“I, uh... I don't know if I can afford to buy her stuff.”|Wave Broke]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> [[“Then could I borrow some cash? I'm kind of broke...” (LIE)|Wave Broke]]</li> <li> [[“I've got some spending money, so that should be fine.”|Wave Spending]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>Thrust out into the swing of things, you were immediately overwhelmed by a flurry of sounds and lights and movement. Neon lamps scanned the crowd like searchlights, flashing bright in your eyes when they met sequins and vinyl on the partiers. They were a homogeneous mass. Yvette gripped your wrist hard and pulled you through, being jostled on all sides. Like being squeezed through a beating heart. The music was all-encompassing, bright and distorted and keeping the crowd moving violently. Yvette, for what it was worth, seemed unphased. As he moved people spread out to accommodate him, some reacting with surprise to his presence, others greeting him with hollers and friendly pats on the shoulder as he passed.</p> <p>"Just a little further, hon," he assured you, his voice barely audible over the thump of the music. "I'm sure you aren't too used to things like this, being all poor and Northern and such. Really, it's the only way to live, you're going to love it eventually!"</p> * [[This was INCREDIBLE.|Wave Party]] * [[This was far too much for you.|Wave Horror]]<p>This kind of party was perfect for a person like you. You really needed to focus on the mission, focus on the task at hand! But it was hard not to get lost in it, your body urging you to move along with everybody else. Get high on something (you made a mental note to ask Yvette where you could get molly here) and just fucking lose yourself in the crowd. Whatever this music was, this incomprehensible mass of overproduced synths and compression laid over a deep, rhythmic bass, it was resonating in your bones and you wanted it to stay.</p> <<if $identity.includes("hedonist")>>\ * [[This was incredible.|Wave Curtain]] <<else>>\ <<include "hedonist">>\ <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "hedonist" "Hedonist">><<goto "Wave Curtain">><</link>> / [[NO|Wave Curtain]] """---"""</h1>\ <</if>>\<p>Was this the sort of horrible arcane ritual the rich fuckers in this city got up to in their free time? This mass of undulating flesh, everyone scantily clad in these strange outfits made of plastic and metal and fabrics that felt like plastic and metal. The music was resonating in your bones like some kind of cosmic horror, its strange, glitchy sounds filling your ears like that static. You were in hell. But your lifeline, Yvette's iron grip on your wrist, was pulling you free.</p> <<include "Wave Curtain">><p>Yvette was drawing you towards the back left corner of the room, behind the bar, behind the DJ, where a curtain of glittering multicoloured beads shielded some kind of back room from the rest of the club. Another bouncer was stationed there, keeping drunks from the thinner area of the crowd from wandering into this exclusive area. Yvette pulled you from the thick of the crowd and pushed the beads aside without so much as a thought. He ignored the bouncer entirely.</p> <p>And just like that, you disappeared from the undulating mass of bodies and emerged into a new world entirely.</p> * [[The VIP area.|Wave VIP]]<p>Beyond the curtain everything was far more lavish. The black-painted concrete walls were draped in some kind of iridescent fabric, and a disco ball was hanging above. The light in here bounced off in every direction and made the whole room look like it was drenched in glitter.</p> <p>The patrons back here actually were drenched in glitter. There were fewer, and dancing far less ecstatically in the more intimate space. The women gleamed, covered in sequins and body glitter, like their bodies were encrusted with diamonds. Some of the men were near the same, though with satin shirts and jewelry. Not that all of the folks back here could be neatly categorized as one or the other.</p> <p>These richest of the rich were milling about, chatting over the slightly dulled music, lounging in couches, and rubbing against each other beneath the lights. A few were holding fancy cocktails, prepared by their own personal bartender- you weren't going to find any cheep beer back here.</p> <p>As the two of you entered, a few folks hollered at Yvette and a few more waved. It seemed like you'd hooked up with the right person if you wanted to get in with high society, although you didn't manage to make eye contact with a single one of them.</p> * [[Whatever. You just need to work your way up.|Wave Ask]] * [[Stuck up rich bastards.|Wave Ask]]<p>At the very least, Yvette was focused on the task at hand. "Have any of you lovelies seen Yasmin tonight?" His voice was even more melodic than usual, like a jingle on the radio. He really stepped it up for these people. Or maybe it was natural.</p> <p>A few of the revellers who weren't totally distracted by their dancing pointed to the back, with one voice declaring over the music, "She's in the parlour, hon." That was all Yvette needed.</p> <p>"Come, darling. I hope you don't have any breathing issues."</p> * [[You do, but it's probably fine.|Wave Parlour]] * [[You breathe plenty clear.|Wave Parlour]] * [[That was kind of ominous.|Wave Parlour]]<p>It was no matter, because you were already being led (luckily not by your wrist anymore, but by decorum) back even further into the building. Rich people here must love their layers. This wasn't a curtain, though- Yvette turned the knob on a sturdy looking door and pulled it open, gesturing for you to enter. Already, smoke was wafting out like cold air escaping an icebox.</p> <p>As you stepped inside, you could see through the haze the most lavishly decorated room you'd ever laid eyes on. It was like every inch was covered in luscious fabrics, rugs lining the floors and pillows spilling off couches draped in furs and quilts. The walls were lined with dark curtains, leaving the music from the dance floor a muffled and distant sound as soon as Yvette shut the door behind him.</p> <p>And the only person in this room, reclining back on the couch and holding a long, slender pipe encrusted with gems, was one of the most sickly beautiful people you'd laid eyes on.</p> * [[This must be Yasmin.|Wave Yasmin]]<p>Her slender form was laid out over the couch like a Renaissance painting, draped in a sheer sheet that pooled on the ground before her and left most of her soft, tan skin uncovered. Beneath it, a delicate dress made of soft baby pink velvet clung to her bony frame. You could almost imagine how it would feel to run your hands over her hip. One of her legs was partially off the side, with a single pink feathered kitten heel dangling off her toes.</p> <p>But as ethereal as she looked lying there, her face was the really striking thing. Wreathed in pale blonde hair that was pin straight, it was less gaunt than you'd expect, but still sickly in an oddly alluring way. Like an old timey person would swoon at a woman with TB, the flush of her cheeks and the pout on her glossy pink lips was enough to drive somebody insane. Her eyes were big and downturned, brown eyes like a puppy with these long lashes and dark, chalky makeup ringing them. <<if $identity.includes("devotee")>>She looked strikingly like that portrait in your uncle's home, the beautiful face of Death smiling down on you.<<else>>She looked like a depressed fashion model in an avant garde photoshoot, but she was right in front of you, in the flesh.<</if>></p> <p>A trail of smoke wafted from between her lips as she parted them to speak. "Yvette, babe, I thought you were busy with, like, business deals or something tonight. It's //so// good to see you." Her voice was soft and high, raising in pitch right at the end like a rich girl in an old tape. She placed her pipe down in a similarly filigreed tray on a little table next to her, beside a small lit oil lamp. Her eyes drifted to look at you, but never meeting your gaze- taking in your appearance. "Is this your new plaything?"</p> <p>Yvette didn't respond as the girl reached a dainty hand out towards you. Her nails were painted pink, and a single gleaming gold ring adorned her middle finger. She was waiting for you to come towards her.</p> * [[Eager, you step toward her and take her hand. Like accepting a gift.|Wave Hand]] * [[A little uneasy, you approach and take her hand.|Wave Hand]]<<styletest>>\ <p>Yasmin's fingertips softly grazed your skin, exhilarating like a static shock. Her hand was cold. With a gentle grip she tugged you closer, her other hand sliding up your forearm as she pulled you down to her level.</p> <p>Her lashes fluttered as she met your eyes. "Has Yvette been mean to you, baby?" The tone of her voice was syrupy, a sort of sarcasm to the way she overperformed every syllable. "Don't you worry, you're safe now."</p> <p>She let you go, and you shook out the phantom cold of her skin against yours. The girl leaned back in her bed of pillows and let out a melodic giggle. She had amused herself, although you weren't sure what was so funny. Your head spun and your skin tingled.</p> <p>Turning her attention back to her friend, Yasmin said, "<<if _result == "handmade">>You've got such interesting taste, hon. These freaks weren't worth hanging out with anyway.</p> * [[You squeeze your way through the crowd and out into the cold night streets of The Heights.|Wave Finish]]<p>The girl giggled, letting her arms fail in holding her up and falling back into the pile of pillows she was laid upon. So figured you should go do that right away.<<else>>You weren't sure what exactly she meant by that, but you hoped it was nothing bad. I don't know." She let her attempts at staying upright fail and rolled back into the pile of pillows she was laid upon. Crossing her arms in front of her chest and staring up at the ceiling as if in thought, she hummed for a moment before coming to a conclusion. "I want liquor. I'm not picky."</p> <p>Call it instinct or call it reading into things, but you were reasonably certain that this was utter horseshit. She absolutely was picky, and she absolutely was going to judge you harshly based on what you got her. Fuck.</p> * [[Better go pick something out, then.|Wave Bar]]<p>You circled around the throng of VIPs in here, taking a roundabout route to the bar but one that would guarantee the least chance of bumping into somebody. Without Yvette here, you felt like you could get kicked out at any moment. This was a place where you certainly did not belong.</p> <p>The bar here was smaller than the one in the main club, but arguably even better stocked. It was all laid out on shelves behind the bartender, row after row of expensive liquors and mixers. You couldn't even pronounce half of this shit. As a person who once drank moonshine directly out of a still, you were deeply unprepared for this.</p> <p>You were so distracted by the array of options before you that you barely even realized the bartender was talking to you. He repeated himself again- "<<if $player.gender == "man">>Sir?<<elseif $player.gender == "woman">>Ma'am?<<else>>Pardon me?<</if>> What can I get for you?"</p> <ul>\ <<if $wealth lt 1>>\ <li> [[Wait... how the fuck were you supposed to pay for this?|Wave Funds]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> [[You scan the shelf, trying to make a quick decision.|Wave Consider]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>Yeah... before you could even consider which of these expensive drinks to get her, you had to pay attention to that hole in your pocket. What money were you planning on using, exactly? The last little scraps you had? As important as this was, eating was even more important.</p> <p>You glanced around, trying to come up with a game plan. You weren't planning on coming back here (and probably couldn't even get in), so you could always try to open a tab and then skedaddle before they notice you didn't pay. Or you could try to schmooze one of the folks here into paying for you.</p> <p>Confident at least that you could figure it out, you started scanning the shelves.</p> * [[You look for a good, expensive beverage.|Wave Consider]]<p>Immediately, you picked out three of the fanciest things you could spot and tried to narrow it down to just one.</p> <p>First, a bottle of vodka. It looked pretty fancy, but in comparison to everything else... well, it was vodka. Not exactly the most expensive liquor around, at least not in this area where it was pretty cheap to distill. This was certainly a party girl you were dealing with, so the more drunk she got the happier she'd be, presumably.</p> <p>Second, a bottle of red wine. Aged, cork still in, luxury stuff. Rich people //love// wine, so if you got her that she'd probably be pretty impressed. Especially if you could ad lib some stupid crap about it having "notes of strawberry" or whatever. Might be a little pricey, though.</p> <p>And finally, right up on the top shelf, a bottle that was almost glowing green. Absinthe. It was rare to even see it in person, but there it was- the green fairy, ready to be purchased by you. You didn't even have to ask to know how expensive it would be. You would really have to fork over some dough for it. But maybe that was worth it? Show the rich girl you can take care of her and her expensive tastes.</p> <p>Three good options. What would it be?</p> * [[“Can I get a couple shots of vodka?”|Wave Order][$temp2 = "vodka"]] * [[“Can I get a glass of red wine?”|Wave Order][$temp2 = "wine"]] * [[“Can I get a glass of absinthe?”|Wave Order][$temp2 = "absinthe"]]<p>"Right away." The bartender turned to grab the bottle from behind him, tossing it from one hand to the other and back. "I believe you're new around here, correct? Could I get your name for the tab?"</p> <p>Ah, yes. You would have to deal with this now.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[Just give the man your name.|Wave Name][$temp3 = true]]</li> <li> [[Give him a fake name, just in case.|Wave Name][$temp3 = false]]</li> <li> <<link "Get him to put it on Yvette's tab. <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-four'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-four'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-heart'></i>">><<glamroll 8 "Wave Bar Glam Success" "Wave Bar Glam Failure">><</link>></li> </ul>\<<if $temp3 == false>>\ <<if not $player.name == ["Nikki", "Nicky", "Nicki", "Nikky", "Niki", "Nickie"]>>\ <p>"Name's Nikki."</p> <<set $tempname = "Nikki">>\ <<else>>\ <p>"Name's Steele."</p> <<set $tempname = "Steele">>\ <</if>>\ <<elseif $temp3 == true>>\ <p>"Name's <<print $player.name>>."</p> <<set $tempname = $player.name>>\ <</if>>\ <p>"Nice to meet you, <<print $tempname>>." <<include "Wave Pour">></p><p>"Of course, you're Yvette's latest conquest," the man chuckled. "Be careful- that bloody rose thing isn't just for show."</p> <<include "Wave Pour">> <<set $temp4 = true>>\<p>He shook his head, an infuriated look on his face that must have its roots in many half-remembered arguments. "I've said this several times already, he can pay for his conquests all he likes but I still need to mark down who's ordering."</p> <p>"Oh. Uh, sorry." Well, that didn't go exactly as planned. "Name's <<print $player.name>>."</p> <p>"Nice to meet you, <<print $player.name>>." <<include "Wave Pour">></p><p>He grabbed a<<if $temp2 == "vodka">> couple shot glasses<<elseif $temp2 == "wine">> fancy wine glass<<elseif $temp2 == "absinthe">>n oddly shaped little stemmed glass<</if>> from under the bar and placed it down. As he spoke, he began pouring out the drink you'd ordered. "<<if $temp2 == "vodka">>This is stronger than the crap you'd get at a bar in the Stacks or the Red Light." He poured a tiny amount of the clear liquid into each glass, ready to be carried back to the lounge on a metal tray.<<elseif $temp2 == "wine">>Good choice- this is a nice vintage, very full-bodied." It was a deep, dark red like deoxygenated blood, splashing up the side of the glass as he poured it out.<<elseif $temp2 == "absinthe">>I assume you'll be bringing this back to the lounge- just wait for the ice to melt, and voila." He poured out only a shot of the lime green liquor, then placed a smaller, perforated glass with a few chunks of ice and a sugar cube up top.<</if>></p> <p>"Thank you, sir. Appreciated." Delighted to not have to pay up just yet, you grabbed <<if $temp2 == "vodka">>the tray<<else>>the glass<</if>> and set off back towards the lounge.</p> * [[This is perfect. You're doing your job perfectly.|Wave Deliver]]<p>Balancing as best as you could to avoid spilling any of the expensive alcohol and taking a strategic route around the jostling dacers on the floor, you made your way back over to the lounge. Through the door, you could very faintly hear chatter inside. It seemed like you were about to interrupt their conversation.</p> * [[You interrupt their conversation.|Wave Interrupt]] * [[Or maybe you can just... wait... with your ear conveniently placed on the door.|Wave Eavesdrop]]<p>Pushing the side of your head up against the wooden door, you tried to block out the loud techno music behind you and focus on the conversation inside. You couldn't hear it very clearly, but you could make out Yvette's muffled tones- "Technically, I think you could fire them! You are in charge, aren't you, hon?"</p> <p>Yasmin's voice responded, her somewhat slurred speech making it a even harder to piece together what she was saying. Something about "handlers," and then, "It was in the will! Oh, and daddy was right about it too- god, I'd make an awful leader, wouldn't I?"</p> <p>"I think you'd make a fine leader." Even through a door, you could tell that Yvette was lying. "You have that special something. Very good with people."</p> <p>"You think so?"</p> <p>"Of course." There was a short pause and some shuffling, followed by a concerning statement- "What's taking <<print $pro.them>> so long? One moment, I'm going to go get <<print $pro.them>>."</p> * [[Ah, crap. Better act natural.|Wave Natural]]<p>You stepped away from the door as quickly as possible to avoid being caught by it, a few of alcohol splashing out as you moved. Just in time, too. It slammed open, and Yvette was standing right there, staring you down. "Oh... there you are! I was worried you got lost or something." He flashed you a cold smile. Did he know you were listening to his conversation? "You know, I just saw Darling over there, she's been wanting to catch up for weeks... how about I leave you two to get acquainted?"</p> <p>From inside, you could hear Yasmin let out a long, uncaring yawn. "Doesn't matter to me," she muttered. Whatever she was smoking, it was a depressant for sure.</p> * [[Yvette winks at you as you pass.|Wave Alone]]<p>You turned the handle as carefully as possible and pushed the door open, stepping back into the little haven with drink in hand. Yvette was leaning back against the wall to your left, mid sentence. "You are in charge-" He stopped and turned to look at you, his blonde curls bouncing by his chin as his head moved. "Oh, there you are. My god, how long does it take you to get a drink?"</p> <p>"Sorry, there was a line." That was untrue, but better than being berated in front of the woman you were meant to impress.</p> <p>He pushed himself off the wall, craning his neck to look over your shoulder and winking in the process. "I think I see Darling over there, she's been wanting to catch up for weeks... how about I leave you two to get acquainted?"</p> <p>Yasmin yawned, leaning even further back into her throne of pillows. "Doesn't matter to me," she muttered. Whatever she was smoking, it was a depressant for sure.</p> * [[Yvette stepped out, leaving you with Yasmin.|Wave Alone]]<p>Alone with Yasmin at last. You still weren't entirely clear why Yvette was so intent on you making a good impression- <<if $attraction.includes("yasmin")>>not that you didn't intend to anyway. A girl like that, you //had// to try to get her to like you.<<else>>it was a little suspicious to say the least, but a job is a job.<</if>> And you were going to do it.</p> <p>Here's hoping that you chose a drink she'd like.</p> <p>"Don't be shy," Yasmin tittered from the other side of the room. "What'd you get me?"</p> <ul>\ <<if $temp2 == "vodka">>\ <li> [[“Vodka.”|Wave Vodka]]</li> <<elseif $temp2 == "absinthe">>\ <li> [[“Absinthe.”|Wave Absinthe]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> [[“Wine.”|Wave Wine]]</li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>You held out the glass and the woman, splayed out before you like a suburban goddess, pouted. Her lips were glossy pink, <<if $attraction.includes("yasmin")>>and you could only imagine how that gloss would taste.<<else>>gleaming in the lamplight.<</if>> "Oh, you'd be better off giving that to Yvette... he's crazy about the stuff. I don't like it." As if her words meant nothing, though, she still plucked it out of your hand by the stem.</p> <p>Holding it up to her face, Yasmin twirled the glass around, watching the dark liquid inside swirl with the subtle movements of her hand. She stared at it, fixated, her sad brown eyes hypnotized by the ripples. "My daddy used to love this stuff," she muttered, her voice low and saccharine. "When we had family dinners, he used to have these big bottles of vintage red wine, and he'd pour out a big glass of the stuff and it'd be this awful sickly brown colour. The way it looked, you'd swear they squeezed it out of an old rag. Do you know how they make wine?"</p> * [[“Yeah, it's fermented.”|Wave Fermented]] * [[“No... isn't it kind of rare nowadays?”| Wave Fermented]] <<set $relationship.yasmin to $relationship.yasmin.fm(-5)>>\<p>Her eyes flicked up to look at you through her long lashes. "They crush up grapes that they grow out West, and they put them in big wooden barrels to rot. And when it's aged enough, they put it in a bottle and cork it up and put it on a shelf." Glancing back down at her glass, she muttered, "They say it's worth more the longer you don't use it. Can you believe that? It's just meant to sit up there on the shelf looking fancy. And if you open the bottle too soon, you're going to spoil it..."</p> <p>"Do you not want it?" This probably meant she didn't want it.</p> <p>Instead, Yasmin held the glass up to her lips and took the tiniest sip. She sat there for a moment, taking it in, before sticking out her tongue. "It sucks. Thanks."</p> * [[“Uh... you're welcome.”|Wave Darling]] * [[“Sorry...”|Wave Darling]]<p>You held the tray out for her, low enough that she could see what was on it- her eyes lit up at the sight. "Ooh, shots! Bitch, you just met me, how do you already know me?" She giggled, an excited little smile crossing her cherry pink lips. "I'm a total slut for vodka. I know it's cheap and unbefitting of a //lady//, but that's what makes it fun..."</p> <p>Propping herself up with one arm and reaching out her dainty fingers, she grabbed a glass from the tray. With the speed at which she had it upside down and had downed the contents, it was a wonder it hadn't all splashed in her face. Evidently, she had no problem with the taste. "Go on, put the rest down... I should really pace myself."</p> * [[You set the tray down on an ornate side table.|Wave Liquor]]<p>"I'm a big fan of hard liquor," she muttered, batting her lashes at you. "I like how quick it is... skip the sipping on a cocktail for a half hour, get straight to the fun." That was probably supposed to be a euphemism... but maybe acknowledging it would be too forward.</p> * [[“So what, do you want to skip the boring part and get straight to the fun?”|Wave Skip]] * [[“Glad you like it. I'm a big fan of vodka too. Very no-nonsense.”|Wave Darling]]<p>Yasmin rolled over on her back, draping an arm dramatically over her forehead as if she'd been slain in battle. "Oh heavens, what do you take me for? Some kind of slut?" She did literally just call herself a slut, so that was a little hypocritical. If it had been serious. "I've only just met you! You at least need to buy me dinner first..."</p> <p>"You're coming on real strong for somebody who was introduced as your friend's date..." True, but a playful enough tone to not interrupt the mood.</p> <p>She rolled her eyes. "Oh, Yvette doesn't have real partners! He has toys. I don't mind his leftovers, as long as they're as cute as you."</p> * [[“I'm flattered.”|Wave Darling]]<p>Yasmin's eyes widened, bewitched by the green fairy. "Ooh... look at it! It's so pretty!" She braced herself against the couch and stretched her hand out as far as she could, wiggling her delicate fingers. "Lemme see!"</p> <p>That was a good sign. You obliged her, steppimg forward and carefully placing the glass in her hand. It was a small miracle that she didn't drop it. Holding it up close to her face, she stared through the green liquid, enraptured by it.</p> <p>"Don't get ahead of yourself, you'd gotta wait till it's watered down first." It looked like candy, but the taste of pure, unadaulterated absinthe wasn't exactly pleasant. Although a girl like this could maybe handle it anyway.</p> <p>Pouting, she placed the glass down on the side table and crossed her arms over the arm of the couch to stare at it. A drop of water fell into the glass below, spreading a sugary cloud of white through it. "I'm impatient. I wish they'd just toss a sugar cube and some water in there and be done with it."</p> * [[“Wouldn't be as fancy then.”|Wave Fancy]] * [[“I think the ritual adds something to it.”|Wave Ritual]] <<set $relationship.yasmin to $relationship.yasmin.fm(10)>>\<p>"Would taste the same." She stared at the glass with a forlorn look on her face, before seemingly snapping out of it. In an instant she was back to giving off that party girl energy. A party girl on massive downers, mind you, but a party girl's a party girl.</p> * [[Better than pouting and sighing, at least.|Wave Darling]]<p>"What's a ritual good for?" She stared at the glass with a forlorn look on her face. "Only rituals I've ever done have been funerals."</p> <p>You pointed to her pipe, sitting pretty in its tray next to her absinthe. "Wouldn't you say that's a ritual? There's a set of steps you follow, and special items you need to use."</p> <p>Yasmin rolled her eyes. "All that's going right over my head, babe. You don't have to be an intellectual... you're at the club, remember?"</p> * [[Ouch.|Wave Darling]]<p>"I don't think I caught your name, baby." She fluttered her lashes. "I'm Yasmin. Although I'm sure you knew that already..."</p> <p>"<<print $player.name>>. Nice to meet you."</p> <p>Swinging her legs over to make room on her lavishly adorned couch, Yasmin patted the space next to her. "C'mon, sit! Since Yvette's just up and abandoned you here, how about we get to know each other a little, hm?"</p> <p>"I'm sure he'll be back soon." You didn't quite believe yourself, so you accepted her offer, settling down and sinking into the mass of pillows and blankets. It was almost uncomfortable, like some kind of comfort level overflow error.</p> <p>"Oh god, no chance." The idea was absurd enough to earn a little giggle. "If he's off with Darling, those two are going to be talking the whole night. About business, I'm sure, the boring bitches. And I guess that means he's made me your babysitter."</p> <p>"Or maybe he's made me //your// babysitter?"</p> <p>"You're the one who's in over <<print $pro.their>> head here!" She leaned in towards you, her shoulder bumping against yours. "You're not from Signal Hill after all... actually, where //are// you from?"</p> <p>Had Yvette mentioned you being from out of town? Surely he had. Or maybe it was just that obvious. It seemed like everybody could tell you were from out of town.</p> * [[“I'm from up North.”|Wave North]] * [[“I'm from down South.” (Lie)|Wave South]] * [[“I'd rather keep that private. I've got a bit of a dark history.”|Wave Private]]<p>"Oh wow. How far North? Like, Sumner?" Sumner was definitely not in the North. Sumner was what you Northern folk would call South. Geography wasn't this girl's strong suit- but then again, accurate maps were hard enough to come by if you actually needed them.</p> <p>"No, further than that. Like, North."</p> <p>She gasped and put her hands to her mouth. "Wow, that's far! Is it, like... cold up there?"</p> <p>"In the Winter, sure." You'd had your fair share of harsh ones, too. You remembered growing up, being stuck in the ice cellar of your grandmother's home, watching the icicles form from a hole in the floorboards above. When the cold rolled in, you could be caught up in it for weeks.</p> <p>"Wow." This seemed shocking to her. She'd probably never seen a snowflake. "What did you do up there? Not in general, I mean, like, before you left. Like, what did you //do//?"</p> <ul>\ <li> [[“I was a mercenary.”|Wave Merc]]</li> <li> [[“I was a medic.”|Wave Medic]]</li> <li> [[“I was a caravaneer.”|Wave Nomad]]</li> <li> [[“I worked with machines.”|Wave Machinist]]</li> <<if $identity.includes("devotee") and $player.gender == "androgyne">>\ <li> [[“I was a... mystic. Like a priest.”|Wave Augur]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[“Nothing interesting, honestly.”|Wave Boring]]</li> </ul>\<p>"Oh, that's fun," she purred, leaning in close enough for you to feel her warm breath on your cheek. "You know, the love of my life was a mercenary. We don't talk anymore... but I love mercs. Like an old cowboy movie. Lonesome gun for hire, fending for themselves out in the wastes... there's something so romantic about it."</p> <p>Chuckling, you said, "It's not nearly as poetic as you make it sound. Really just... getting paid to look scary, most of the time."</p> <p>"Well, I'm not scared of you."</p> <<if $identity.includes("merc")>>\ * [[Probably for the best.|Wave Inquire]] <<else>>\ <p>All well and good, but were you actually a mercenary? Or were you just lying to make yourself sound cool? Don't worry, your secret's safe with me.</p> <<include "merc">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "merc" "Merc">><<goto "Wave Inquire">><</link>> / [[NO|Wave Inquire]] """---"""</h1> <</if>>\ <<set $relationship.yasmin to $relationship.yasmin.fm(5)>>\<p>"Oh." She seemed a little disappointed by that. "So like... a doctor?"</p> <p>"Not exactly... I mean, I worked //with// doctors, sometimes. And we did a lot of the same stuff. But I mostly worked in the field, y'know, accompanying caravans or scavenging missions..."</p> <p>"So like a doctor?"</p> <p>You nodded, defeated. "Yeah... like a doctor."</p> <<if $identity.includes("medic")>>\ * [[Clearly, you aren't impressing her.|Wave Inquire]] <<else>>\ <p>If that was a lie, it would be a failed one. That stung. Not that you hadn't heard it before. Running with a caravan was one of those jobs that'd surely be idealized and looked back on fondly in fifty years (or whenever the fuck you're out of a job), but for now you were pretty low on the.food chain. Like cowboys. You were a cowboy at the worst time to be a cowboy.</p> <p>"I mean, no... we carried guns and stuff. Warded off the dangers of the wastes to deliver necessary supplies across vast distances. I've been to more towns than I could count..."</p> <p>"So like a mailman." To be fair, that also described mailmen.</p> <p>"I guess so."</p> <<if $identity.includes("nomad")>>\ * [[Clearly, you aren't impressing her.|Wave Inquire]] <<else>>\ <p>If that was a lie, it would be a failed one. "What kind of machines?"</p> <p>"Oh, you know. I'm a bit of a jack of all trades. That's... kind of boring."</p> <<if $identity.includes("machinist")>>\ * [[Maybe you aren't selling the cool factor very well.|Wave Inquire]] <<else>>\ <p>Maybe you weren't selling the cool factor very well. But it was just the truth. That was just what you did. Right?</p> <<include "machinist">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "machinist" "Machinist">><<goto "Wave Inquire">><</link>> / [[NO|Wave Inquire]] """---"""</h1> <</if>>\<p>Her eyes lit up, like this was something she could never have predicted. "Oh? A //mystic//? From the North? Wow!"</p> <p>"The proper word is //augur//." Having become a traveller like this, you were used to explaining yourself to strangers.</p> <p>"What does that mean?" She leaned in close, not in a romantic way, but like an excited student. "Do you, like, read fortunes? Cast spells?"</p> <p>"My role is to channel divine beings... for healing, wisdom, rituals. I guess fortune telling is... close."</p> <p>Yasmin leaned in even closer. "That's so //exotic//. We don't have anything like that here."</p> <<if $identity.includes("augur")>>\ * [[It seems she's interested in your religion. That's nice of her.|Wave Inquire]] <<else>>\ <p>It seemed like this was a good way of holding her attention. But were you, y'know... officially an augur? Anybody from Signal Hill wouldn't be able to fact check you, but did you actually go through all the gruelling initiation rituals to attain such a rank?</p> <<include "augur">> <p>Would you like to accept this identity?</p> <h1>"""---""" <<link "YES">><<addidentity "augur" "Augur">><<goto "Wave Inquire">><</link>> / [[NO|Wave Inquire]] """---"""</h1> <</if>>\ <<set $relationship.yasmin to $relationship.yasmin.fm(5)>>\<p>"Oh." She seemed... a little disappointed. Maybe she was expecting some kind of grand tale of your adventures, or a dark backstory. Unfortunately, you didn't have either of those.</p> <p>"Yeah. I mostly did manual labour and the like. Decided to pack up and move South to start a new life."</p> <p>Yasmin nodded, although at this point she was examining her nails as if their plain pink enamel was far more interesting. "Nice. Well, it's not too late to start doing something interesting. This is, like, the best place to do it."</p> <p>"It sure seems like it."</p> <p>You were... quickly losing her. Maybe you were just a boring person...</p> * [[Oof.|Wave Inquire]] <<set $relationship.yasmin to $relationship.yasmin.fm(-5)>>\<p>"Oh my god, me too! I haven't been back South since daddy moved us up here when I was... what, 13? It was so long ago..."</p> <p>Damn. You were just lying because you do that compulsively for no good reason, but it was actually a great decision. You were bonding now! This was bonding!</p> <p>Then she asked a question you didn't really expect. "Whereabouts exactly?"</p> <p>Well fuck. In truth, Signal Hill was about the furthest South you'd been. East and West, maybe, but where you were from this //was// the South.</p> <ul>\ <li> <<link "Just try your best to make up something convincing. <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-five'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-five'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-brain'></i>">><<savvyroll 10 "Wave Lie Success" "Wave Lie Failure">><</link>></li> <li> [[“Oh, y'know. Around.”|Wave Lie]]</li> </ul>\<p>One of the guys in your caravan had mentioned he was from a place called Oxford- a pretty big settlement, if you remembered correctly. Best not to claim that one, just in case she'd been there. Instead, you'd just use it as inspiration.</p> <p>"Little town just North of Oxford," you muttered as confidently as you could muster. "You probably wouldn't know it. Nobody ever does!"</p> <p>"Oh, oh, I'm from Oxford!" She was beaming. "D'you mean Camphor? My daddy owned one of the sugarcane farms there..."</p> <p>Perfect. This was perfect. Just take what she says, and run with it. "Oh, really? My mother worked the sugarcane farms when I was a kid."</p> <p>Yasmin shook her head, a smile crossing her face and her eyes glazed over. "Weren't those the good ol' days? Maybe I just think that cause I was twelve... but those were the good ol' days."</p> * [[If she says so.|Wave Inquire]] <<set $relationship.yasmin to $relationship.yasmin.fm(5)>>\<p>One of the guys in your caravan had mentioned he was from a place called Oxford- a pretty big settlement, if you remembered correctly. There were probably a whole lot of people living in a big place like that- just say you live there.</p> <p>"I used to live down in Oxford." You said it with the kind of confidence needed to really sell the lie.</p> <p>"Oh, oh, I'm from Oxford!" She was beaming. "Whereabouts in Oxford?"</p> <p>Oh, fuck. That was what you didn't want to hear. Curse your luck. "I'd rather not say... you know. I'm on the run."</p> <<include "Wave Private">><p>"Around where?" She frowned, furrowing her brow at you. "C'mon, what's the big secret about? Do you not like me?"</p> <p>Ah, shit. Rewind. Rewind. Try to walk this back. "I'm... well, it's best if people back home don't find out where I am. You could say I'm on the run." Yes. An outlaw. Sexy. Mysterious.</p> <p>"Boo." Sticking her tongue out like a child, Yasmin turned back away from you. "I don't believe you at all. You're not an outlaw, you just don't wanna tell me."</p> <p>"That's not-"</p> <p>"It's fine. Privacy and all that." She was in a huff, for sure. You had really messed up on this one. "Anyway..."</p> * [[She trails off in the middle of changing the subject.|Wave Inquire]] <<set $relationship.yasmin to $relationship.yasmin.fm(-10)>>\<p>"Ooh... mysterious!" She nudged you with her elbow, a little smile across her lips. "I'm gonna find out sooner or later, babe. I find out //everything// around here. I'm very in the know."<<if $signal gte 1>> This was patently untrue. She certainly believed it ws true, but Yasmin was a petty gossip, not all knowing. She knew who was dating who. She did not know why. Your secrets were safe- from Yasmin, at least.<</if>></p> <p>You shook your head, your eyes cast down to your feet. "You don't want to know. There's a reason I left."</p> <p>"I bet you killed somebody in cold blood," Yasmin muttered, leaning in real close to your face. You could feel her breath, warm against your cheek. "On the run from the lawmen? Or maybe on the run from your guilt? Oh, oh, or maybe you killed the person your lover was cheating with, and now there's nothing left for you there... am I close?"</p> <p>"No."</p> <p>She winked. I'm just some nobody." You flashed her a smirk and stretched your legs out. Trying to make yourself comfortable and increasingly failing. "You're in charge of the electric company, right? Keeping the lights on in places like this?"</p> <p>Yasmin scoffed, holding up a delicately folded hand in front of her face as if her pink laquered nails were the most interesting thing in the room.
