<h1>"""---""" [[DON'T CHARGE|Charge Bar Sit]] """---"""</h1>\ <<elseif $pocket.count("Empty Batteries") gt 5>>\ <h1>Would you like to charge all of your batteries (3 <i class='fa-solid fa-coins'></i>), only five of them (2 <i class='fa-solid fa-coins'></i>), or only two of them (1 <i class='fa-solid fa-coins'></i>)?</h1> <<if $wealth gte 3>>\ <h1>"""---""" <<link "CHARGE ALL">><<spendwealth 3>><<set _batteries = $pocket.count("Empty Battery")>><<drop $pocket "Empty Battery" _batteries>><<pickup $pocket "Charged Battery" _batteries>><<goto "Charge Bar Sit">><</link>> """---"""</h1>\ <</if>>\ <<if $wealth gte 2>>\ <h1>"""---""" <<link "CHARGE FIVE">><<spendwealth 2>><<drop $pocket "Empty Battery" 5>><<pickup $pocket "Charged Battery" 5>><<goto "Charge Bar Sit">><</link>> """---"""</h1>\ <</if>>\ <<if $wealth gte 1>>\ <h1>"""---""" <<link "CHARGE TWO">><<spendwealth 1>><<drop $pocket "Empty Battery" 2>><<pickup $pocket "Charged Battery" 2>><<goto "Charge Bar Sit">><</link>> """---"""</h1>\ <</if>>\ <h1>"""---""" [[DON'T CHARGE|Charge Bar Sit]] """---"""</h1>\ <</if>>\<h1><<link "The Graveyard">><<popup "Graveyard Transition Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Graveyard Transition Description">><</if>> <ul>\ <<if Flag("ArjunPermission")>>\ <li> [[Go into the Lamplighter HQ.|Lamplighter HQ Hub]]</li> <<else>>\ <li> [[Approach the guy at the gate.|Arjun Introduction]]</li> <</if>> </ul>\<p>As soon as you stepped out of the city, you got this overwhelming feeling of being deeply, incalculably small. Maybe it was the sheer size of the so-called Graveyard. Those buildings looked so much smaller when there was a whole city between you and them. Standing on the cracked concrete, staring across the ash-wastes at their sheer scale, you were struck with awe.</p> <p>Ah, well, nothing better to do than start walking.</p> <p>The vast road you found yourself following must have been what they called a highway. On tapes you'd see them filled with an incredible number of vehicles, all crowded together in orderly lines and moving in time like a herd of cattle. Nowadays, its ash-dusted surface was cracked and empty. There were a few areas where a bridge over another road had crumbled, and you had to take an alternate route- luckily, you weren't unguided on this journey.</p> <p>The road, and the scant few intact buildings along its way, was marked with symbols. Spray painted arrows and Xs in yellows and reds, marking where to go and where not to go. They were leading you somewhere, and as the enormous monuments of The Graveyard began to surround you, it became clear what they were leading you to. A large square full of ancient buildings, surrounded with scrap and wire fences, armoured to the teeth. An enormous symbol of a old gas-powered streetlamp was emblazoned on the wall of a brick construction in yellow spray paint. The Lamplighters.</p><h1><<link "The Trek Home">><<popup "Graveyard Leave Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Graveyard Leave Description">><</if>> <ul>\ <li> [[Home sweet home.|Red Light District]]</li> </ul>\<p>It was time to leave the Graveyard, that dead place full of crawling things and violence, behind. Time to head back to the city, arguably just as dead and full of crawling things and violence. More beautiful, though.</p> <p>Having already made this journey out, it was easy enough to follow the path back. Easy, and relatively quick. Soon enough, you'd passed back through the checkpoint and were surrounded again by the loving embrace of the city.</p><h1><<link "Lamplighter HQ">><<popup "Lamplighter HQ Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("Lamplighter HQ Hub")>><<include "Lamplighter HQ Description">><<set $visited.push("Lamplighter HQ Hub")>><<else>><<include "Lamplighter HQ Description Short">><</if>><</if>> <ul>\ <li> [[Go up to KC's office.|KCs Office]]</li> <<if $playedleads.includes("lamplighters")>>\ <li> [[Head over to the market.|Lamplighter Market]]</li> <li> [[Enter the lounge.|Lamplighter Lounge]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Head back to the city.|Graveyard Leave]]</li> </ul>\<p>Inside the walls, it was clearer what this place was- a campus of interconnected buildings, much more squat things than the massive towers that laid further into The Graveyard, but making up for it in floor space. Built of large grey bricks and big glass windows that gleamed in the sunlight. All together they circled around the center, what was once a small park full of walking paths and a large central fountain.</p> <p>The fountain remained, standing proud above the ash, free of any water that would have once spilled over its tall upper platform. In its stead, folks were still using it as a gathering place- a couple guys in eclectic outfits and studded jackets were sitting around its base smoking cigarettes, with one perched on the basin above, swinging his legs idly.</p> <p>Off to the East you could see a lounge of some sort full of folks coming and going with food and drink. They were all laughing and chatting. Further towards the North, there was a little market, half housed in a building and half formed out of stalls outside. All sorts of goods, from innocuous clothing and scrap to armour and medical supplies, were displayed in various stalls.</p> <p>Several of the other buildings had no indication of what they were on the outside. You knew for sure that one of them, near the West, was some kind of administrative building where KC's office was.</p> <<if $playedleads.includes("lamplighters")>>\ <p>Standing in this little protected courtyard, nobody gave you much mind. You could go pretty much wherever your little heart desired.</p> <<else>>\ <p>All of that was very interesting, but Arjun specifically told you to go straight to KC's office. You should probably do that. You could always swing by these places on your way out.</p> <</if>>\<p>The campus of The Graveyard was laid out before you, protected within the confines of its built up scrap walls and fences. Grey brick buildings with gleaming windows filled the space, circling around the central fountain. To the North, the market, its little stalls populated with eclectic goodies. Over to the East, big open doors welcomed you into the lounge. And to the West, the administrative building where KC's office was located. Tough looking folks in spikes and leather roamed the campus, and you could hear boisterous chatter from them as they passed you.</p><<if $leads.includes("testrun")>>\ <p>You headed back up to the fifth floor, down that hall, to KC's office. The door was slightly ajar, welcoming you inside whenever you were ready to get going.</p> * [[Head inside.|Test Run]] <<elseif not $playedleads.includes("lamplighters")>>\ <p>You entered the building that Arjun had pointed out, up to the fifth floor, down the hall. Sure enough, winded as you were from all that walking, you reached your destination. A door labelled as KC's office. Now you knew that it was for sure spelled letter K, letter C (wonder what that stood for). Time to introduce yourself to her and pray that she liked you.</p> * [[Here goes nothing.|KC Intro]] <<else>>\ <p>A knock on KC's door was met with silence. Maybe you could come back later.</p> * [[You should probably go back downstairs.|Lamplighter HQ Hub]] <</if>>\<h1><<link "The Market">><<popup "Lamplighter Market Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("Lamplighter Market")>><<include "Lamplighter Market Description">><<set $visited.push("Lamplighter Market")>><<else>><<include "Lamplighter Market Description Short">><</if>><</if>> <ul>\ <li> [[Approach the clothing seller.|Ricky]]</li> <li> [[Approach the armoury.|Lamplighter Armoury]]</li> <li> [[Leave the market.|Lamplighter HQ Hub]]</li> </ul>\<p>This market was far from the kind of place you'd see in the city- and a lot closer to the kind of thing you'd see back home. Vendors smoked and lounged in chairs behind their stalls. They were filled to he brim with eclectic goods that spilled out into the walking space in the form of racks and mannequins, forcing you to weave between obstructions and other shoppers. You could smell something cooking, beef with spices, somewhere in this tiny maze.</p> <p>There were a few stalls in particular that caught your eye. One, a clothing store selling the same style of worn and spike-encrusted garments everybody here seemed to be wearing. It all looked second hand, recovered and restyled to be resold. Nearby, a much more impressive sight- a larger stall made of scrap metal and cinderblocks, shelves stocked with ammo, body armour, and fancy looking pistols. On a rack behind the shopkeeper, there were some seriously heavy duty weapons- for one, a semi-auto rifle, not too dissimilar to the kind that made the hole in your side. And above it, a red and black chainsaw in pristine condition.</p><p>The market was a bustling maze of stalls decorated with eclectic goods. You noted two shops that were particularly interesting- a clothing store selling various punk attire, and a big scrap metal and cinderblock stall covered in weapons, ammo, and body armour.</p><h1><<link "Ricky">><<popup "Ricky Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Ricky Description">><</if>> <ul>\ <li> [[Talk to Ricky.|Ricky Chat]]</li> <li> [[Buy some clothes.|Ricky Store]]</li> <li> [[Leave.|Lamplighter Market]]</li> </ul>\ <<if not $met.includes("ricky")>>\ <<set $met.push("ricky")>>\ <</if>>\<p>As soon as you got close enough to the stall to alert the owner, who had been relaxing against a metal pole in the back. He was a lanky guy dressed in the same kind of studded and ripped fare he was selling, the most impressive piece being a jacket entirely covered in an assortment of patches. His hair was this big teased mass of black, and he had a prominent, slightly crooked nose. He sprung up from his resting place and bounced over to the front, leaning up against the counter with his hands splayed out. "Hey, man! <<if not $met.includes("ricky")>>The name's Ricky! Nice you meet ya!<<else>>Good to see ya again!<</if>>" His voice was squeaky, fitting for his bone-skinny frame. "See anything you like?"</p><h1><<link "Armoury">><<popup "Lamplighter Armoury Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Lamplighter Armoury Description">><</if>> <ul>\ <<if not Flag("LamplighterMember") and not $met.includes("truck")>>\ <li> [[Warily ask him about the wares.|Truck][$temp = "wary"]]</li> <li> [[Confidently ask him about the weapons.|Truck][$temp = "confident"]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Slink away.|Lamplighter Market]]</li> </ul>\<<if not Flag("LamplighterMember")>>\ <p>Approaching the armoury, you were shocked by the sheer amount of //stuff// here, and barely guarded. Not that all of the people here didn't look like they could blow your brains out if you did something wrong. It was just... odd. Where you were from, none of this stuff would be out on display. And in the city, lord knows a store like this would have everything behind lock and key.</p> <p>There were guns of all description (and other weapons too- knives, axes, even bows and arrows), body armour like you'd never seen before hanging casually off wire hangers. These people were armed to the teeth. And this was just the stuff that they //weren't using//.</p> <p>The only thing as impressive as this array of weaponry was the store's operator himself. He was built like a truck, all muscles under some of the gnarliest looking body armour you'd ever seen. His jaw... jesus. And he was covered in an array of tattoos too, from a set of crossed swords under his eye to full sleeves and a painted ribcage over his chest.</p> <<else>>\ Add an alt description here if the player is a Lamplighter later. <</if>>\<h1><<link "Lounge">><<popup "Lamplighter Lounge Description">><</link>></h1> <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("Lamplighter Lounge")>><<include "Lamplighter Lounge Description">><<set $visited.push("Lamplighter Lounge")>><<else>><<include "Lamplighter Lounge Description Short">><</if>><</if>> <ul>\ <li> [[Head back outside.|Lamplighter HQ Hub]]</li> </ul>\ <<set $visited.push("Lamplighter Lounge")>><p>As you got closer to the building on the East, it became clearer what you were approaching- a lounge of sorts, where a whole lot of folks were hanging out. It was a big open space punctuated by thick columns- maybe a lobby for some kind of office in the old world. There was a makeshift kitchen off to the left, but most of the room was dominated by round tables surrounded by chairs and big circles of couches. In the back corner, there was even a television with a few different game consoles sittng out around it.</p> <p>This lounge wasn't exactly full to bursting, but there were quite a few folks around, all clad in leather and spikes and patches and armour. There was a group sitting around a table playing blackjack, and a few people sitting around in the couches having an animated conversation. Neither group seemed particularly interested in you. But you managed to catch sight of Arjun, who was evidently off guard duty now- he was sitting by the TV with his legs kicked up on a coffee table, drinking a beer (or soda?) from a glass bottle. He probably didn't want you to talk to him.</p><p>You stepped inside the big open hall of the lounge, propped up by massive columns and populated by folks in leather and spikes drinking and conversing loudly. Arjun was sitting on a couch in the corner, though you had a feeling he wouldn't want to chat with you.</p><h1><<link "The Heights">><<popup "The Heights Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("The Heights")>><<include "The Heights Description">><<set $visited.push("The Heights")>><<else>><<include "The Heights Description Short">><</if>><</if>> <ul>\ <<if $leads.includes("waveform")>>\ <li> [[Look for Waveform.|Waveform]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Enter the electronics store.|Pace]]</li> <li> [[Enter Darling's Boutique.|Darlings]]</li> <li> [[Approach the radio station.|Radio Station Base]]</li> <<if $leads.includes("hotdate")>>\ <li> [[Restaurant]]</li> <</if>>\ <<if not $radiolist.includes("Ad 2")>>\ <li> [[Enter L'Apothecaire.|L'Apothecaire]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Head down the stairs to The Stacks.|The Stacks]]</li> <li> [[Head down the stairs to the Red Light District.|Red Light District]]</li> </ul>\<p>The Heights looked nothing like the rest of the city. For one, it was elevated above everything else, up on top of the hill. But it was different in another way. While you could identify each neighborhood by the way the buildings all rose at the same time in the same style, The Heights was marked by diversity. There were tall, lavish buildings made of reclaimed masonry, quaint little brick storefronts, things made of wood panelling selected for aesthetics rather than practicality. It all looked sleek, stylish, and reflected the light on big panes of glass as the sun moved in the sky.</p> <p>The centerpiece of this whole area was a massive concrete pillar, cracked and ancient, predating everything here. An enormous metal radio tower emerged from its top, piercing the smog-filled sky, held in place by thick wires that anchored to the ground elsewhere in the city. The roads curved to wrap around it, shoppers bunching up like congregants. The plain grey surface of the building's massive square base was covered with paint- not graffiti, but a kind of mural. A stylized drawing of the city, with the radio tower standing proud above it all, a bright sun behind it casting rays down on the wasteland.</p> <p>In this central square (or circle), there were a few places in particular that caught your eye. A modern-looking stucco building, lacking windows but making up for it with massive open front doors, labelled "PACE" in big blue lettering. Inside, you could see an assortment of devices and electronic thingies. Just next to that one was a larger place decorated with red-toned wood panelling and white molded filigree, with big fancy windows that revealed stylish mannequins posed inside. The sign spelled out "Darling's Boutique" in flowy cursive.<<if not $radiolist.includes("Ad 2")>> On the other side of the street, you noticed that place they mentioned on the radio- "L'Apothecaire." Fancy name, and a fancy looking apothecary to match.<</if>></p> <p>From here, you could trace the main roads back to get down to either the more utilitarian grid of The Stacks or the shady streets of the Red Light District.</p><p>High up on the hill, The Heights was nothing like the rest of the city. In the main square, all the buildings were different- fancy wood panelling, reclaimed masonry, sleek glass. All of them centered around a massive concrete pillar that held up the city's eponymous radio tower. Its base was painted with a stylized mural of the city. Around it, a couple storefronts caught your eye- the simple modern construction and open doors of an electronics store. The fancy filigrees of Darling's Boutique.<<if not $radiolist.includes("Ad 2")>> And that place they mentioned on the radio- "L'Apothecaire."<</if>> All were sleek and beautiful, like they'd never been touched by ash.</p><h1><<link "PACE">><<popup "Pace Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Pace Description">><</if>> * [[Browse a little.|Pace Store]] * [[Head out.|The Heights]]<p>The inside of this store was even more incredible than the outside- rows upon rows of whats-its and doo-dads, a whole shelf of batteries and rechargers, and big televisions on the back wall all showing the same film. This place must have used up so much electricity.</p> <p>This was clearly a different //type// of store from many of the ones you'd encountered. Rather than a single shopkeeper, there were several folks in blue uniform shirts roaming the floor, chatting with customers or fiddling with the tech on display. And a security guard up front. Just in case you decided to grab something and run, you supposed.</p> <p>//Currently, the only function of the walkman and record player are to "use" tapes and records by redirecting to an external site. They will get mechanical uses in the future, but are currently lacking them. Any kind of music can be donated to the radio station or sacrificed at a Devotee's altar. Apart from those uses, this store is mostly in place for future proofing.//</p><<if $leads.includes("dressupgames")>>\ <<goto "Dress Up Games">>\ <<else>>\ <h1><<link "Darling's Boutique">><<popup "Darlings Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("Darlings")>><<include "Darlings Description">><<set $visited.push("Darlings")>><<else>><<include "Darlings Description Short">><</if>><</if>> * [[Buy something.|Darlings Store]] * [[Leave the boutique.|The Heights]] <<if not $met.includes("darling")>>\ <<set $met.push("darling")>>\ <</if>>\ <</if>>\<p>When the door opened, the sweet chime of a bell rang out throughout the little room. The inside of this boutique was exactly as lavish as the outside. Columns, crown moulding, beautiful paintings in elaborate frames hung on the walls. Nowhere you'd been since you got to the city could compare<<if $met.includes("cherry")>>- well, except the Rose<</if>>. But it didn't look much like a clothing store. There was clothing, sure, clothing on mannequins and fancy hats and shoes and jewelry on shelves around the room. But no racks of shirts on hangers, y'know?</p> <p>The bell must have alerted the shop's owner, who poked her head out from a back door. "Oh, hello, dear!" She had a million long braids that flowed over her shoulder and a bright smile across her face. As she stepped out, you could see she was dressed just as lavishly as her establishment would imply- loose, flowing pants in a light fabric with a large bow on the waistband, and a light linen blouse with gold detailing tucked in at the waist. She was tall, too, and wearing heels that made her look even taller.</p> <p>"I'm Darling," she introduced herself, flashing you a smile. "Just let me know what you're looking for, and I can help you out. We offer //some// ready-made clothing, but we primarily do custom work."</p><p>The inside of this boutique was exactly as lavish as the outside. Columns, crown moulding, beautiful paintings in elaborate frames hung on the walls. Nowhere you'd been since you got to the city could compare<<if $met.includes("cherry")>>- well, except the Rose<</if>>. But rather than clothing on hangers and racks, there were just a few lavish dresses and hats displayed on mannequins. Darling, the proprietor, was hanging around to see if you had a request.</p><h1><<link "L'Apothecaire">><<popup "L'Apothecaire Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("L'Apothecaire")>><<include "L'Apothecaire Description">><<set $visited.push("L'Apothecaire")>><<else>><<include "L'Apothecaire Description Short">><</if>><</if>> <<if $wealth lte 4>>\ * [[Ah, well. Maybe when you earn more cash.|The Heights]] <<else>>\ * [[Maybe if you were really desperate...|The Heights]] <</if>>\<p>This was far from the kind of apothecary that Doc ran, and much more similar to the type you were used to- yet somehow more //fancy// than any of those places. Drugs were arranged on tall, elaborate shelves in glass bottles like you were used to, but everything was ordered, perfectly aligned, decorated with elaborate labels. These were not medicines, they were //products//.</p> <p>But behind the counter was where the real goodies were kept. Over the druggist's head, up on the high shelves- cigarettes, laudanum, cordials of liquor and cocaine. And //marijuana//. It was somewhat uncommon up North, with lack of electricity and poor outdoor growing conditions, but here it must have been plentiful given the sheer amount they had on the shelf. Oils? They made oils out of it? Wild.</p> <p>The other notable thing about this place was the prices. They were all listed on the shelves, and lord were they ludicrous. <<if $wealth lte 4>>There was no way you could afford any of this stuff. Maybe a pack of their cheapest cigarettes.<<else>>Even if you could afford this stuff, the idea of actually paying this much made your head hurt.<</if>></p>The apothecary was as fantastic as ever, shelves laden with perfect glass bottles full of tinctures, powders, and remedies of all sorts. And on the high shelf over the druggist's head- cigarettes, laudanum, cordials of liquor and cocaine. And marijuana. But the prices... <<if $wealth lte 4>>There was no way you could afford any of this stuff. Maybe a pack of their cheapest cigarettes.<<else>>Even if you could afford this stuff, the idea of actually paying this much made your head hurt.<</if>></p><h1><<link "Radio Station">><<popup "Radio Station Base Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Radio Station Base Description">><</if>> <ul>\ <<if not $radiolist.includes("Personal Shoutout")>>\ <<if $wealth gte 1>>\ <li> <<link "Make a monetary donation for a shoutout. (1 <i class='fa-solid fa-coins'></i>)">><<set $donation = "monetary">><<goto "Radio Donation">><</link>></li> <</if>>\ <li> <<link "Donate music for a shoutout.">><<set $donation = "music">><<goto "Radio Donation">><</link>></li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Head out.|The Heights]]</li>\ </ul>\<p>Walking round the base of the radio tower, you finally found the entrance- a brick building butting up against one of its smooth concrete sides, clearly a later addition, but open to the public at least. Pulling open the big front door and stepping inside, you found yourself inside a room that was just as brutalist and plain as the outside. A door on the far wall, evidently locked, was labelled with a symbol of stairs going up and down.</p> <p>To the left of this nearly empty room, however, there were two little metal doors built into the plaster wall around chest-height. A little mental geometry, and you could deduce that this room was only part of the building- there was another room back there. Grabbing a handle near the top of one of the doors, and sure enough, with a little force it opened downwards to reveal a chute on the other side. Sort of like the door on a mailbox.</p> <p>A sign between them described their purpose- "This station runs on YOUR donations! Any donations of cash (left) or records/CDs/cassettes (right) are greatly appreciated. Include your name and/or a message with a large donation to have it read out on the air."</p><p>The inside of the little brick building at the base of the tower was mostly bare. Apart from the (locked) door to head upstairs, there was a table with two little metal doors over top. "This station runs on YOUR donations! Any donations of cash (left) or records/CDs/cassettes (right) are greatly appreciated. Include your name and/or a message with a large donation to have it read out on the air."</p><<if $donation == "monetary">>\ <p>You pick up an envelope from a table sitting under the chutes and stuff some cash you've acrewed in there, scrawling your name on the front with a ballpoint pen and licking the envelope to seal it. Opening up the door, you slid it down the cash chute, where it fell out of view in the other room. You could expect to hear your name over the radio soon.</p> <<spendwealth 1>>\ <<set $radiolist.push("Personal Shoutout")>>\ <ul><li> [[Exciting!|Radio Station Base]]</li></ul> <<set $radiodonations += 1>>\ <<else>>\ <p>You grab a piece of paper from a table sitting under the chutes and scrawl down your name with a ballpoint pen. Now, what to donate...</p> <<for _item, _amount range $music.table>>\ <<capture _item>>\ <ul><li style="text-transform: uppercase">\ _item\ <span style="float: right">\ <<link "DONATE">>\ <<set $radiolist.push("Personal Shoutout")>>\ <<goto "Radio Station Base">>\ <<drop $music _item 1>>\ <</link>>\ </span></li></ul>\ <</capture>>\ <</for>>\ <ul><li> [[Nevermind.|Radio Station Base]]</li></ul> <<set $radiodonations += 1>>\ <</if>>\ <<unset $donation>>\<h1><<link "The Stacks">><<popup "The Stacks Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("The Stacks")>><<include "The Stacks Description">><<set $visited.push("The Stacks")>><<else>><<include "The Stacks Description Short">><</if>><</if>> <ul>\ <<if $leads.includes("trackingnumber")>>\ <li> [[Look for the building on the map.|Tracking Number]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Enter The Juice Bar.|Charge Bar]]</li> <li> [[Enter the bookstore.|Bookstore Intro]]</li> <li> [[Enter the Trading Company.|Trading Co]]</li> <li> [[Head down to Skid Row.|Skid Row]]</li> <li> [[Head up to The Heights.|The Heights]]</li> <li> [[Head to the Red Light District.|Red Light District]]</li> </ul>\<p>Entering The Stacks, the source of the name was evident. Beyond the main street, the orderly cobble formed a network around clusters of massive brutalist structures, brick and concrete titans with few windows and fewer interesting features. Their smokestacks rose above the city like silent vigils, spewing particles into the already ash-clogged sky. You could see them over every rooftop.</p> <p>But here on the main drag, there were no factories. Instead there were quaint, brick-and-mortar storefronts all butting up next to each other. Big windows showed the inside of each little shop, grocers and butchers and clothing shops. Just glancing down the row, you saw almost a dozen wards made of brightly coloured glass beads hanging over the doorways. A tradition up North, meant to cleanse those who entered of malicious energy. This sort of accoutrement was virtually absent elsewhere in the city- interesting.</p> <p>A few shops in particular caught your eye. There was a bustling bar on a street corner, its name plastered on a sign above it labelling it "The Juice Bar." Weird title for a bar, but it seemed popular enough. Further down the street, a fancy old-fashioned font advertised "The Signal Hill Trading Company," a big ol' store that looked like it sold everything under the sun. And just next door, another thing caught your eye- one of the thinner buildings, its front window was blacked out, covered by something on the inside. It was simply marked by a painting of an open book on the door. A beaded ward hung from the overhang.</p> <p>From here, you could head down a set of steps that snaked off into Skid Row. To the West, a steep brick staircase at the end of a major street led up into The Heights. And if you followed the main road South far enough, you'd wind up in The Red Light District.</p><p>The smokestacks of brutalist concrete and brick factories rose over you as you entered The Stacks. They were further into the district, but ever present, looming over the area. Here on the main drag, instead of factories, there were brick-and-mortar storefronts all butting up next to each other. Beaded wards hung over many of the doorways. One such doorway was a thin brick bookshop, with the windows covered on the inside. Next to it, a much larger store, The Signal Hill Trading Company. On a corner just down the street, a building advertising itself as "The Juice Bar" was buzzing with activity.</p><<if $leads.includes("crossroads")>>\ <<goto "Crossroads">>\ <</if>>\ <h1><<link "The Juice Bar">><<popup "Charge Bar Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<if not $visited.includes("Charge Bar")>><<include "Charge Bar Description">><<set $visited.push("Charge Bar")>><<else>><<include "Charge Bar Description Short">><</if>><</if>> <<if $leads.includes("shotgunromance")>>\ <p>Sure enough, Reese hadn't been leading you on- there he was, sitting in a booth over on the left, nursing a glass of whiskey on the rocks and a cigarette.</p> <</if>>\ <ul>\ <li> [[Approach the bar.|Charge Bar Sit]]</li> <li> [[Listen to the radio.|Radio]]</li> <<if $leads.includes("shotgunromance")>>\ <li> [[Approach Reese.|Shotgun Romance]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Leave the bar.|The Stacks]]</li> </ul>\<p>The bar was a breath of fresh air (proverbially- literally, it smelled like a thousand cigarettes alight in a bonfire). The streets of Signal Hill were unfamiliar and strange, but this was the same bar you'd entered every Friday for the last five years. There was local colour, of course, different folks and different decor, but every bar was the same at its core. You could feel at home here.</p> <p>The local colour here, though, was a little stranger than most of the places you've been in your travels. The same arrangement of small tables with rickety old chairs surrounding a central long bar, the same sort of people here drowning their sorrows after a long day in the factories. But behind the bartender, where you'd normally expect a proud array of different liquors, was a confusing mass of wires. Extension cables and power cords hung like Christmas lights from the ceiling, connecting to yet more cords and cables. Docks for everything from cell phones to MP3 players, large battery charging stations filled with individual AAAs and AAs, plugs hanging unused from the shelves. The various green, red, and blue LEDs created an abstract light show in the back, barely illuminating the coils of wires.</p> <p>There were few patrons here- a few down-on-their-luck looking folks were drinking over a bowl of crisps, and a guy was slumped over near the end of the bar, seemingly out cold. Must have been pretty damn drunk to stay asleep with the radio right next to him, filling his ears with static and guitar.</p><p>This bar was familiar- the same sort of place that every small town and big city had on every street corner. Except for the bar itself. Set up behind the bartender, where you would expect to see an array of alcohols on offer, there was instead a confusing mass of wires and blinking LEDs. Scattered throughout the room, a few down-on-their-luck folks were drinking and chatting over the tinny sound of the radio.</p><p>You sidled up to the bar, taking a seat on one of the metal barstools. Its three legs were an unequal length, teetering back and forth between two solid positions. It was just tall enough that your feet couldn't reach the ground.</p> <p>The man standing behind the bar was tall and broad, with a beard worthy of an old timey lumberjack and the flannel to back it up. A pair of much too small spectacles was balanced on the bridge of his bulbous nose. He was wiping down a scuffed old glass mug with a rag that couldn't have been that much cleaner. As you approached, he gave you a silent nod. Acknowledging your presence, but not too much. Just a little.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[Order a drink.|Bar Order]]</li> <<if $pocket.has("Empty Battery")>>\ <li> [[Charge your batteries.|Battery Charging]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Chat with the bartender.|Bartender]]</li> <li> [[Stand up.|Charge Bar]]</li> </ul>\<h1><<link "Bookstore">><<popup "Bookstore Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Bookstore Description">><</if>> <ul>\ <<if $met.includes("bookseller")>>\ <li> [[Head back to the bookseller's office.|Bookstore Office]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Inspect the books.|Bookstore Books]]</li> <li> [[Explore the “maze.”|Bookstore Maze]]</li> <li> [[Step out.|The Stacks]]</li> </ul>\<p>A tiny golden bell hanging over the doorway heralded your entrance to the bookstore. Stepping in from the smog-choked streets of The Stacks, you were overwhelmed by the earthy smell of hundreds of ancient texts. They lined the walls of the cramped bookstore, dozens of reclaimed wood shelves stretching seven feet to the ceiling. A window was sacrificed for the sake of more space, an extra bookcase shoved unceremoniously next to the door to cover it. Without sunlight, the whole place was only illuminated by bare bulbs hanging on wires from the rafters. From the doorway you could barely see five feet ahead of you, the tomes laid out in an almost maze-like structure.</p><p>You took a moment to brush your fingers across the spines of the books, feeling worn leather and laminated paperboard from ages in the past. There was a large leatherbound volume that looked like it was falling to pieces, cheap fake gilded letters peeling off is surface where the hide had disintegrated away from the cardboard interior. Next to it, an old magazine, bright pinks and blues shining around the face of grinning teenage boys who were probably long dead by now. It promised a quiz within to determine which boy would want to date you. And beyond that, a hand-bound journal. Cream ribbon kept its covers together, and fake plastic flowers peeked out between the exposed edges of the paper.</p> * [[Nothing particularly interesting.|Bookstore Intro]]<p>You peeked around one of the shelves, revealing another short hallway that curved off into the distance. Down that hallway, another one, and another. The books seemed mildly related, with the occasional label on the shelf that seemed to contradict the genres around it- a whole shelf labeled “Biographies,” featuring everything from religious texts to books about long-forgotten wars. Another labelled “Fantasy,” mostly populated by what appeared to be cheap erotica. There was no apparent throughline, only rough connections. Like a mind map.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[Delve even deeper.|Bookstore Depths]]</li> <<if not $rolled.includes("bookstoresignal")>>\ <li> <<link 'Try to figure it all out. <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-dice-three"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-tower-broadcast"></i>'>><<signalroll 6 "Bookstore Signal Success" "Bookstore Signal Failure">><</link>></li> <</if>>\ </ul>\<p>There was some kind of pattern there, you were sure of it. Words jumped out at you from the spines. There was something about the waves in here, something intentional.</p> <p>Try as you might, though, it wasn't coming together. The pieces all hovered in your mind, burrowing in your brain, modulating that buzzing, but none of it made sense. The picture was warped and strange, lines skipping and stretching.</p> * [[It was starting to hurt your head.|Bookstore Maze]] <<set $rolled.push("bookstoresignal")>>\<p>There was some kind of pattern there, you were sure of it. Words jumped out at you from the spines. There was something about the waves in here, something intentional.</p> <p>You stepped back, leaning up against a shelf, feeling the leather spines press into your shoulder blades. You couldn't quite get far enough to take it all in in one glance, but this was close enough. A golden plaque nailed into the second highest shelf labelled these as “Mystery” books, though the titles ranged everywhere from cookbooks to autobiographies. Dotted throughout, manuals on the operation of early computers. Maybe 80s or 90s. You weren't great with history.</p> <p>Despite the strange array of topics, something clicked as you stared at them. That buzzing in your ear, it was almost quiet. All in order. Like the information in front of you, the vibrations of all of these tomes, balanced itself out. One to one, negative to positive. Whoever arranged these knew what you know. They could feel this, for sure.</p> * [[The labels were probably outdated. This was a much better organization system.|Bookstore Maze]] <<set $rolled.push("bookstoresignal")>>\<p>Conceivably, this place was just the size of an average storefront. You could maybe imagine it all fitting in the same dimensions. But inside, that's not what it felt like. It felt big. Like wandering the empty halls of a grand catacomb, buried deep inside the earth where tunnels could expand for miles around you.</p> <p>Eventually, the cramped halls of books opened up into a larger space- still lined with books, but at least six feet wide, so that was new. An ancient particleboard desk sat in the center. On it, a cream-coloured thing like a TV screen and a keyboard of sorts, all connected up with tangled wires to a panel behind one of the bookshelves. The whole area was dark, apart from a cool glow being emitted from that TV screen. It illuminated the face of an older woman, face marked by decades of wear and graying hair pulled up into a soft bun. She looked up at you, and her eyes looked exactly like your grandmother's.</p> <p>"Oh, hello, dear. If you need any help finding anything, please just let me know."</p> <ul>\ <li> [[Talk to the bookseller.|Bookseller]]</li> <li> [[Walk back out through the maze.|Bookstore Intro]]</li> </ul>\ <<if not $met.includes("bookseller")>>\ <<set $met.push("bookseller")>>\ <</if>>\<h1><<link "Bookstore">><<popup "Bookstore Office Description">><</link>></h1>\ <<if settings.descriptions == true>><<include "Bookstore Office Description">><</if>> <ul>\ <li> [[Talk to the bookseller.|Bookseller]]</li> <li> [[Buy some books.|Bookstore]]</li> <li> [[Walk back out through the maze.|Bookstore Intro]]</li> </ul>\<p>Eventually, the cramped halls of books opened up into a larger space- still lined with books, but at least six feet wide, so that was new. An ancient particleboard desk sat in the center. On it, a cream-coloured thing like a TV screen and a keyboard of sorts, all connected up with tangled wires to a panel behind one of the bookshelves. The whole area was dark, apart from a cool glow being emitted from that TV screen. It illuminated the face of an older woman, face marked by decades of wear and graying hair pulled up into a soft bun. She looked up at you, and her eyes looked exactly like your grandmother's.</p> <p>"Oh, hello, dear. If you need any help finding anything, please just let me know."</p><<liveblock>> <h1><span style="float: left"><<link "<">><<goto "Bookstore Office">><</link>></span> ZINES</h1> <hr> <<for _item, _amount range $collectibles.table>> <<if Item.get(_item).tags.includes("zine")>> <<if not $bookstorezines.includes(_item)>> <<capture _item>> <ul><li style="text-transform: uppercase"> <<link _item>> <<dialog "" "item-description">> <<print Item.get(_item).description>> <</dialog>> <</link>> <span style="float: right"> <<link "GIVE">> <<pickup $bookstorezines _item 1>> <<set $zinesdonated += 1>> <<update>> <</link>> </span> </li></ul> <</capture>> <</if>> <</if>> <</for>> <</liveblock>><p>Entering the Trading Company, you were struck by the sheer number of products on display. It was overwhelming. Dried foods, liquors, medicines, all sorts of clothing, tools and tackle, votive candles and decorations. It was a vast space, but seemed tiny compared to the massive amount of //stuff// contained within. Each shelf was piled high with new things, most of which was of very little use to you, but it all looked so //interesting//.</p> <ul>\ <li> [[Buy something.|Trading Co Store]]</li> <<if $leads.includes("altarcomponents")>>\ <li> [[Check out the candles.|Trading Co Candles]]</li> <</if>>\ <li> [[Get out of here.|The Stacks]]</li> </ul>\<p>You wandered through the store towards a familiar looking sight- lines of candles, roughly the same size and shape, all in different wax colours. Some could surely be passed off as regular candles, but you weren't fooled. You were a devotee yourself. You recognized devotional tools when you saw them.</p> <p>Sure enough, as you glanced through them, you spotted printed images on the sides of several- artwork or photographs of saints, their faces recognizable even in wax. Scanning through them, you were disappointed to see no images of the Lady. Not even Her traditional colour, that pale blue. Tragic.</p> * [[You'd have to find one somewhere else.|Trading Co]]<p>Signal Hill is a text based narrative RPG inspired by modern tabletop games. That means it's rules-light and narrative heavy.</p> <p>There are still a few rules you'll need to know to have a smooth experience in the city, though. Click the topics above, and press the question mark in the top right if you need a reminder while you play.</p><p>Leads are hints that'll tell you where to find cool shit to do. Through walking around and talking to folks you'll find new leads that'll be added to your list.</p> <p>You can find your leads in the menu on the left. Sometimes, having a lead is the only way to start a certain story. Other times, it might just push you in the right direction.</p><p>Whenever you do something difficult, you'll have to roll for it to find out if you succeed or fail. Every roll in the game is 2d6, plus the value of one of your skills. These are your skills:</p> * ''<i class='fa-solid fa-brain'></i> SAVVY.'' Resourcefulness and practicality. * ''<i class='fa-solid fa-hand-fist'></i> BRAWN.'' Intimidation, strength, and power. * ''<i class='fa-solid fa-heart'></i> GLAM.'' Presence, aesthetics, and charisma. * ''<i class='fa-solid fa-tower-broadcast'></i> SIGNAL.'' Attunement and intuition. <p>When you roll, the skill will be indicated by the skill's symbol at the end of the link. If you want to guage how difficult the roll is gonna be, the combined total of the dice shown next to the skill will be the target you need to hit.</p> * This is what a roll looks like. <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-three'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-dice-three'></i> <i class='fa-solid fa-hand-fist'></i> <p>In addition, sometimes you'll get an extra bonus to a roll (or have it lowered) when you're under the influence of drugs or some circumstance makes it easier or harder.</p><p>When you get into an altercation, the outcome is going to depend on what weapon you're using. When you start out, you can choose one of six weapons, each with their own stats.</p> <p>To get new weapons, you'll first have to unlock another weapon slot using XP, which you can do from the Upgrades tab in the ID menu. You can then purchase another basic weapon from a store. There are also specialty weapons you can unlock through gameplay. You can switch between weapons in the Gear menu.</p> <p>These are the stats on your weapons:</p> * ''<i class="fa-solid fa-crosshairs"></i> PRECISION.'' How easily you can aim at targets. * ''<i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i> SPEED.'' How quickly you can shoot, reload, or swing the weapon. * ''<i class="fa-solid fa-burst"></i> POWER.'' How much damage the weapon does on a single hit. * ''<i class="fa-solid fa-coins"></i> VALUE.'' The wealth the player needs to have to buy the weapon.<p>Throughout the game, various choices and routes will give you the option to adopt new identities. Identities are a part of you, and they each offer unique benefits and drawbacks, as well as unique options during gameplay.</p> <p>You can check which identities you have in the ID page under the Identity tab.</p><p>Wealth is a measure of how rich you are. Signal Hill isn't concerned with individual currency- only whether you're rich enough to afford things. Just like in real life, rich people don't need to sweat the small stuff, but if you're low on cash you're going to struggle for every purchase.</p> <p>Your Wealth is ranked from 0 to 5. <div class="wealth-table">\ <table> <tr> <th>0</th> <td>Impoverished. You can't afford anything. Good luck finding a place to stay.</td> </tr> <tr> <th>1</th> <td>Bad off. Most of your money is going toward housing, anything else might bankrupt you.</td> </tr> <tr> <th>2</th> <td>Doing okay. You can buy small stuff without going hungry, but be careful.</td> </tr> <tr> <th>3</th> <td>Moderately wealthy. Buy what you want, but don't be stupid. You're not that rich.</td> </tr> <tr> <th>4</th> <td>Well off. You can afford some outlandish shit if you feel like it. Go wild. Have fun.</td> </tr> <tr> <th>5</th> <td>Rich get richer. Get into any club, hire anybody, buy whatever you want.</td> </tr> </table>\ </div>\ <p>Any item you buy will have a Value that tells you who can afford it. If the Value is below your Wealth rank, it's a minor purchase, and won't affect your Wealth. If it's the same as your rank, it's a major purchase- you can still buy it, but your Wealth will decrease by 1.</p> <p>Getting more Wealth works a little differently. Payouts can either be big or small. A big payout will immediately get you to the next wealth level. Small payouts will add up over time- once you've gotten as many small payouts as your Wealth rank, your Wealth will increase by 1.</p><p>If you want to improve your skills or unlock new weapons, you'll need to spend XP. You can get XP from following leads to their completion, even if you don't get the result you hoped for. Even if you stumble into a story without the lead active, don't worry- you'll still earn XP for it.</p> <p>You can spend XP to upgrade your skills, to a max of 3 each. If you'd rather wait, you can spend 10XP to unlock a new weapon slot. All of this can be done in the ID menu, under the Upgrades tab.</p><p>On desktop, you can access the menus by hovering over the tapes on the left side of the screen and access this tutorial by pressing the question mark at the top right of the screen. On mobile, press the + in the bottom left to access the menus or the ? at the bottom right to access this tutorial.</p> <p>If you're on desktop, you can play Signal Hill entirely with your keyboard. In addition to regular browser navigation, you can press a number from 1 to 9 to select the corresponding option. To roll the dice when they are on screen, press the space bar.</p> <p>You can also navigate to the menus using your keyboard. Hit the L key to view your Leads, the I key to view your ID, the G key to view your Gear, the S key to open the Saves menu, and the C key to open the Config menu.</p>
